Cookiemadness ID step
Cookiemadness ID step
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Bake a 9 inch pie crust using directions on the box or your usual method for baking a scratch pie crust.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 In a 3 quart saucepan, combine the sugar, cornstarch and salt. Gradually add the milk, then add the chocolate chips and egg yolks.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Put the saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring constantly, until chips melt and mixture is smooth. Continue stirring for another minute or two or until big bubbles break the surface and mixture is about as thick as pudding.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Remove from heat and stir in cream cheese until fully melted. Transfer mixture to a clean bowl and cover with a sheet of plastic wrap. Let cool slightly, then refrigerate until just barely cool. Check every hour.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 In a large bowl, beat 1 1/2 cups of whipping cream until soft peaks form. Beat in the vanilla. Reserve 1 heaping cup of the whipped cream for topping, then fold the rest (which should be about 2 cups) into the chocolate mixture.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Sweeten the reserved whipping cream with a little powdered sugar if desired, then spread or pipe over the pie. Chill the pie for at least 5 hours. Garnish top with sprinkles or chocolate shavings.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Bake a 9 inch pie crust using directions on the box or your usual method for baking a scratch pie crust.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 In a 3 quart saucepan, combine the sugar, cornstarch and salt. Gradually add the milk, then add the chocolate chips and egg yolks.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Put the saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring constantly, until chips melt and mixture is smooth. Continue stirring for another minute or two or until big bubbles break the surface and mixture is about as thick as pudding.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Remove from heat and stir in cream cheese until fully melted. Transfer mixture to a clean bowl and cover with a sheet of plastic wrap. Let cool slightly, then refrigerate until just barely cool. Check every hour.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 In a large bowl, beat 1 1/2 cups of whipping cream until soft peaks form. Beat in the vanilla. Reserve 1 heaping cup of the whipped cream for topping, then fold the rest (which should be about 2 cups) into the chocolate mixture.
1d9278b4-67b4-435c-a39f-434741294149 Sweeten the reserved whipping cream with a little powdered sugar if desired, then spread or pipe over the pie. Chill the pie for at least 5 hours. Garnish top with sprinkles or chocolate shavings.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 In a large bowl, combine the butter and sugars. Using a wooden spoon, cream the mixture until light and fluffy, for about 3 minutes.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Lightly beat the egg and vanilla together in a small bowl or custard cup. Add to the butter mixture a little at a time, stirring until well combined. If you are using large eggs, don't blend the vanilla with the egg. Add the vanilla straight to the batter and only use 42 to 45 grams of the egg mixture.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Mix together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt until very well combined and there are no lumps. If necessary, sift. Add to the butter mixture and stir to make a soft dough. Stir in all the chips (or chunks)
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Using an ice cream scoop or cookie scoop or spoon, divide the mixture into 16 balls. Subway cookies weigh 1.6 oz, so you may want to weigh. Roll into balls and place onto the lined baking trays, spaced at least 2 1/2 inches apart.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Bake for 10-12 minutes until well spread and just set on the surface. The cookies will still be quite soft, but will firm up as they cool. Leave on the tray for 5 minutes, then carefully transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Store cookies in an airtight container for up to 7 days.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Preheat the oven to 175°C (or 350 degrees F). Line 2 large baking trays with baking parchment.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 In a large bowl, combine the butter and sugars. Using a wooden spoon, cream the mixture until light and fluffy, for about 3 minutes.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Lightly beat the egg and vanilla together in a small bowl or custard cup. Add to the butter mixture a little at a time, stirring until well combined. If you are using large eggs, don't blend the vanilla with the egg. Add the vanilla straight to the batter and only use 42 to 45 grams of the egg mixture.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Mix together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt until very well combined and there are no lumps. If necessary, sift. Add to the butter mixture and stir to make a soft dough. Stir in all the chips (or chunks)
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Using an ice cream scoop or cookie scoop or spoon, divide the mixture into 16 balls. Subway cookies weigh 1.6 oz, so you may want to weigh. Roll into balls and place onto the lined baking trays, spaced at least 2 1/2 inches apart.
301a6cdb-c3e5-4547-8a32-60f77f5fa705 Bake for 10-12 minutes until well spread and just set on the surface. The cookies will still be quite soft, but will firm up as they cool. Leave on the tray for 5 minutes, then carefully transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely. Store cookies in an airtight container for up to 7 days.
e05368d8-42be-4ff3-9f98-84cac665a498 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
e05368d8-42be-4ff3-9f98-84cac665a498 In a mixing bowl, beat the softened butter and both sugars until creamy. Beat in the egg and egg white, then beat in the vanilla extract, baking soda and salt. Stir in the almond flour until it is well blended, then stir in the chocolate and nuts.
e05368d8-42be-4ff3-9f98-84cac665a498 Using a medium cookie scoop or a tablespoon, drop rounds onto a parchment lined baking sheet and bake for about 12 to 15 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned.
e05368d8-42be-4ff3-9f98-84cac665a498 Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for about 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 Grease an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 or a 9x5 inch pan with shortening and line with a strip of parchment paper if desired.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 In the bowl of a stand mixer, mix together 1 3/4 cup of the flour, the sugar, salt, shortening and yeast. Add the water and beat with the paddle attachment until well blended, then add remaining flour about 3/4 cup of a time until you have a dough that is just slightly sticky but no longer clings to the side of the pan when mixed.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 Attach dough hook and let the machine knead for about 8 minutes, adding a little extra flour if kneaded.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 Cover bowl and let rise for 45 minutes or until about doubled in bullk.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 On a pastry mat or large clean surface (use extra flour if your dough is sticky), roll or just pat the dough into a rectangle that is 9x18. Starting with the 9 inch side, roll into a cylinder, pinching down dough as you roll.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 Squash the dough a bit into a 9 inch log and plop it into the pan. Cover with grease plastic wrap and let rise for another hour.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 Bake at 425 degrees F. for about 30 minutes.
ac91e9d1-c10a-41ba-a640-bdf42d4a2059 Let cool, then carefully remove from pan and let cool completely before slicing.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Find 2 baking sheets that you can fit in your freezer and line them with foil or parchment.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt; set aside.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 With an electric mixer (hand held is fine), beat the butter on medium until creamy. Add both sugars and beat on medium until light and fluffy, scraping bowl.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Add the egg, vanilla and 2 tablespoons water, and mix on low to combine.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Add the flour mixture, and mix with a spoon until combined. Stir in the chocolate.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Scoop the dough up with a 1/3 cup measure and form about 10 balls that weigh in at about 100 grams. Place 4 balls an equal distance apart on a prepared pan that can fit in your freezer. Freeze the pan with the cookie dough on it for 15 minutes.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Place the chilled baking sheet in the oven and bake 10 minutes, until the cookies are puffed slightly in the center. Lift the baking sheet and let it drop down against the oven rack, so the edges of the cookies set and the inside falls back down. Bake for another 2 minutes, then repeat -- lifting and dropping (banging). Repeat again banging at 2 minute intervals until you've baked the cookies for 16 or 17 minutes. This may vary depending on your oven. Do not overbake! The cookies are much better when slightly underbaked. Also, remember to put the second pan with dough in the freezer while the first batch is baking.
f6ab37d3-d213-49cc-97b2-00d8f8957506 Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet until they are firm enough to transfer, then let cool completely on a wire rack. I like to continue cooling in the refrigerator to set the chocolate (or leave gooey if you prefer).
517a10f0-f7ac-42f4-844f-b16be34ae504 Let cool in the pan for a few minutes, then carefully loosen sides by sliding a knife between the loaf and the pan.
517a10f0-f7ac-42f4-844f-b16be34ae504 Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease bottom only of an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch loaf pan. If desired, line vertically with a strip of parchment paper to make a sling.
517a10f0-f7ac-42f4-844f-b16be34ae504 In a large mixing bowl, mix together the self rising flour and the sugar. Add the eggs, buttermilk and vanilla and stir until well blended, then stir in the oil.
517a10f0-f7ac-42f4-844f-b16be34ae504 Lastly, mash the bananas and stir them into the batter along with the nuts.
517a10f0-f7ac-42f4-844f-b16be34ae504 Spread batter evenly in the baking pan and bake for 60-65 minutes.
517a10f0-f7ac-42f4-844f-b16be34ae504 Let cool in the pan for a few minutes, then carefully loosen sides by sliding a knife between the loaf and the pan.
517a10f0-f7ac-42f4-844f-b16be34ae504 Let cool until bread feels sturdy enough to lift from pan, then remove from pan and set on a rack to cool completely.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea Arrange large balls of dough on prepared cookie sheets, about 3 inches apart.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea Use the palm of your hand to flatten into 4-inch rounds. Bake until golden brown, rotating cookie sheets halfway through, about 16 minutes. If your cookies are still pale after 16 minutes, keep baking! If the dough is very cold it will take longer. Let cookies cool on pan 2 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line cookie sheets (I used 2) with parchment paper.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea Place butter and sugars in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat on medium speed until pale and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Reduce speed to low. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until combined. Mix in vanilla.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, salt, baking soda, and baking powder.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea With mixer on low, gradually add to butter mixture, beating until well combined. Add oats, coconut, apricots, dark chocolate, cherries, and pecans; mix on low until just combined.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea Arrange large balls of dough on prepared cookie sheets, about 3 inches apart.
3edb88f8-e9bd-41f2-8716-ff5c58a1a7ea Use the palm of your hand to flatten into 4-inch rounds. Bake until golden brown, rotating cookie sheets halfway through, about 16 minutes. If your cookies are still pale after 16 minutes, keep baking! If the dough is very cold it will take longer. Let cookies cool on pan 2 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
75aa5956-d1cc-44d8-bf7f-605fb9951b51 Preheat oven to 350°. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
75aa5956-d1cc-44d8-bf7f-605fb9951b51 Beat cake mix, mayonnaise, water, and eggs until mixed, then beat with an electric mixer for 4 minutes.
75aa5956-d1cc-44d8-bf7f-605fb9951b51 Bake 25-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centers comes out clean.
75aa5956-d1cc-44d8-bf7f-605fb9951b51 Let cool on a wire rack 10 minutes. Remove cakes from pans and cool completely.
75aa5956-d1cc-44d8-bf7f-605fb9951b51 Frost the cake with canned Betty Crocker chocolate frosting.
ee75a748-7c89-4c88-b850-3f886fe01f43 Preheat oven to 350 degrees and have ready an ungreased or Silpat lined baking sheet.
ee75a748-7c89-4c88-b850-3f886fe01f43 With an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar for about 5 minutes, scraping bowl often, until very light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and scrape sides of bowl again.
ee75a748-7c89-4c88-b850-3f886fe01f43 Gradually stir in flour, ½ cup at a time, until a smooth dough forms.
ee75a748-7c89-4c88-b850-3f886fe01f43 Using a generously rounded tablespoon, scoop up dough and shape into 24 balls. At this point you can bake the dough or chill it until ready to bake.
ee75a748-7c89-4c88-b850-3f886fe01f43 Arrange the dough balls on baking sheets spacing about 2 ½ inches apart. Dampen fingers and press index, middle and ring fingers into each dough ball to make indentations and flatten.
ee75a748-7c89-4c88-b850-3f886fe01f43 Bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Carefully transfer to a cooling rack and let cool completely.
ba489fc1-dae2-4867-af97-d400dc105772 Prepare crust: In a mixing bowl, mix together the flour and salt. Add shortening and butter and cut with a pastry cutter or mix with your fingers until crumbly. Add ice water a couple of tablespoons at a time and stir with a heavy duty scraper, pushing all ingredients together, to form a ball. Press into a disc, wrap in plastic (or put in a freezer bag) and chill for an hour.
ba489fc1-dae2-4867-af97-d400dc105772 Prepare crust: In a mixing bowl, mix together the flour and salt. Add shortening and butter and cut with a pastry cutter or mix with your fingers until crumbly. Add ice water a couple of tablespoons at a time and stir with a heavy duty scraper, pushing all ingredients together, to form a ball. Press into a disc, wrap in plastic (or put in a freezer bag) and chill for an hour.
ba489fc1-dae2-4867-af97-d400dc105772 On a floured surface, roll the dough into a 10 inch circle, drape it over a 6 inch pie plate, trim, fold and crimp the edges. Freeze lined dish for 20 minutes. Cover inside with greased foil, weigh down with pie weights, set on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes at 375. Note: You’ll probably have leftover pie crust.
ba489fc1-dae2-4867-af97-d400dc105772 Filling: Whisk together filling ingredients and pour into the warm pie shell. Reduce heat to 350 and bake for about 35 to 45 minutes or until it appears set and puffy. The middle should still look slightly underdone, but not liquid-y. Let stand 30 minutes before serving. This is important. The quiche settles and becomes a bit smoother as it cools. It’s so tempting to cut right into it when you take it out of the oven, but let it stand.
9e414555-e463-4c45-ad1b-f3802204ed2b Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Spray a 9-inch (23 cm) square or round baking pan with non-stick cooking spray or line about 20 to 22 cupcake cups with paper liners. I used square cupcake cups and pushed round liners into them so the cupcakes would bake as squares.
9e414555-e463-4c45-ad1b-f3802204ed2b Mix pancake mix, brown sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, chopped nuts and butter for topping in a medium bowl until combined. Set aside.
9e414555-e463-4c45-ad1b-f3802204ed2b Combine pancake mix, sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Add sour cream, oil and egg. Blend just until dry ingredients are moistened. Spread half the batter into prepared pan, sprinkle with half the topping mixture. Spread with remaining batter and sprinkle with remaining topping. If making as cupcakes, just divide the batter evenly between the muffin cups and spoon topping.
9e414555-e463-4c45-ad1b-f3802204ed2b Bake 30 to 35 minutes for a full cake or about 20 minutes for cupcakes. Cakes are done when a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve garnished with powdered sugar, if desired.
1b7810cc-43a3-48e7-89e4-938e97839c99 Melt 1 1/3 cups of the dark chocolate chips (8 oz) in a microwave-safe bowl at 50% power, stirring every 30 seconds until fully melted. Stir the cocoa powder and espresso powder into the melted chocolate and let cool slightly. Alternatively, you may do this step in a saucepan.
1b7810cc-43a3-48e7-89e4-938e97839c99 Bake one sheet at a time on center rack for 8 to 10 minutes or just until cookies appear set. Let the cookies cool on baking sheets about 5 minutes or until set.
1b7810cc-43a3-48e7-89e4-938e97839c99 Melt 1 1/3 cups of the dark chocolate chips (8 oz) in a microwave-safe bowl at 50% power, stirring every 30 seconds until fully melted. Stir the cocoa powder and espresso powder into the melted chocolate and let cool slightly. Alternatively, you may do this step in a saucepan.
1b7810cc-43a3-48e7-89e4-938e97839c99 In a mixing bowl using an electric mixer, beat the butter, salt (if using) and both sugars until creamy. With mixer on medium, add eggs 1 tablespoon at a time until incorporated, then beat for 1 minute. Beat in vanilla and melted chocolate mixture, scraping sides of bowl often. When chocolate is incorporated, stir in the flour. Make sure the dough is completely cool, then stir in the remaining 2/3 cup chocolate chips. Cover mixture and let sit until thickened.
1b7810cc-43a3-48e7-89e4-938e97839c99 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or Silpats. Using a tablespoon measure, scoop up heaping tablespoons of dough and shape into balls. Arrange about 2 inches apart (6 to a sheet) on baking sheets. Press tops down slightly.
1b7810cc-43a3-48e7-89e4-938e97839c99 Bake one sheet at a time on center rack for 8 to 10 minutes or just until cookies appear set. Let the cookies cool on baking sheets about 5 minutes or until set.
5c76b42e-fb6d-417d-b5ab-f7cdaa81f93e Bake one sheet at a time for 25 minutes (check at 15) or until cookies are evenly browned. Let cool slightly, then remove from baking sheets to finish cooling.
5c76b42e-fb6d-417d-b5ab-f7cdaa81f93e Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.
5c76b42e-fb6d-417d-b5ab-f7cdaa81f93e Beat the butter until creamy using an electric mixer. Beat in both sugars, and vanilla. When creamy, beat in the egg. When egg is mixed in, beat in salt and baking soda. Add flour and stir until it is almost blended in. Add the chocolate chips and stir until all flour disappears.
5c76b42e-fb6d-417d-b5ab-f7cdaa81f93e Line two large baking sheets with regular foil.
5c76b42e-fb6d-417d-b5ab-f7cdaa81f93e Using a 1/4 teaspoon measure, scoop up rounded spoons of dough, each with about 3 chocolate chips (you'll have what appears to be a lot of chips and a tiny bit of dough). Shape into marble size balls and arrange on baking sheets spacing about 1 1/2 inches apart.
5c76b42e-fb6d-417d-b5ab-f7cdaa81f93e Bake one sheet at a time for 25 minutes (check at 15) or until cookies are evenly browned. Let cool slightly, then remove from baking sheets to finish cooling.
6ab748f7-f0c2-4267-807a-bd39e4a58aa8 Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F and place a 5-inch cast iron skillet inside to heat while you make the batter.
6ab748f7-f0c2-4267-807a-bd39e4a58aa8 In a medium size bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda. Whisk in the milk, buttermilk, and egg. Whisk in almost all of the melted butter, reserving about 1/2 tablespoon for the skillet later on.
6ab748f7-f0c2-4267-807a-bd39e4a58aa8 Carefully remove the hot skillet from the oven. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F.
6ab748f7-f0c2-4267-807a-bd39e4a58aa8 Add the reserved butter to the hot skillet. Pour the batter into the skillet (it should sizzle and butter should pool around it) and place it in the center of the oven. Bake until the center is firm and a cake tester or toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 20 minutes. Allow to cool for 10 to 15 minutes and serve.
6ab748f7-f0c2-4267-807a-bd39e4a58aa8 Note: I've never had the cornbread spill over, as it tends to bake around the sides first and rise up. However, if you are worried about it you can put a rimmed baking sheet on the lower rack to catch any drips.
f9596966-aaf2-4ec2-b489-1a7d5048837d Preheat oven to 350° F. and line an 8 inch metal pan with foil; spray foil with cooking spray.
f9596966-aaf2-4ec2-b489-1a7d5048837d Stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
f9596966-aaf2-4ec2-b489-1a7d5048837d In a medium size (3 quart is good) microwave safe mixing bowl, melt butter for 1 minute on high. Stir in sugar and water, then microwave mixture for 30 seconds to help melt sugar. Stir and let stand for about 3 minutes.
f9596966-aaf2-4ec2-b489-1a7d5048837d Add egg and and stir until mixed. Stir in Nesquik, then add flour mixture and stir just until smooth. If the batter is still very warm, allow it to cool a bit (so the chips won't melt when added) then fold in chocolate chips. Rap pan on counter to bring air bubbles to top.
f9596966-aaf2-4ec2-b489-1a7d5048837d Bake for 18 minutes. Let cool completely on a wire rack. Chill for an hour or so, then lift from pan and slice into 12 brownies.
f9596966-aaf2-4ec2-b489-1a7d5048837d Makes 12 brownies
78319c6f-28fb-4715-82d9-cb57007db3be Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. (Note: Other recipes use 300, but I use 350).
78319c6f-28fb-4715-82d9-cb57007db3be Rub a 9 inch glass pie plate (I use a deep dish) generously with butter. Alternatively, have ready a pre-baked pie crust.
78319c6f-28fb-4715-82d9-cb57007db3be In a mixing bowl, beat egg whites and baking powder until soft peaks form. Add cream of tartar, beating constantly. Add 1 cup of sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly until stiff peaks form. Beat in vanilla. Using a rubber scraper, fold in graham crackers and chopped, toasted pecans. Pour mixture into pie plate (or baked pie shell) and bake for 30 minutes.
78319c6f-28fb-4715-82d9-cb57007db3be Let cool completely on a wire rack. The pie will sink a bit as it cools.
78319c6f-28fb-4715-82d9-cb57007db3be Prepare topping. In a chilled bowl, using chilled beaters, beat cream until it begins to thicken. Add sugar and vanilla and continue beating until stiff peaks form. Do not overbeat. Top pie with whipped cream. Garnish with extra pecans if desired.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 In a bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the butter until creamy. Beat in 2/3 cup of the sugar and beat for 1 minute, scraping side of bowl. Stir in the egg and beat for about 30 seconds, scraping side of bowl, then beat in cinnamon and vanilla.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Add the flour mixture and the milk alternately to the batter, stirring until blended.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Spread the chopped rhubarb in the bottom of the baking dish and toss with the remaining 2/3 cup of sugar. Spread the batter over the top of the rhubarb. It may not go all the way to the sides.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Bake the pudding cake for 45 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out with moist crumbs.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Let cool before serving or serve warm.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 In a bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the butter until creamy. Beat in 2/3 cup of the sugar and beat for 1 minute, scraping side of bowl. Stir in the egg and beat for about 30 seconds, scraping side of bowl, then beat in cinnamon and vanilla.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Add the flour mixture and the milk alternately to the batter, stirring until blended.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Spread the chopped rhubarb in the bottom of the baking dish and toss with the remaining 2/3 cup of sugar. Spread the batter over the top of the rhubarb. It may not go all the way to the sides.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Bake the pudding cake for 45 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out with moist crumbs.
220fbc9d-0870-44f8-b31f-f27c27edd016 Let cool before serving or serve warm.
b7b3e58b-aa55-4db3-94d5-b14fc251a225 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 13x9 inch pan with cooking spray. A glass dish works well for this.
b7b3e58b-aa55-4db3-94d5-b14fc251a225 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, mix together cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, water and oil. Beat for 2 minutes. Pour into the pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until cake springs back when touched. Let the cake cool for 15 minutes, then use a drinking straw to poke holes all over it.
b7b3e58b-aa55-4db3-94d5-b14fc251a225 Drizzle the condensed milk over the cake letting it fall into the holes. Cover loosely and let cool. This should take at least an hour or possibly longer if you used the glass dish.
b7b3e58b-aa55-4db3-94d5-b14fc251a225 Prepare the topping. Beat the cream until stiff peaks form.
b7b3e58b-aa55-4db3-94d5-b14fc251a225 In a second bowl, beat together the softened cream cheese and sugar until creamy and smooth. Beat in the milk and vanilla, then fold the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture. Spread over the cooled cake.
b7b3e58b-aa55-4db3-94d5-b14fc251a225 Sprinkle top with cinnamon or cocoa powder if desired.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Have ready 3 greased and floured 9 inch round cake pans.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 Prepare the chocolate cake first. In a mixing bowl, stir together flour through cocoa powder. Add the oil, milk, egg, vanilla and stir until well mixed. Stir in the boiling water or coffee. Beat with an electric mixer for about 30 to 60 seconds or until smooth, then pour into the pan. Bake for about 30 minutes. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then invert onto a rack and let cool completely.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 While chocolate cake bakes, wash out the mixing bowl and beaters and start preparing the other two batters. Try to time it so they’re ready to go in the oven a little after the chocolate cake is ready. You don't want to let the batters sit too long.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 For each of the two batters, measure out the flour, baking powder and salt in separate bowls. Set aside
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 Working with two mixing bowls, put the butter and sugar for each batter in a mixing bowl. With an electric mixer, cream the butter and sugar in each bowl. Add one egg to each bowl and beat until light and fluffy, then add the flavorings. To one bowl, beat in the vanilla. To the other, beat in the strawberry Jell-O, and both extracts.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 With a big spoon or a heavy duty scraper, add the flour and milk alternately, beginning and ending with the flour, to the yellow batter and mix by hand until smooth. Batter will be thick. Repeat procedure with the strawberry batter.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 Put the batter into two cake pans and bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out with moist crumbs. Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then invert and let cool completely.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 To assemble, frost and stack the cakes so that the chocolate is on the bottom, vanilla is in the center and strawberry is on top. Or stack it the way you want. It's not like I'm the queen of everything and you have to follow orders.
f6f13f5b-9dec-429e-ac01-345e4b286f87 Frosting: Beat 3 sticks (12 oz) softened unsalted butter until smooth and creamy. Gradually add 4 ½ cups of powdered sugar. After adding about half of the sugar, add 3 tablespoons of heavy cream and continue beating in remaining sugar. Continue beating and scraping sides of bowl, adding whole milk as needed, until you reach a smooth consistency. For a sweeter frosting, add a little more powdered sugar and milk. Beat in a pinch of salt (or omit if you used salted butter for some reason).
6f9c4455-1545-447d-a214-e01c6ab55ee0 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 3 8 inch round metal pans and line with circles of parchment. The strawberry cake mix is sticky! Dust pans with flour.
6f9c4455-1545-447d-a214-e01c6ab55ee0 Have ready 3 small to medium size mixing bowls. Measure out your cake mix in each bowl. If you have a scale, that's the best way to do it.
6f9c4455-1545-447d-a214-e01c6ab55ee0 Add eggs, oil, and water using 1/3 the amounts called for on the packages. Beat the cake batters as directed with a handheld electric mixer. Pour into the pans and bake for about 22 minutes or until they spring back when touched.
6f9c4455-1545-447d-a214-e01c6ab55ee0 Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn from the pans and let cool completely.
6f9c4455-1545-447d-a214-e01c6ab55ee0 Frosting: In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter until creamy. Gradually add the sugar, beating and scraping the bowl. Add the cream and vanilla and continue beating, then add the milk until you reach a consistency that works for you. Taste and add more sugar if needed.
6f9c4455-1545-447d-a214-e01c6ab55ee0 Ice and stack the cakes with a very thin layer of this frosting, then set the cake on a parchment lined tray and put in the freezer. This step is optional, but frozen cakes are easier to frost.
6f9c4455-1545-447d-a214-e01c6ab55ee0 Once you have your "crumb" layer (thinly frosted cake), spread the vanilla icing all over the cake and decorate.
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease two 4 1/2 inch springform pans with shortening and dust with flour.
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 Sift the flour, salt, and baking powder together and set aside (or just mix them together well).
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 With a handheld electric mixer, beat the butter until creamy. Add the sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Using low speed, add the egg, then increase mixer speed and beat for about a minute, scraping sides of bowl; beat in the vanilla.
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 Fold the dry ingredients into the butter mixture with a heavy duty scraper. A soft dough should form. Scrape the dough into a pastry bag. Pipe a circle of dough over the bottom of each pan, then pipe an outer circle on top of that circle to contain the cream.
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 Put a large scoop of pastry cream in the center, making sure it doesn't touch the walls of the pan. Try to scoop it higher than the outer circle.
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 Carefully pipe remaining batter over the mount of pastry cream. Don't build up the sides, just do the best you can to cover the pastry cream so that it mounds in the center.
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 Brush tops owith a mixture of beaten egg and milk. Set on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for about 45 minutes at 325 until tops are golden brown and cakes appear set. Let cool for about 25 minutes in the pan, then carefully remove the rings and let cool completely.
71d4782f-e025-4f6d-a2e7-1962743bc626 At this point, you can chill the cakes or serve them at room temperature.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two 9x2 inch round cake pans. Alternatively, you may use three.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 In a large mixing bowl, beat sugar and butter at medium speed with an electric mixer until fluffy. Add strawberry extract, vanilla extract, pureed strawberries, and sour cream. Beat until combined.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 Sift together flour, baking powder, soda, and salt. Gradually add to butter mixture, beating until combined.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold into batter.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 Pour batter evenly into prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 Let cool in pans for 10 minutes then turn out onto wire racks. Cool completely.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 To make frosting, beat butter and cream cheese for about 2 minutes. Add powdered sugar 1 cup at a time. Add jam and slowly add pureed strawberries. Taste test it at this point and add a little strawberry extract if you feel like it.
2eda27c1-e663-414c-bbc7-000b47e67fc6 This icing is kind of soft, so I recommend putting the cake in the refrigerator as soon as you've finished frosting it. I stored mine in the refrigerator in a cake carrier. It tasted even better on Day 2.
60444eb3-638c-479b-bf1c-ae4e0f41ce2c Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Spray a 9-inch (23 cm) square or round baking pan with non-stick cooking spray or line about 20 to 22 cupcake cups with paper liners. I used square cupcake cups and pushed round liners into them so the cupcakes would bake as squares.
60444eb3-638c-479b-bf1c-ae4e0f41ce2c Mix pancake mix, brown sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, chopped nuts and butter for topping in a medium bowl until combined. Set aside.
60444eb3-638c-479b-bf1c-ae4e0f41ce2c Combine pancake mix, sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Add sour cream, oil and egg. Blend just until dry ingredients are moistened. Spread half the batter into prepared pan, sprinkle with half the topping mixture. Spread with remaining batter and sprinkle with remaining topping. If making as cupcakes, just divide the batter evenly between the muffin cups and spoon topping.
60444eb3-638c-479b-bf1c-ae4e0f41ce2c Bake 30 to 35 minutes for a full cake or about 20 minutes for cupcakes. Cakes are done when a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve garnished with powdered sugar, if desired.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease bottom only of a 15x10 inch jellyroll pan and line bottom with parchment paper.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Beat eggs in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment for five minutes. Gradually beat in sugar, beating for another 2-3 minutes. While the mixer is going, sift together the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder and salt).
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Reduce mixer speed to medium low and beat in water and vanilla.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Remove bowl from stand and fold in the flour mixture. Batter should be fairly liquid and bubbly.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Pour into the pan and bake for 12-15 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Loosen edges from pan with a knife and let cool in pan for about 10 minutes. Invert onto a flat surface. Peel away parchment paper, then invert again onto a large cooling rack. Cool completely. Freeze for about an hour to make carving easier.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Prepare the whipped cream filling. Beat the cream until stiff peaks just start to form, then beat in confectioners’ sugar and vanilla (don't overbeat). Keep chilled while you carve the cake.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Line the inside of a 9x13 inch pan with plastic wrap leaving a couple of inches of overhang.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d To carve, put the cake on a cutting board. Cut it in half so that you have two 10x7 ½ inch rectangles. Take one of the rectangles and split it into two uneven layers, one very thin and one thick. Repeat with the second rectangle. You should end up with two thin layers and two thick layers total.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Put one of the thin layers of cake in the bottom of the lined pan and spread a thin layer of sundae topping over it. Top it with the second thin layer of cake. Spread a layer of whipped cream over the cake, then arrange strawberry slices evenly over the whipped cream. Spread a little more whipped cream over the strawberries, then lay one of the thick layers of cake over it, cut side up. Spread strawberry topping over that layer of cake, then add a layer of strawberries and whipped cream. Top with remaining thick layer of cake. Cover cake with plastic wrap and chill while you make the topping.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d To make the cream cheese topping, beat the 1/2 cup of heavy whipping cream JUST until stiff peaks form (don’t overbeat). Set aside. In another bowl, beat the cream cheese (or mascarpone), confectioners’ sugar and vanilla until smooth. Fold the lightly whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture. Spread across top of the cake, reserving some of it to pipe rosettes if desired. Run a cake comb or a fork through the top to make stripes.
e8fb49e8-846f-4576-ba4b-13084cdea97d Chill for 4 to 6 hours or until ready to serve. To serve, lift from the pan and cut into squares. Garnish each square with a rosette (or just a blob) of frosting and a strawberry half.
f6c145f2-4393-496a-b07b-6e9bcc8bfab8 Butter the bottom third of a 2 1/2 to 3 quart slow cooker.
f6c145f2-4393-496a-b07b-6e9bcc8bfab8 In a medium size mixing bowl, stir together the flour, granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons of the cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Stir in milk, oil, and vanilla. Spread batter evenly in slow cooker.
f6c145f2-4393-496a-b07b-6e9bcc8bfab8 In the same bowl you used for that mixture, combine the brown sugar and remaining 4 tablespoons cocoa. Stir in hot water until smooth. Pour evenly over batter in slow cooker. Cover and cook on high heat setting for about 2 1/2 hours.
f6c145f2-4393-496a-b07b-6e9bcc8bfab8 When ready to serve, spoon ice cream into bowls, keeping all the ice cream cold as you serve each portion. With a big spoon, scoop up cake and sauce and set next to the ice cream
ea639db6-893b-4cf0-875c-5ae989f920e1 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray two 8 inch round cake pans with baking spray.
ea639db6-893b-4cf0-875c-5ae989f920e1 In bowl of a stand mixer or in a large mixing bowl using an electric mixer, cream butter, sugar and salt until light. Add the vanilla and the eggs beating 30 seconds after each egg is added. Make a paste of food coloring and cocoa and add to the creamed mixture. Add buttermilk and flour alternately, beating at low speed until mixed.
ea639db6-893b-4cf0-875c-5ae989f920e1 In a small cup, combine the soda and the vinegar and let it foam up. Pour the foaming mixture into the batter and stir until it’s mixed in. Immediately pour into the two 8 inch pans and bake for 27-30 minutes.
ea639db6-893b-4cf0-875c-5ae989f920e1 Let cool for 10 minutes in pans set on a rack. Flip from pans and let cool completely. Make icing.
ea639db6-893b-4cf0-875c-5ae989f920e1 Beat the butter and cream cheese until smooth. Beat in vanilla. Add confectioner’s sugar slowly, beating until smooth. For a little tartness, beat in some lemon juice.
c13d79d7-f078-492f-b375-5a2508f7a5e6 Toss berries with sugar, cover and refrigerate for a few hours or until you are ready to make the cakes.
c13d79d7-f078-492f-b375-5a2508f7a5e6 Prepare Biscuits (Makes 6)
c13d79d7-f078-492f-b375-5a2508f7a5e6 Mix the cool melted butter, sour cream, milk and sugar together in a mixing bowl. Add all but 2 tablespoons of the flour and stir just until it’s barely mixed in – if batter seems too sticky, add the rest of the flour. I used all of it and my dough was dry, but the biscuits were still good. Squish mixture with your hands until it comes together, but don’t overwork it. Dump onto a cutting board or flat surface and shape into a plank about 3/4 inch thick. Using the top of a glass or biscuit cutter, cut out biscuits. Place on baking sheet and bake at 400 for about 12-16 minutes or until biscuits seem done. Let cool.
c13d79d7-f078-492f-b375-5a2508f7a5e6 Whipped Cream
c13d79d7-f078-492f-b375-5a2508f7a5e6 In a chilled mixing bowl using chilled beaters, whip the cream until soft peaks form. Beat in the sugar and vanilla and beat until peaks are stiff
c13d79d7-f078-492f-b375-5a2508f7a5e6 Assemble! Slice the biscuit, rub a little whipped cream on the cut side, spoon strawberries over whipped cream, top with more whipped cream and more strawberries or top with the other half of the biscuits. I gave everyone half a biscuit and that was fine. The rest of the biscuits went in the freezer.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour two 9×2 inch round cake pans and set them on a baking sheet.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Sift together the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Beat the butter on medium speed of an electric mixer until soft and creamy. Add the sugar and beat for another 3 minutes. Add the eggs one by one, and then the yolk, beating for 1 minute after each addition. Beat in the vanilla; Reduce the mixer speed to low and add the dry ingredients alternately with the buttermilk; scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed and mix only until the ingredients disappear into the batter.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Divide the batter evenly between the two pans and smooth the tops with a rubber spatula.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Bake for 28 to 30 minutes, rotating the pans at the midway point. When fully baked, the cakes will be golden and springy to the touch and a thin knife inserted into the centers will come out clean. Transfer the cakes to a rack and cool for about 5 minutes, then run a knife around the sides of the cakes, unmold them, and peel off the paper liners. Invert and cool to room temperature right-side up.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 To make the extract, stir the espresso powder and boiling water together in a small cup until blended. Set aside.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 To make the syrup, stir the water and sugar together in a small saucepan and bring just to a boil. Pour the syrup into a small heatproof bowl and stir in 1 tablespoon of the espresso extract and the liqueur or brandy; set aside.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 To make the filling and frosting, put the mascarpone, sugar, vanilla, and liqueur in a large bowl and whisk just until blended and smooth.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Working with the stand mixer with the whisk attachment or with a hand mixer, whip the heavy cream until it holds firm peaks. Switch to a rubber spatula and stir about one quarter of the whipped cream into the mascarpone. Fold in the rest of the whipped cream with a light touch.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 To assemble the cake: If the tops of the cake layers have crowned, use a long serrated knife and a gentle sawing motion to even them. Place one layer right-side up on a cardboard round or a cake plate protected with strips of wax or parchment paper. Using a pastry brush or a small spoon, soak the layer with about one third of the espresso syrup. Smooth some of the mascarpone cream over the layer - user about 1 1/4 cups - and gently press the chopped chocolate into the filling. Put the second cake layer on the counter and soak the top of it with half the remaining espresso syrup, then turn the layer over and position it, soaked side down, over the filling. Soak the top of the cake with the remaining syrup.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 For the frosting, whisk 1 to 1 1/2 tablespoons of the remaining espresso extract into the remaining mascarpone filling. Taste the frosting as you go to decide how much extract you want to add. If the frosting looks as if it might be a little too soft to spread over the cake, press a piece of plastic wrap against its surface and refrigerate it for 15 minutes or so. Refrigerate the cake too.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 With a long metal icing spatula, smooth the frosting around the sides of the cake and over the top. If you want to decorate the cake with chocolate-covered espresso beans, press them into the filling, making concentric circles of beans or just putting some beans in the center of the cake.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Refrigerate the cake for at least 3 hours (or for up to 1 day) before serving - the elements need time to meld.
6c881f27-adba-4659-b3d7-df8d1375fb28 Just before serving, dust the top of the cake with cocoa.
d48f9d5c-9861-4d75-94de-152066f3e6c0 Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray three 9-inch round layer pans with flour-added cooking spray and line bottoms with rounds of parchment paper (the cake is sticky!).
d48f9d5c-9861-4d75-94de-152066f3e6c0 In a large mixing bowl using an electric mixer, beat butter until creamy. Gradually add oil and mix well, then gradually add sugar, beating until very light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
d48f9d5c-9861-4d75-94de-152066f3e6c0 Sift flour, baking soda, salt and gelatin powder. Set aside.
d48f9d5c-9861-4d75-94de-152066f3e6c0 Combine pureed strawberries, milk, vanilla extract and red food coloring.
d48f9d5c-9861-4d75-94de-152066f3e6c0 Reduce speed on mixer to a low setting and stir flour mixture and milk mixture alternately into the batter, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Divide batter evenly among pans and bake 30-35 minutes or until tops spring back if lightly pressed in their centers. Cool layers in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto racks to completely cool before frosting.
d48f9d5c-9861-4d75-94de-152066f3e6c0 Frosting: Beat cream cheese with butter until smooth. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar on a medium speed setting until light and fluffy. Blend in vanilla extract and continue beating until frosting has a satiny appearance. Spread generously between layers and over the sides and top of the cake.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 15x10 inch jelly roll pan and line with wax paper. Grease and flour the wax paper.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Beat eggs and sugar until very light and fluffy. Mix in pumpkin. Stir together flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and pumpkin pie spice, then stir into batter. Pour into lined pan and bake at 375 degrees 12-14 minutes.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a immediately loosen the sides of the cake from the pan. Sprinkle powdered sugar evenly over the cake, then lay a clean dish towel over it. Put a large baking sheet over the towel, then invert the pumpkin cake onto the baking sheet with the towel. Remove wax paper cake. Roll the bread along with the towel into log shape and try not to break it as you curl it. Allow to cool at least 30 minutes.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Filling: Mix together the softened creamed cheese, softened butter and powdered sugar. Beat until light and fluffy, then beat in vanilla.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Unroll cake and towel. After mixing all the ingredients for the filling, spread the filling onto the bread and roll the bread in the same direction. Now cover with wax paper and chill to set for a few hours. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before cutting into slices. It really tastes good after sitting in the refrigerator for a day or so.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 15x10 inch jelly roll pan and line with wax paper. Grease and flour the wax paper.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Beat eggs and sugar until very light and fluffy. Mix in pumpkin. Stir together flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and pumpkin pie spice, then stir into batter. Pour into lined pan and bake at 375 degrees 12-14 minutes.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a immediately loosen the sides of the cake from the pan. Sprinkle powdered sugar evenly over the cake, then lay a clean dish towel over it. Put a large baking sheet over the towel, then invert the pumpkin cake onto the baking sheet with the towel. Remove wax paper cake. Roll the bread along with the towel into log shape and try not to break it as you curl it. Allow to cool at least 30 minutes.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Filling: Mix together the softened creamed cheese, softened butter and powdered sugar. Beat until light and fluffy, then beat in vanilla.
19ce71a1-7def-4c7f-bb1d-f0107d73998a Unroll cake and towel. After mixing all the ingredients for the filling, spread the filling onto the bread and roll the bread in the same direction. Now cover with wax paper and chill to set for a few hours. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before cutting into slices. It really tastes good after sitting in the refrigerator for a day or so.
60e32a4f-1474-4b7d-a33c-6be04ff32917 Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 or 9 1/2 inch deep dish pie plate generously with some butter.
60e32a4f-1474-4b7d-a33c-6be04ff32917 Whisk together pumpkin, evaporated milk, 1 1/2 eggs, sugars, pumpkin pie spice in a medium bowl. Pour into greased pie plate.
60e32a4f-1474-4b7d-a33c-6be04ff32917 Mix together the cake mix and softened butter to make a very soft and crumbly dough. Sprinkle over top of the pumpkin mixture, then sprinkle pecans on top.
60e32a4f-1474-4b7d-a33c-6be04ff32917 Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown.
60e32a4f-1474-4b7d-a33c-6be04ff32917 Let cool to room temperature and then chill until ready to serve. To serve, bring back to room temperature.
60e32a4f-1474-4b7d-a33c-6be04ff32917 Slice and serve with whipped cream or ice cream.
0c79f08c-46bb-42c1-9bda-71e4fbecc424 Rub the slow cooker generously with some of the butter. Place pie filling in the slow cooker. Mix dry cake mix and remaining butter until crumbly, sprinkle over filling. Sprinkle with nuts. Cover and cook on low for 2 - 3 hours. Serve warm in bowls.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Lay a sheet of plastic wrap flat on the counter and carefully empty mixture onto plastic wrap. Bring it together into a ball, then flatten into a disk. Wrap in plastic and chill for several hours or until ready to use. If you have a pastry mat, you can do this on the mat rather than directly onto the plastic.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Put the flour, salt and sugar in food processor bowl and pulse to mix. Alternatively, you can just use a mixing bowl.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Add butter and and shortening and pulse until the mixture is coarse but still has a few pea size pieces of butter or cut with a pastry cutter until coarse.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Add two tablespoons of water at a time, pulsing to incorporate (or just stirring), until the mixture begins to clump together.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Lay a sheet of plastic wrap flat on the counter and carefully empty mixture onto plastic wrap. Bring it together into a ball, then flatten into a disk. Wrap in plastic and chill for several hours or until ready to use. If you have a pastry mat, you can do this on the mat rather than directly onto the plastic.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 When ready to use, roll out crust and line a 9 inch round pie dish. Put the lined pie dish in the freezer for 30 minutes or keep chill for about an hour.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Press a piece of foil or parchment paper over the frozen crust and weigh down with pie weights.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for about 15 minutes. Remove foil and weights and continue baking for another 15 minutes or until golden.
e05c316c-238b-4d53-aac7-9a6c7849fad3 Alternatively, you can use what I call the BraveTart method (from Stella Parks) and use sugar instead of pie weights. Cover the chilled unbaked crust in foil as above, but fill the foil with sugar instead of pie weights. Bake at 350 for about an hour. Let cool slightly, remove the sugar and foil.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Combine the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl or in the bowl of a food processor. Mix or pulse to combine.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Cut the butter into the flour with a pastry cutter or if using a food processor, pulse until mixture is coarse.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Add water 2 tablespoons at a time, mixing or pulsing, until mixture holds together. Do not keep processing until it forms a ball -- you just want dough that is moist enough to hold together when pinched.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Empty dough onto a large pastry mat and pat it into a big rectangle. It should be moist enough to hold together, though it will crumble slightly. Press it into a compact block, then wrap tightly and chill for several hours.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b When ready to use, cut the block in half so you'll have enough for a top and bottom crust. Bring to room temperature. Roll one half on a floured surface into a large circle. Transfer to a 9 1/2 inch pie plate and trim edges. Cover and chill.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b On a large sheet of parchment, roll the second half of the dough into a large square -- about 10x10. Using a pizza cutter, score into 8 to 10 strips. Do not separate, just store.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Set the scored dough square on a tray and keep in the refrigerator until you are ready to make your lattice.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Fill pie with whatever fruit filling you are using.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Drape 4 or 5 strips of dough across the top. Weave remaining pie strips through.
2378dbee-dc25-4052-9e27-e70f6b48ef6b Brush with cream and sprinkle with coarse sugar, then bake as directed.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Measure the flour and put it in a large mixing bowl.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Mix the flour, sugar and salt very well in the bowl. Shred the cold butter over the flour. Toss everything together lightly with a fork to keep the butter bits separate.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Using your fingers, lightly work the mixture into a coarse meal.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Add about 3 tablespoons of water and mix with a spoon or heavy duty scraper. Keep adding water until dough just barely comes together.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Dump the mixture onto a big sheet of plastic wrap and press it all together a little tighter. It shouldn't crumble at this point.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Wrap in plastic wrap and let it rest in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 When ready to roll, set the dough on top of piece of lightly floured parchment paper or plastic wrap, then put another sheet of parchment or plastic wrap over the dough and press it down slightly. If the dough cracks, let it come to room temperature. I find it easier to deal with while cold, though.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Roll into a large (12 inch) circle. Peel away top layer (bag or parchment) and transfer to the pie plate. You can do this by folding the circle into quarter and transferring it with a scraper or you can set the pie plate upside down over the circle and flip, so that the crust goes into the pie plate. This can be messy, so do it over the sink.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Very carefully peel it away. If your crust starts to tear as you peel off the parchment, put it in the freezer for a few minutes and then peel.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 Once parchment is peeled away, crimp the edges of the pie and put the crust covered pie plate back in the refrigerator for about an hour. The point is to keep it cold and relax the gluten so it won't shrink.
cd09cbfc-83f5-4784-86ac-4420770dc501 To blind bake, cover cold pie crust with greased foil or parchment, add pie weights and bake covered at 375 F for 20 minutes. Remove weights and foil and continue baking for another 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
22535e84-8667-4eb5-bf98-5795ca62c5ee Combine flour, salt and sugar in a bowl and put them in the freezer for about 20 minutes. Put food processor bowl and blade in freezer as well.
22535e84-8667-4eb5-bf98-5795ca62c5ee Assemble food processor as usual and dump in the flour mixture. Pulse a few times to mix. Add cold butter and shortening and pulse 10-15 times or until mixture is coarse. Add the vinegar/vanilla mixture and pulse to mix. Add water two tablespoons at a time, pulsing until mixture is moist enough so that when you pinch it together. It should still look pretty dry at this point, but should hold together when pinched.
22535e84-8667-4eb5-bf98-5795ca62c5ee Turn the dough onto a work surface and shape into two portions. It should go from a raggedy mess to two raggedy disks – they should hold together, though. If they don’t, you didn’t add enough water. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill for at least one hour to rest the dough. This is an important step. Don’t skip the resting.
22535e84-8667-4eb5-bf98-5795ca62c5ee When ready to use, sprinkle some flour over a big sheet of nonstick foil or parchment. Set the disk of dough on the foil and let it sit at room temperature for about 15 minutes. Sprinkle top with more flour, then lay another big sheet of nonstick foil or parchment over the dough and roll out from the center to the edge one stroke at a time, going around clockwise, to make about a 13 inch round. Now it’s time to put it in the pie dish. I like to invert the 9 inch pie plate or tin over round and flip, but you can also fold the circle in half, lift it up, then press it into the pie dish. Press pie dough into pan, fold edges inward and crimp.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 In bowl of a food processor, pulse both flours and salt to mix.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 Add the butter (and shortening, if using) chunks to food processor and pulse to cut in butter. Pulse until you have pea-size clumps.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 In a smaller bowl or liquid measuring cup, combine water, egg yolk and vinegar.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 Add the water mixture to the flour mixture and pulse until mixture comes together. I usually end up using all the water mixture plus a little more, but Greg Patent says not to pour it all in at once because you may not need it all.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 Turn mixture into a bowl and form into a scruffy looking ball. Press it into a disc and wrap in plastic wrap. Chill for at least one hour or until ready to use.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 When ready to use, bring the dough ball back to room temperature.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 Roll into a 12 inch circle and use to line a 9 inch pie plate. To help prevent shrinkage, chill the lined pie plate before blind baking.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 I recommend doubling this recipe if you are making a deep dish pie. You'll have dough leftover.
e5b73b96-6417-405c-b88e-4a6a85567614 To blind bake, press into pan as directed. Poke several holes in the dough with a fork and chill the lined bowl for an hour. When ready to bake, cover with parchment paper, put pie weights (or dried beans) in the center to weigh the parchment down. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes, then remove parchment and weights and bake at 325 for another 20 minutes or until pie shell appears set and is slightly browned.
aa905e38-ff67-409f-8c21-73dafb7c743f First, make the Creme: Place milk in a saucepan and heat over low. While keeping an eye on the milk and watching that it doesn't break into a boil, whisk together egg yolks and sugar in a separate bowl. Whisk in flour. Bring milk to simmer. Whisk 1/3 cup of the hot milk into the egg mixture. Slowly whisk egg/milk mixture into saucepan with simmering milk, whisking constantly. Raise heat slightly, whisking constantly, and cook for about 1 minute or until mixture is thick. Pour into a clean bowl. Whisk in vanilla. Set aside to cool while you prepare the filling. If you prefer, you can do this step a day or hours in advance and chill in refrigerator until ready to use.
aa905e38-ff67-409f-8c21-73dafb7c743f Second, make the Almond Filling: Grind toasted almonds in a food processor. In a mixing bowl, beat together sugar and softened butter. Add eggs, one by one. Add rum and vanilla. Stir in almonds.
aa905e38-ff67-409f-8c21-73dafb7c743f Third, make Frangipane. Add half of the pastry cream to the almond mixture. At this point, it might be a bit liquidy. Chill mixture in the refrigerator for an hour or more to firm it up a bit. You may be able to skip this step. Mine needed to chill a bit. There will be leftover pastry creme.
aa905e38-ff67-409f-8c21-73dafb7c743f Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Roll one sheet of puff pastry into a 12 inch circle. Spread the frangiapane on the dough leaving a border of a little over an inch. Roll out the second sheet of puff pastry and form a larger circle. Lay it on top of the frangipane. Press down the edges tightly to seal in the frangiapane. Chill for 30 minutes. (I forgot to chill mine after filling and I think it caused some leakage. Using a pastry brush, brush the entire galette with egg yolk. (I didn't do this very well which is why my galette is streaky looking).
aa905e38-ff67-409f-8c21-73dafb7c743f Bake at 400 degrees F. for 25-30 minutes. Cindy used different baking times, but I suspect most Americans will use Pepperidge Farm puff pastry and that's the temp they gave on the box.
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 Preheat oven to 350º F. Line an 8-inch metal baking pan with nonstick foil..
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 In a microwave-safe bowl, heat the chocolate and butter on high for 30 seconds. Stir and heat again for another 30 seconds. Stir and repeat until melted. Whisk in cocoa powder until smooth; set aside to cool.
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs, sugar, salt and vanilla until combined.
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 Whisk melted chocolate mixture into egg mixture, then add flour and stir just until mixed.
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 Pour almost all of the chocolate mixture into the prepared pan, holding back about 1/3 cup (just eyeball it -- doesn't need to be exact).
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 For peanut butter swirl, combine melted butter, peanut butter, powdered sugar, salt (if using, I left it out) and vanilla in a bowl and stir until smooth.
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 Sprinkle your reserved handful of chocolate chips over the batter, then drop peanut butter mixture over batter and gently spread to cover most of the top. Drop reserved 1/3 cup or so of chocolate batter in small dollops over peanut butter batter and drag a knife gently through for a marbled look.
39abf114-7c4f-424a-8812-012e66f84468 Bake until a toothpick inserted comes out mostly clean, about 38-45 minutes (Internal temperature should top out at 212). Let cool on a wire rack. When cool, lift from pan by grasping foil. If desired, chill brownies before cutting, but serve at room temperature.
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 9x13 inch pan with nonstick foil.
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Melt 1 stick (4 oz) of the butter and chocolate in small saucepan over low heat or in the top of a double boiler; set aside to cool.
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Place remaining (4 oz) stick of butter, sugar and vanilla in mixer bowl.
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Using the the flat blade, beat on mixer speed 2 for about 30 seconds. Scrape side of bowl and increase speed to 6 and beat for 2 minutes. If the butter was still pretty cold, you might want to mix for another 2 minutes.
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Decrease to mixer speed 4 and add eggs, one at a time, beating for 15 seconds after each egg, scraping bowl often.
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Add cooled chocolate mixture and mix on Speed 2 for 30 seconds.
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Stop and scrape bowl, then add salt and flour and stir on a low speed until blended. Stir in nuts, then pour into the pan an bake for 30 minutes (not 45, which is what the book says).
e26a2d97-cef1-46a2-a24f-41178400a62d Let cool completely, then remove from the pan and cut into squares.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 9 inch square metal pan with nonstick foil.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and add the chocolate. Cook and stir over low until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in cocoa powder. Set aside and let cool slightly.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f In a large mixing bowl, mash the banana until smooth. Whisk in the brown sugar, eggs and vanilla.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Add melted chocolate mixture to banana mixture and stir until combined, then stir in the salt and the flour.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Check to make sure mixture is not too warm, then add the chocolate chips.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Pour batter in the pan and spread evenly
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Mix together peanut butter and oil and drop spoonfuls of peanut butter over the batter. Drag a knife through to make a marble pattern.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Bake for 30 minutes or until brownies appear set. While brownies are hot, drop small spoonfuls of peanut butter over the peanut butter marbled areas so they'll appear smooth again.
495504f8-6481-44cd-bb4d-e1b6cf88ee1f Let cool to room temperature, then chill for about 2 hours. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
0e34162b-16a5-4acd-9d8b-05f8bb9c7ce3 Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Line an 8 inch metal pan with nonstick foil.
0e34162b-16a5-4acd-9d8b-05f8bb9c7ce3 Combine the butter and chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl and heat at 50% power, stirring every 40 seconds, until chocolate mixture is melted and smooth. Alternatively, you can do this in a bowl set over water. Add the cocoa powder to the hot chocolate mixture and stir until smooth, then stir in half (3/4 cup) of the sugar.
0e34162b-16a5-4acd-9d8b-05f8bb9c7ce3 Meanwhile, in a second bowl, gently whisk together eggs, remaining ¾ cup sugar, salt and vanilla. Scrape the sugar/egg mixture into the chocolate mixture and stir until blended, then stir in the ½ cup of flour. Stir in the walnuts, then scrape mixture into the pan.
0e34162b-16a5-4acd-9d8b-05f8bb9c7ce3 Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies appear set. If you have a meat thermometer, check to see that they are around 210 to 212 degrees F.
0e34162b-16a5-4acd-9d8b-05f8bb9c7ce3 Let the brownies cool at room temperature, then chill for a while before lifting from pan, cutting and serving.
e6ef29e7-6bf6-4c27-9fc8-15ca81e09524 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 9x13 inch metal baking pan with foil and spray bottom with cooking spray. If halving the recipe, use an 8 inch square pan.
e6ef29e7-6bf6-4c27-9fc8-15ca81e09524 Melt butter in medium saucepan over low heat. Add 2 cups of the sugar (reserve the 2 tablespoons for later) and cocoa; stir to blend. Remove from heat. Stir in eggs and vanilla. Stir together flour, salt and baking soda and add to chocolate mixture.
e6ef29e7-6bf6-4c27-9fc8-15ca81e09524 At this point, make sure the batter is no longer warm so that it won't melt the add-ins. Stir in the peanut butter chips and about 1/2 cup of the mini peanut butter cups and spread evenly in the pan.
e6ef29e7-6bf6-4c27-9fc8-15ca81e09524 Mix only 1/2 cup of the peanut butter with the 2 tablespoons of reserved sugar and drop by tablespoons onto chocolate batter. Gently pull a knife through (just a bit) to marble.
e6ef29e7-6bf6-4c27-9fc8-15ca81e09524 Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until brownie starts to pull from edges of pan and is set. The peanut butter part that's showing should look a little dried out. This is normal.
e6ef29e7-6bf6-4c27-9fc8-15ca81e09524 Set on a wire rack. Immediately, while the brownies are still hot out of the oven, start spooning the remaining peanut butter (you don't have to use all of it) over the areas where the baked peanut butter shows. The point is to cover the baked peanut butter with the fresh peanut butter so that it melts over it and looks smooth. Top should still look very swirled. As you dollop with more peanut butter, sprinkle the remaining chips over the top (feel free to cut some in half) artfully.
e6ef29e7-6bf6-4c27-9fc8-15ca81e09524 Let cool completely, then chill just until chocolate and peanut butter are set. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
b111a11e-046c-422f-a97a-b9171cffab0d Preheat oven to 350 F and line a 9x13 inch pan with nonstick foil or regular foil. If using regular foil, spray with cooking spray. Alternatively use parchment paper.
b111a11e-046c-422f-a97a-b9171cffab0d Beat the butter and brown sugar in a mixing bowl. Beat in salt and egg. Stir in flour and oats. Press mixture into the baking pan and bake for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown around edges.
b111a11e-046c-422f-a97a-b9171cffab0d Meanwhile, combine caramels and half and half cream in a large saucepan and cook over low to medium low heat until caramels are melted. Pour over crust. Sprinkle with chocolate and cashews.
b111a11e-046c-422f-a97a-b9171cffab0d Let cool to room temperature, then transfer to refrigerator to chill (this sets the caramel a bit).
b111a11e-046c-422f-a97a-b9171cffab0d Lift from pan and cut into bars.
d91213d2-efcb-40a5-ad23-9b280a12c5ce Adjust an oven rack to the middle level of the oven and preheat to 350°F. Prepare a 9 by 13-inch baking pan with heavy-duty aluminum foil (Note: The book tells you how to do this if you don't know how). Lightly grease the foil in the pan.
d91213d2-efcb-40a5-ad23-9b280a12c5ce Unwrap the peanut butter cups; set aside.
d91213d2-efcb-40a5-ad23-9b280a12c5ce Cut the butter sticks into 1-inch slices. In a small, heavy saucepan, melt the butter pieces over the lowest setting. While the butter is melting, chop the unsweetened chocolate into 1/4-inch pieces and add to the melted butter along with the bittersweet chocolate chips. Use a small whisk to speed the melting process. When the chocolate is melted and completely smooth, turn off the heat but leave the saucepan on the burner while proceeding with the recipe.
d91213d2-efcb-40a5-ad23-9b280a12c5ce Using a large whisk, lightly beat the eggs in a large mixing bowl. Place the sugars and salt in a separate small mixing bowl, then whisk into the eggs just until incorporated. Briefly whisk the melted chocolate mixture, then gradually whisk into the egg mixture until just combined. Briefly whisk in the vanilla.
d91213d2-efcb-40a5-ad23-9b280a12c5ce Place the flour and baking powder in the small mixing bowl; whisk together to combine. Sift through a medium strainer directly onto the batter; stir in with a silicone spatula until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly with a small offset spatula. Push the peanut butter cups into the batter; do not place any within ½ inch of the pan sides. Use the offset spatula to cover the candy with the batter. Sprinkle the chopped peanuts over the batter, then place the milk chocolate chips evenly on the batter. Bake for 35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Transfer the pan to a cooling rack and let cool at room temperature for at least 15 minutes, then refrigerate the pan for 7 to 8 hours, or overnight. See page xix for instructions on removing and cutting the slab, and for refrigerated storage (up to 3 weeks) and freezing guidelines.
abdc6068-b8af-4f08-874a-a73dc328f1b2 Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line an 8 inch metal baking pan with foil and spray the bottom with cooking spray.
abdc6068-b8af-4f08-874a-a73dc328f1b2 Melt the butter and chocolate in medium saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally. Stir in sugar. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Combine flour, baking powder and salt; add to chocolate mixture, stirring until well blended. Spread batter in prepared pan.
abdc6068-b8af-4f08-874a-a73dc328f1b2 Bake for 20 minutes or until brownie begins to pull away from sides of pan. Remove from oven; sprinkle with toffee bits. Cover tightly with foil. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Remove foil and cut into squares.
66870286-1929-4ca0-ace6-24e3bb60bea7 Prepare the brownie batter as directed on the package, but add 8 to 10 broken chocolate sandwich cookies to the batter. Spread in a nonstick foil lined 9x13 inch pan. Bake for about 28 minutes or whatever the box of your preferred brand of brownie mix says.
66870286-1929-4ca0-ace6-24e3bb60bea7 As soon as the brownies are done, combine room temperature butter, 1 cup of condensed milk, and chocolate chips in a saucepan. Turn heat to medium or medium low (low and slow is the way to go – don’t overheat the mixture) and stir until chocolate is melted and smooth. Stir in the vanilla. Pour over the brownies. If desired, sprinkle toasted pecans over the top. Let cool and set.
66870286-1929-4ca0-ace6-24e3bb60bea7 Lift from the pan and cut into 24 or 32 brownies
fdbcb724-ce4a-4191-9105-5ba9eebd362b Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 12 indentation mini bar/dessert pan with baking spray.
fdbcb724-ce4a-4191-9105-5ba9eebd362b Melt butter in a large saucepan set over medium heat. When melted, remove from heat and add chocolate chips. Stir until melted, then stir in the cocoa powder and sugar. Set aside and let cool to lukewarm.
fdbcb724-ce4a-4191-9105-5ba9eebd362b Stir the flour, baking powder and salt together in a small bowl
fdbcb724-ce4a-4191-9105-5ba9eebd362b When the chocolate/butter mixture has gone from hot to warm, stir in the cold eggs and vanilla.
fdbcb724-ce4a-4191-9105-5ba9eebd362b Add the flour mixture and stir to combine, then stir in the walnuts. Make sure the batter is cool, then add chocolate chips if using. Pour batter into prepared baking pan and bake 16-18 or until brownies appear set. Let cool in the pan for about 15 minutes, then use a knife to carefully dislodge the bars from the pan.
04be116c-f918-4e5e-af37-c6dc4673abbe Prepare one 9x13 inch pan of brownies as directed on the package using oil and eggs as needed, but add 1 teaspoon of fine instant coffee (the kind that comes in little packets) or 1 teaspoon of instant espresso powder to the batter as well as 1 cup dark or semi-sweet chocolate chips. Bake as directed. Alternatively, you can make an 8 inch pan and use half of all the ingredients.
04be116c-f918-4e5e-af37-c6dc4673abbe Let the brownies cool until they are just a tad bit warm, then spread 1 jar of Marshmallow Crème across the top, by dropping it on in small gobs and spreading the gobs until they come together. The small bit of heat from the brownies should melt the marshmallow a little bit.
04be116c-f918-4e5e-af37-c6dc4673abbe Spoon lines of Jif Chocolate Hazelnut Mocha Flavored Spread horizontally or vertically (doesn’t matter) over brownies. Drag a skewer through the lines, first toward you, then away from you, alternating directions to make the whale-tail/leaf pattern.
04be116c-f918-4e5e-af37-c6dc4673abbe Put the brownies in the refrigerator (or cheat and use the freezer) for about 30 minutes or until the top is set just until so that when you cut it, the brownies aren’t gooey.
04be116c-f918-4e5e-af37-c6dc4673abbe Cut into any size squares or bars and keep chilled until ready to serve. The topping should stay in place fairly well.
8368ad42-ffff-4edd-bcc8-f7c3b8ecb165 Preheat oven to 325 F (or use whatever setting your mix states – I used Ghirardelli brand brownie mix and the directions stated 325).
8368ad42-ffff-4edd-bcc8-f7c3b8ecb165 Line a 9 inch square metal pan with foil and spray with flour-added cooking spray (or just use non-stick foil).
8368ad42-ffff-4edd-bcc8-f7c3b8ecb165 Combine first 4 ingredients in a mixing bowl and stir well. Press mixture into a greased 9-inch square pan. Set aside. In the same mixing bowl combine the brownie mix, hot water, oil, and egg; mix with a wooden spoon until blended, then carefully spoon over crumb mixture. Bake at 325 for 40 minutes. Cool completely, then chill briefly. Lift foil from pan and cut into large squares.
d174450b-3e67-46f5-b7ba-fd09270c2d03 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 9 inch square pan with foil and spray foil with cooking spray.
d174450b-3e67-46f5-b7ba-fd09270c2d03 Make the filling first. Beat the cream cheese and both sugars together with a mixer, then reduce speed and beat in the pumpkin, egg, vanilla and pumpkin pie spice. Stir in the flour. Set aside.
d174450b-3e67-46f5-b7ba-fd09270c2d03 In a second bowl, beat the butter, salt and sugar until creamy. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Stir in the melted chocolate chips then stir in the flour. Pour all but about 3/4 cup of the chocolate mixture into the pan.
d174450b-3e67-46f5-b7ba-fd09270c2d03 Spoon the pumpkin mixture evenly over the brownies layer.
d174450b-3e67-46f5-b7ba-fd09270c2d03 Drop reserved brownie batter over pumpkin to give the brownies a splotched, marbled look.
d174450b-3e67-46f5-b7ba-fd09270c2d03 Bake on center rack at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until brownies test done. That is, when a skewer inserted comes out clean. Let cool for about two hours at room temperature and then chill for a few hours or overnight (the longer the chill, the better). Lift from pan and cut into 16 large squares.
fc731b3b-afba-4ea0-bd91-f5323245b6ad Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line 36 mini muffin cups with paper liners. If you are halving the recipe, use 18.
fc731b3b-afba-4ea0-bd91-f5323245b6ad Melt the butter in a large microwave-safe mixing bowl for about a minute or until melted and very hot. Add the chocolate and stir until it melts. If it doesn’t melt, microwave butter and chocolate together for another 30 seconds and stir. Stir the cocoa into the melted chocolate mixture.
fc731b3b-afba-4ea0-bd91-f5323245b6ad In a food processor, puree the chickpeas, agave and salt until smooth. Add the eggs and vanilla and process until smooth. Pour the chickpea mixture into the bowl of melted chocolate and stir until blended. Make sure it’s sufficiently cool, then stir in chocolate chips.
fc731b3b-afba-4ea0-bd91-f5323245b6ad Spoon batter into mini muffin cups dividing equally among the 36. Bake at 325 F for 20 minutes or until brownies appear set and a toothpick inserted comes out with moist crumbs rather than batter. Let cool completely.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 9 inch metal pan with foil and grease foil or line with parchment.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Beat butter and sugar together in a small bowl using an electric mixer. Beat in the honey and vanilla. Add eggs one at a time, beating for 30 seconds after each egg. Beat in the salt.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Combine flour and cocoa. By hand (so as not to overbeat), stir the flour mixture into the batter.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Spread the batter in the pan going all the way to the edges. Bake on center rack for 25 minutes or until brownies test done.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Let cool completely in pan.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Carefully lift brownies from pan and trim ratty edges (make sure to taste test. It’s imperative!). Cut in half two make two 9x 4 inch slabs. Spread Nutella over one slab. Stack second slab on top. Set the brownies back in the pan and chill for about an hour – this makes slicing neater.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f With a large knife, slice the brownie slab into 8 squares.
