e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Set the squares on a cooling rack. Melt the chocolate in a bowl set over but not touching a pan of barely simmering water. With a teaspoon, drizzle the chocolate over the brownie squares. Set the squares on a plate or back in the pan and chill until chocolate is set.
e0881527-7455-4e3c-82de-92ef07712f7f Makes 8 big ones, or you can cut them smaller.
df909957-529b-4c29-ba34-e3e33f6bbab4 Prepare and bake the brownie mix as directed on the package.
df909957-529b-4c29-ba34-e3e33f6bbab4 While brownies bake, mix together the marshmallows, nuts and a little less than a cup of the chocolate chips (you’ll be saving some for the end).
df909957-529b-4c29-ba34-e3e33f6bbab4 About 5 minutes before the brownies are supposed to be done, sprinkle marshmallow mixture over the top. Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes or until marshmallows puff up.
df909957-529b-4c29-ba34-e3e33f6bbab4 Remove from oven. Sprinkle remaining chocolate chips over top of hot brownies and if you’d like, Sprinkle on some more walnuts so that everything appears balanced.
df909957-529b-4c29-ba34-e3e33f6bbab4 Let cool at room temperature for about an hour. Transfer to the refrigerator for another hour to set the chips.
df909957-529b-4c29-ba34-e3e33f6bbab4 Lift the brownies from the pan and cut into squares.
52f6ab48-e318-4ecc-b841-d489849b9d1e Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and grease a 9x13 inch glass baking dish or line with parchment paper.
52f6ab48-e318-4ecc-b841-d489849b9d1e In a saucepan, melt the butter and chocolate over low heat, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and set aside.
52f6ab48-e318-4ecc-b841-d489849b9d1e Using an electric mixer, beat together the eggs, sugar and vanilla until light and fluffy, 5 to 7 minutes. With the mixer on low speed, beat in the melted chocolate and the salt. Add flour by hand and stir with a heavy duty scraper just until combined. Stir in the nuts
52f6ab48-e318-4ecc-b841-d489849b9d1e Scrape the batter into the dish and bake in the center of the oven until puffed and almost set, about 45 minutes. A toothpick inserted will be slightly moist.
52f6ab48-e318-4ecc-b841-d489849b9d1e Remove and cool slightly before serving.
0ddac536-b124-4159-a569-2eea4ba59d42 Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13-inch glass baking dish. Line the pan with parchment paper.
0ddac536-b124-4159-a569-2eea4ba59d42 Place the chocolate, butter, and instant espresso powder in a large bowl set over simmering water. Stir until the chocolate and butter are completely melted and smooth. Turn off the heat, but keep the bowl over the water and add both sugars. Whisk until completely combined, then remove pan from stove and allow to come to room temperature.
0ddac536-b124-4159-a569-2eea4ba59d42 Gently whisk together 3 of the eggs and gradually whisk them into the cooled chocolate mixture until combined. Add the remaining 2 eggs and whisk until combined. Add the vanilla and stir until combined. Do not overbeat the batter at this stage or the brownies may turn out cakey and lose their shine.
0ddac536-b124-4159-a569-2eea4ba59d42 Sprinkle the flour mixture over the chocolate mixture. Using a rubber spatula (not a whisk), fold the flour mixture into the chocolate until just a bit of the flour mixture is still visible.
0ddac536-b124-4159-a569-2eea4ba59d42 Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake in the center of the oven for 30 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through the baking time, until a toothpick inserted into the center of the brownies comes out with a few moist crumbs sticking to it. Let the brownies cool completely, then lift them out of the pan using the parchment paper. (I recommend chilling for a bit first). Cut into squares and serve.
0ddac536-b124-4159-a569-2eea4ba59d42 Store at room temperature in an airtight container or wrap with plastic wrap for up to 3 days. Personally, I prefer freezing the brownies so they stay fresh longer.
100a9b6a-1f2f-49e2-b1a0-c8220617661d Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9 inch square metal pan with foil and spray foil with cooking spray. Alternatively, use nonstick foil or grease the pan and line with parchment.
100a9b6a-1f2f-49e2-b1a0-c8220617661d Melt butter in a medium saucepan set over medium or medium low heat. When butter is almost completely melted, add chocolate, reduce heat to low and stir until chocolate is melted. Cool mixture slightly, and with a wooden spoon, beat in brown sugar, followed by eggs and vanilla. Scrape sides of bowl and with the wooden spoon, beat in the baking powder and salt, making sure they’re evenly distributed. Add the flour and stir gently until it is mixed in.
100a9b6a-1f2f-49e2-b1a0-c8220617661d Spread batter evenly in pan and bake in middle of oven for about 30 minutes or until a wooden pick comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack.
100a9b6a-1f2f-49e2-b1a0-c8220617661d Make caramel-pecan layer: In a heavy medium size saucepan bring sugar, corn syrup, water, and a pinch salt to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Boil mixture, without stirring, until it turns a golden caramel – mine was golden in 8 minutes. Remove pan from heat and carefully add cream and vanilla (mixture will bubble up and steam). Stir in pecans and quickly pour mixture over brownie layer, spreading evenly. Cool brownies completely in pan on a rack.
100a9b6a-1f2f-49e2-b1a0-c8220617661d Chill brownies, loosely covered, until caramel is firm, at least 4 hours. Lift from pan by grasping parchment (or foil). Cut brownies into 16 squares, then cut each square into 4 squares. Set squares in regular or miniature size cupcake papers and sprinkle sea salt on top before serving. Makes 64
100a9b6a-1f2f-49e2-b1a0-c8220617661d Optional – Melt 1 or 2 ounces of semisweet chocolate in the microwave, transfer it to a heavy duty freezer bag or decorating bag, snip end and pipe over the brownies. You can do this before cutting, though the chocolate will snap a bit, or you can pipe the chocolate on after the brownies are cut – that is, right before you set them in the miniature cupcake cups.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 In the bowl of a stand mixer or with an electric handheld mixer, beat the eggs until light and foamy. Gradually beat in the sugar in 3 parts until mixture is pale and thick, then beat in vanilla.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch metal pan with nonstick foil.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 Melt the butter and chocolate together in the top of a double boiler or melt butter and chocolate together in the microwave stirring every 30 seconds. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 In the bowl of a stand mixer or with an electric handheld mixer, beat the eggs until light and foamy. Gradually beat in the sugar in 3 parts until mixture is pale and thick, then beat in vanilla.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 With a heavy duty scraper, stir the melted chocolate mixture into the eggs.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 Mix together the flour, salt, baking powder and ancho powder and stir into batter until blended. Stir in chocolate chips.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 Pour into pan and bake brownies on center rack for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
51bb956b-acf5-473f-9aa0-6b6a2f61b350 Let brownies cool for several hours, then lift from pan and cut into squares.
a1875700-7cfd-4cd8-87b1-70b7558f63bc Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8 inch square metal pan (I recommend coconut oil) and line with a piece of parchment paper. Grease over the parchment. Melted Snickers are sticky.
a1875700-7cfd-4cd8-87b1-70b7558f63bc Light beat the eggs with a whisk, then stir sugar, melted butter and vanilla in with the eggs.
a1875700-7cfd-4cd8-87b1-70b7558f63bc Combine flour, baking powder, salt and cocoa powder; stir into sugar mixture. Fold in chopped Snickers
a1875700-7cfd-4cd8-87b1-70b7558f63bc Spoon mixture into pan and bake at 350° for about 28 minutes or until the brownies appear set. Remove pan from oven and immediately sprinkle top with chopped milk chocolate bars or miniature bars. Also, scatter on extra chopped Snickers. Set a sheet pan over the brownie pan to lock in some of the heat and help the chocolate melt. Let cool at room temperature until the pan is cool enough not to warm up the refrigerator, then chill thoroughly. When chilled, lift from the pan and cut into squares.
3a236600-bde4-4245-981b-bc8c70a74ced Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a 13x9 inch metal pan with foil and grease foil.
3a236600-bde4-4245-981b-bc8c70a74ced Melt butter and chocolate in a medium saucepan over low heat until smooth. Let cool 15 minutes.Stir in sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt. Stir in mashed potatoes until smooth.
3a236600-bde4-4245-981b-bc8c70a74ced Add flour and stir to combine. Pour into prepared baking pan.
3a236600-bde4-4245-981b-bc8c70a74ced Sprinkle with chocolate chips and nuts. Bake until brownies feel firm when lightly touched, about 25 to 30 minutes (for half batch, bake 22 minutes). Cool on rack. Cut into squares to serve. Store in a container that allows air – airtight containers will be soggy.
f0d7d9d6-dfe3-41ff-a1e3-2fd4a8486143 Preheat the oven to 350º F (180 C). Line a 13x9 inch metal pan with nonstick foil or parchment.
f0d7d9d6-dfe3-41ff-a1e3-2fd4a8486143 Melt the butter, 8 ounces (1 1/3 cup) semi-sweet chocolate chips and the unsweetened chocolate in a bowl over simmering water. Allow to cool slightly. You may also do this in the microwave.
f0d7d9d6-dfe3-41ff-a1e3-2fd4a8486143 Stir (do not beat) eggs, vanilla, and sugar together in a large mixing bowl. Stir the warm chocolate mixture into the egg mixture and let cool to room temperature.
f0d7d9d6-dfe3-41ff-a1e3-2fd4a8486143 Stir the flour, baking powder, salt and espresso powder together in another bowl then add to the cooled chocolate mixture. Stir in the Oreos and remaining chocolate chips.
f0d7d9d6-dfe3-41ff-a1e3-2fd4a8486143 Bake for 20 minutes, then rap the baking sheet against the oven shelf to force the air to escape from between the pan and the brownie dough. Bake for about 10 minutes more, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Do not overbake!
f0d7d9d6-dfe3-41ff-a1e3-2fd4a8486143 Let cool, then chill brownies. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Line a 9x13 inch metal pan with foil, preferably the nonstick type.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 Combine the sugar and butter in a large (3 quart) saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring often, until hot and bubbly.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 Remove from the heat. Add cocoa powder and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt; let cool for 10 minutes. Stir in the vanilla, then add the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 Add the flour and stir until fully blended, the stir in 1 cup of almonds.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 Pour the batter into pan and spread evenly with a spatula.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 Top with the remaining 1/2 cup almonds and the chocolate chips.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 In a medium bowl, combine the coconut, sweetened condensed milk and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Spoon the coconut mixture in dollops over the surface of the batter and bake until the coconut is golden-brown and the brownie layer is just set in the center, about 35 minutes.
45278af1-a947-4f01-bc8f-140cc227c9d8 Let cool completely (chill if you have time) before cutting into 16 bars.
27db19c1-69e6-4269-9f82-053a8ca59526 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 13x9 inch metal pan or line it with parchment or foil. If using foil, spray the foil with cooking spray.
27db19c1-69e6-4269-9f82-053a8ca59526 Melt the butter in a microwave-safe mixing bowl. Whisk in the sugar, then whisk in the cocoa powder, followed by the vanilla extract and eggs. When mixture is smooth, add salt and baking powder and whisk thoroughly, breaking up any lumps in baking powder and taking care that it is thoroughly distributed. Scrape sides of bowl and stir (do not beat) in the flour. Pour into pan and spread to edges. Arrange nuts over top.
27db19c1-69e6-4269-9f82-053a8ca59526 Bake on center rack of oven for 22-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out with moist crumbs. Cool completely and chill before slicing.
27db19c1-69e6-4269-9f82-053a8ca59526 Makes 12 or 16 (depends on how big you cut them)
567d2942-c045-4ae1-ad4e-5464e6827c65 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8x8-inch square baking pan with non-stick foil or parchment
567d2942-c045-4ae1-ad4e-5464e6827c65 Melt the dark chocolate and butter together in microwave or in a bowl set over simmering water.
567d2942-c045-4ae1-ad4e-5464e6827c65 In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs with an electric mixer until frothy. Add the brown sugar and beat until smooth. Add the melted chocolate mixture to the egg-sugar mixture a little at a time and beat well.
567d2942-c045-4ae1-ad4e-5464e6827c65 In a bowl, combine the nut meal, rice flour, salt and baking soda. Add the dry mixture to the chocolate mixture and stir until well mixed. Add the vanilla, beat another half a minute or so. Stir in the chocolate chips. Pour into the lined pan.
567d2942-c045-4ae1-ad4e-5464e6827c65 Bake on center rack for 33 to 35 minutes, or until the brownies are set. Don't overcook.
567d2942-c045-4ae1-ad4e-5464e6827c65 Cool on a wire rack; and remove the brownies from the pan by gripping the foil edges. Chill before cutting.
567d2942-c045-4ae1-ad4e-5464e6827c65 Makes 9-12 servings.
4e7a5dba-b7d3-4c39-9504-d88d6ef52a49 Preheat oven to 350 degree F. Line an 8 inch metal pan with nonstick foil or line with regular foil and spray foil with cooking spray.
4e7a5dba-b7d3-4c39-9504-d88d6ef52a49 Chop the chocolate.
4e7a5dba-b7d3-4c39-9504-d88d6ef52a49 Melt butter in a saucepan set over medium heat. When it's about halfway melted,add the chocolate, reduce heat to low and stir until chocolate is melted. Stir in cocoa powder. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
4e7a5dba-b7d3-4c39-9504-d88d6ef52a49 Whisk eggs, sugar, vanilla and salt together in a mixing bowl. Whisk in the melted chocolate mixture. Add the flour and stir until blended. Pour into pan.
4e7a5dba-b7d3-4c39-9504-d88d6ef52a49 If desired, place 9 walnut halves across the top. This is best for large brownies.
4e7a5dba-b7d3-4c39-9504-d88d6ef52a49 Bake for 35-40 minutes. Let sit on a wire rack until completely cool.
4e7a5dba-b7d3-4c39-9504-d88d6ef52a49 Chill thoroughly before slicing for neater brownies.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square metal pan with parchment or better yet, Release foil.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb Thoroughly stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb In a mixing bowl, beat together butter, peanut butter and both sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Add flour mixture, stir until incorporated, then spread in pan.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb Prepare chocolate swirl. Using microwave or double boiler, melt chocolate and butter. Drop by spoonfuls on top of peanut butter batter and drag a knife through the batter to marble.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb Bake on center rack for 30-35 minutes or until edges appear brown and center appears set. I baked mine for 30 to avoid over-baking. Remove from oven and cool on a rack.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb Meanwhile, prepare topping. Stir together peanut butter, vanilla and melted butter. Spread this mixture over the warm (not piping hot, not cool) brownies. Let cool completely.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb Prepare Chocolate Swirl. Put chocolate in a heavy duty freezer bag. Microwave the bag for 30 seconds. Knead it with your hands to melt chocolate. Repeat, microwaving another 30 seconds and kneading bag, until chocolate is completely melted. Make sure there are no lumps. Snip a tiny hole in bottom corner of bag and drizzle chocolate decoratively over peanut butter.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb At this point, it’s a good idea to chill the brownies to set the peanut butter and chocolate. I actually froze mine for about 20 minutes, then moved them to the refrigerator. The point, again, is to set the topping so you can slice the brownies nicely.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb When set, lift from pan and slice brownies in to squares or bars. If they're too firm to slice, let them sit at room temperature Let come to room temperature before eating. Store covered and at room temperature for softer brownies.
4d6d728c-f7df-4772-954d-c9d626304adb Makes 1 8 inch pan.
9203e68c-7c14-4600-935f-0c729b8e22ca Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square metal pan with non-stick foil or parchment.
9203e68c-7c14-4600-935f-0c729b8e22ca Whisk together eggs, sugar and vanilla. Add melted butter.
9203e68c-7c14-4600-935f-0c729b8e22ca Sift ground chocolate with flour, baking powder and salt and stir into egg mixture. Spread half the batter into prepared pan. Place chocolate covered caramel in single layer on top of batter. Cover with remaining batter. Spread with spoon to cover completely. Bake 20-30 minutes. Let cool. Cut into 9 squares.
9203e68c-7c14-4600-935f-0c729b8e22ca Place the chips in a heavy duty freezer bag (must be a freezer bag!). Microwave on high for 30 seconds. Massage bags to melt chips. Repeat until chips are melted. If your microwave has multiple levels, microwave for 1 minute on 60% power and massage bag at 1 minute intervals. Snip off a tiny bit from the bottom corner of the bag and drizzle over brownies.
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 9 inch square metal pan with foil and spray foil with cooking spray.
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Sift together flour, cocoa powder and salt. Set aside.
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Melt chocolate in top of a double boiler or melt in a metal bowl set over (but not touching) a saucepan of barely simmering water.
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Beat butter and both sugars in a large mixing bowl using high speed of an electric mixer. Beat in vanilla and golden syrup. When creamy, beat in eggs, beating thoroughly after each egg.
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Beat in the melted chocolate, scraping sides of bowl.
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Add flour mixture and chocolate chips, stirring until flour is blended in (do not beat).
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Pour batter into prepared pan and bake on center rack of oven for 35 minute or until brownies appear set. Cool on a rack for 1 hour or until brownies are cool enough to transfer to the refrigerator. Transfer to the refrigerator and chill for 1 or 2 hours.
03c61b88-9ee4-4d36-ac19-ecc90a9b12ef Lift brownies from pan by grasping foil. Place on a cookie sheet and cut into squares.
b76de34c-3df6-467a-9842-af96560e0de4 Line a 9 inch square metal pan with non-stick foil or line with regular foil and grease foil.
b76de34c-3df6-467a-9842-af96560e0de4 Preheat oven at 180°C (350°F). Put the sugar and butter into the bowl of a food mixer and beat for several minutes till white and fluffy. By hand is okay, but it’s important to beat until very light and fluffy. I used a stand mixer and beat for a good 4 minutes.
b76de34c-3df6-467a-9842-af96560e0de4 Meanwhile, break the chocolate into pieces, set (2 oz.) of it aside and melt the rest in a bowl suspended over, but not touching, a pan of simmering water. As soon as the chocolate has melted remove it from the heat. Chop the remaining 50g into gravel-sized pieces. Or, melt your chocolate in the microwave.
b76de34c-3df6-467a-9842-af96560e0de4 In a small bowl, beat the eggs lightly with a fork. Sift together the flour, cocoa and baking powder and mix in a pinch of salt. With the mixer running slowly, add the beaten egg a little at a time, speeding up in between additions. Remove the bowl from the mixer to the work surface, then mix in the melted and the chopped chocolate with a large metal spoon. Lastly, fold in the flour and cocoa, gently and firmly, without knocking any of the air out. Scrape the mixture into the prepared pan, smooth the top and bake for 30 minutes.
b76de34c-3df6-467a-9842-af96560e0de4 After 30 minutes the top will have risen slightly and the brownies should appear softer in the middle than around the edges. Pierce the center of the cake with a fork - it should come out sticky, but not with raw mixture attached to it. If it looks raw, don’t worry because the brownies will solidify as they cool. Mine tested almost raw at 30 minutes. I put them in for another 4 then took them out to cool. They set up perfectly with a light skin and “peat bog” like texture.
b76de34c-3df6-467a-9842-af96560e0de4 So total time for me was 34 minutes.
d2f0d039-8851-4433-bf10-ad6a1e82933b Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. (180 C). Line an 8 inch pan with non-stick foil or parchment paper.
d2f0d039-8851-4433-bf10-ad6a1e82933b Prepare ribbons first. In a microwave safe bowl, combine pb chips, pb and butter. Melt on high 30 seconds. Stir until smooth. Spoon a rectangle (don’t worry too much about size, but try to make it at least 6 inches long) onto a plate lined with wax paper. Chill for 30 minutes or until set.
d2f0d039-8851-4433-bf10-ad6a1e82933b Prepare batter. In a medium-sized microwave-safe bowl, melt the butter on high. When butter is melted, stir in the sugar. Return the mixture to the microwave and heat until mixture is very hot, but not bubbling (1 minute). Stir well to help dissolve some of the sugar.
d2f0d039-8851-4433-bf10-ad6a1e82933b Stir in the cocoa, salt, baking powder and vanilla. Add the eggs, beating till smooth; then add the flour and chips, stirring until combined. Spoon half of the batter into prepared pan.
d2f0d039-8851-4433-bf10-ad6a1e82933b Remove peanut butter ribbon mixture from refrigerator and slice into long, thin strips (width & length will vary). Lay half of the strips over the chocolate batter, then spoon remaining chocolate batter over strips.
d2f0d039-8851-4433-bf10-ad6a1e82933b Bake the brownies for 25-27 minutes, until a cake tester inserted into the center comes out dry. Remove them from the oven and immediately lay remaining strips decoratively over hot brownies -- pressing them gently Let cool completely on a cooling rack, then transfer to refrigerator to chill for a few hours. Lift from pan and slice into squares.
d2f0d039-8851-4433-bf10-ad6a1e82933b Makes 16 or more, depending on how you cut them.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square metal pan with nonstick foil.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Crust: Mix the graham cracker crumbs with the sugar, melted butter and salt (if using). Press into bottom of pan and bake for 6 minutes.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Brownies: Melt the chocolate and butter together in the microwave, a double boiler or heavy saucepan set over low heat. Let cool for about 5 minutes.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Whisk the eggs and sugar and vanilla together in a mixing bowl.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Stir the slightly cooled chocolate mixture into the egg mixture, then stir in the salt and baking powder. Add flour and stir until well blended.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Pour the brownie mixture over the graham crust, then return to oven and bake for 22-26 minutes or until set.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Remove from oven and sprinkle marshmallows over top in one generous layer.
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Adjust oven rack so that brownies are about 6 inches from broiler element, then set brownies under broiler (set on high) for 1 minute or until golden. Keep a close eye, because marshmallows brown quickly!
708d7ee4-641f-40c3-958a-2412455d14b8 Let cool on a rack. When cool, chill. Lift from pan and cut into squares. For a cleaner cut, freeze before slicing.
91f92e62-671b-41fd-8c50-ee9fb7c3d6a2 Preheat oven to 350° F. and line an 8 inch metal pan with foil; spray foil with cooking spray.
91f92e62-671b-41fd-8c50-ee9fb7c3d6a2 Stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
91f92e62-671b-41fd-8c50-ee9fb7c3d6a2 In a medium size (3 quart is good) microwave safe mixing bowl, melt butter for 1 minute on high. Stir in sugar and water, then microwave mixture for 30 seconds to help melt sugar. Stir and let stand for about 3 minutes.
91f92e62-671b-41fd-8c50-ee9fb7c3d6a2 Add egg and and stir until mixed. Stir in Nesquik, then add flour mixture and stir just until smooth. If the batter is still very warm, allow it to cool a bit (so the chips won't melt when added) then fold in chocolate chips. Rap pan on counter to bring air bubbles to top.
91f92e62-671b-41fd-8c50-ee9fb7c3d6a2 Bake for 18 minutes. Let cool completely on a wire rack. Chill for an hour or so, then lift from pan and slice into 12 brownies.
91f92e62-671b-41fd-8c50-ee9fb7c3d6a2 Makes 12 brownies
b161f270-dc20-44e4-a782-c838bebfeb59 Preheat oven to 325º F. Line an 8 inch square metal pan with non-stick foil.
b161f270-dc20-44e4-a782-c838bebfeb59 Set aside 2 tablespoons of the chocolate morsels – you will be melting them and drizzling.
b161f270-dc20-44e4-a782-c838bebfeb59 In a large saucepan, heat 1 cup of the morsels, sugar, butter and water over low heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate and butter are just melted. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly (about 3 minutes). Stir in eggs, one at a time, until mixed in. Stir in liqueur or concentrated orange juice (see my note). Add flour and salt; stir well. Stir in cheese, remaining morsels (except reserved 2 tablespoons) and orange zest. Pour into prepared baking pan. Bang the metal pan on the counter to bring air bubbles to top.
b161f270-dc20-44e4-a782-c838bebfeb59 Bake for 35 minutes until wooden pick inserted in center comes out still slightly sticky. Remove pan from oven and set it in a larger pan (roasting pan). Fill roasting pan with ice water so that it comes halfway up sides of small pan. Allow the brownies to cool to room temp in the ice water bath. When cool, melt remaining 2 tablespoons of chocolate and drizzle decoratively over brownies. Chill thoroughly. Cut into squares.
70263407-4891-4e62-ae8c-efb1c1949e8e Preheat oven 350 degrees. Grease a 12x8 pan (or a 13x9 inch).
70263407-4891-4e62-ae8c-efb1c1949e8e Preheat oven 350 degrees. Grease a 12x8 pan (or a 13x9 inch).
70263407-4891-4e62-ae8c-efb1c1949e8e Combine the butter and both chocolates in a pan, and slowly melt on top of the stove. stirring frequently.
70263407-4891-4e62-ae8c-efb1c1949e8e Separately in a bowl, and using an electric mixer, add the remaining ingredients in the order given. Mix well.
70263407-4891-4e62-ae8c-efb1c1949e8e Pour the melted chocolate into the bowl and stir to combine.
70263407-4891-4e62-ae8c-efb1c1949e8e Pour into the greased dish. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees uncovered. Then reduce heat to 325 degrees, cover with aluminum foil, baking 5-10 more minutes (depending on how hot your oven cooks). You want this gooey, but set. Let cool, and enjoy each delicious, RICH bite !
280d9b7c-57c1-40e0-bca6-cad44d4ff868 Prepare brownie mix according to package directions using oil, water and eggs and adding instant espresso coffee and vanilla to batter.
280d9b7c-57c1-40e0-bca6-cad44d4ff868 Bake in 13 x 9-inch baking pan according to package directions, but bake for only 25 minutes.
280d9b7c-57c1-40e0-bca6-cad44d4ff868 Meanwhile, make the filling. Beat the butter and brown sugar in medium bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Blend in egg, instant espresso coffee and vanilla. Stir in walnuts and chocolate until blended.
280d9b7c-57c1-40e0-bca6-cad44d4ff868 Remove brownies from oven. Carefully spread filling over partially baked brownies. Return to oven; bake an additional 15 to 18 minutes or until light brown.
280d9b7c-57c1-40e0-bca6-cad44d4ff868 To make the glaze, heat the chocolate chips and butter in small microwave-safe bowl on HIGH 30 seconds or until melted and smooth when stirred. Whisk in instant espresso coffee and milk until thin enough to drizzle. Drizzle over warm brownies. Let cool.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 13x9 inch pan with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc Place chocolate and butter in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high for 1 minute. Stir and repeat until smooth. Let cool for about 5 minutes.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc While chocolate cools, in a separate bowl beat sugar and eggs on high speed of an electric mixer for 3 minutes. Beat in vanilla. Stir chocolate mixture into the egg mixture. Using a mixing spoon or wire whisk, stir in flour and salt. Pour about half of this batter into the lined pan and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Let cool for 20 minutes.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc While first layer cools, prepare filling.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc Unwrap caramels (ack! Why don't they make unwrapped caramels!) and put them in a saucepan with the 1/3 cup of cream. Heat on medium low, stirring often, until caramels are melted. Stir about half of the chopped pecans into the caramel. Pour the caramel mixture over the brownie layer.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc Spread the remaining brownie mix over the caramel filling. It is kind of tricky, so do your best, but don't worry about covering all the caramel. Scatter chocolate chips and remaining pecans over the top.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc Bake at 350 degrees for another 20 minutes or until the top batter appears set but not dry. Allow brownies to cool completely (this should take a few hours). I like to cool them and then chill them because it makes slicing easier.
0e698b62-0d49-4fd6-8e8f-ede080fe58bc Lift brownies from pan and place on a big cutting board. Slice into whatever size you feel like.
402eeb9b-ffd2-4b27-b5bd-6ff5ae5f508e Preheat oven to 325F. Adjust an oven rack to a lower-middle position.
402eeb9b-ffd2-4b27-b5bd-6ff5ae5f508e Line an 8 inch square metal baking pan with foil or parchment paper.
402eeb9b-ffd2-4b27-b5bd-6ff5ae5f508e Put chocolates, butter, and instant coffee/espresso in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave on high, stirring every 30 seconds, until chocolate is almost melted. Remove from microwave, and stir to melt remaining bits of chocolate. Alternatively, you can melt the choco/butter/coffee combo over a pan of simmering water: put a heat-proof bowl over a pan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl doesn't touch the water, and stir until everything is melted. Remove from heat.
402eeb9b-ffd2-4b27-b5bd-6ff5ae5f508e Whisk in sugar, salt, baking powder, and extracts into the chocolate mixture. Then whisk in the eggs, one at a time, mixing each one completely before adding the next one. After adding the eggs, whisk the mixture until smooth and glossy. Add flour; whisk until just incorporated. Do not overmix. Stir in the nuts.
402eeb9b-ffd2-4b27-b5bd-6ff5ae5f508e Pour batter into the prepared pan; flatten the top with a spatula. Bake until a toothpick poked into the center comes out with wet crumbs, 55 to 65 minutes. (If your oven is notorious for overheating, start checking around 45 minutes.)
402eeb9b-ffd2-4b27-b5bd-6ff5ae5f508e Cool brownies in pan on a wire rack. When cool enough to handle, use the foil or parchment to pull the brownies from pan. Completely cool brownies on rack, at least 3 hours. Be patient, or the brownies won't cut into nice squares and you'll have a mess on hand. ... Cut and enjoy!!!
f741f2af-fd59-4d94-83a2-615d2fbcdfe2 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 9 inch square pan with nonstick foil or line with regular foil and spray foil with cooking spray.
f741f2af-fd59-4d94-83a2-615d2fbcdfe2 Place butter and cut-up chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl; Microwave on high for 30 seconds. Stir. Continue microwaving and stirring every 30 seconds until mixture is melted. Set aside and let cool for 5 minutes.
f741f2af-fd59-4d94-83a2-615d2fbcdfe2 In a second bowl, beat sugar, vanilla, and eggs with electric mixer on high for a full 5 minutes. Stir melted chocolate mixture into egg mixture. When chocolate is incorporated, stir in flour. Pour into pan and bake for 30 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. For a cleaner cut, chill the brownies before cutting.
f741f2af-fd59-4d94-83a2-615d2fbcdfe2 When cool, grasp foil, lift from pan, place on a cutting board and cut brownies into big squares.
4ebf2c24-ab84-4631-98d2-6422cae699b7 Preheat oven to 350º
4ebf2c24-ab84-4631-98d2-6422cae699b7 Combine oil, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. To this, add the flour, baking powder, and cocoa- mix well. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts as desired. Pour in a greased 9x13 pan. Bake for 30 minutes- or until a toothpick comes out clean.
4ebf2c24-ab84-4631-98d2-6422cae699b7 For more fudgy brownies, take the brownies out of the oven about 5 minutes early. Chill completely before cutting.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 13×9 inch metal pan with nonstick foil.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e Sift together flour, baking powder and salt; Set aside.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e Melt the chocolate and butter together in a small saucepan set over low heat, stirring often. You can also do this step in a double boiler or in the microwave.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e In a large mixing bowl, preferably a stand mixer fitted with a whisk, beat eggs for about a minute. Gradually add the sugar and let the mixer go for about 10 minutes or until mixer is thick and pale and falls off beater in ribbons. Beat in vanilla.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e With a heavy duty scraper, fold the melted chocolate (it should be luke warm at this point) to sugar mixture. When mixture is well blended, stir in the flour mixture, then stir in the chocolate chips.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e Pour into pan and bake for about 28 minutes The toothpick test doesn’t really work here, but if you want to test anyway then keep in mind the toothpick should come out with chocolate on it.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e Now comes the hard part! Let them cool completely.
41111e4a-d637-4885-96f0-be44e7c6576e Lift from pan, place on a cutting board and cut into large or small squares. Best served at room temperature, but they slice a little more neatly when chilled or frozen.
b591fa77-5099-4209-8d36-d1be34d4d2c9 Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 35 minutes, reversing the pan from front to back once to ensure even baking (Maida covers her brownies loosely with foil halfway through to prevent burning, but I didn't). At the end of 35 minutes, the brownies will have a firm crust, but when tested with a toothpick will appear underbaked. Take them out anyway.
b591fa77-5099-4209-8d36-d1be34d4d2c9 Adjust an oven rack one-third up from the bottom and preheat oven to 425 degrees. Line a 9x13x2-inch metal pan with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
b591fa77-5099-4209-8d36-d1be34d4d2c9 Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan. When almost melted, reduce heat to low and add chocolate. Stir until chocolate is very soft, then remove from heat and let chocolate melt in the residual heat of the butter.
b591fa77-5099-4209-8d36-d1be34d4d2c9 In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the eggs with the vanilla and almond extracts, salt, espresso and sugar at high speed for 10 minutes. On low speed, add the chocolate mixture and beat only until mixed. Remove the bowl from the mixer and stir in the flour and the nuts.
b591fa77-5099-4209-8d36-d1be34d4d2c9 Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 35 minutes, reversing the pan from front to back once to ensure even baking (Maida covers her brownies loosely with foil halfway through to prevent burning, but I didn't). At the end of 35 minutes, the brownies will have a firm crust, but when tested with a toothpick will appear underbaked. Take them out anyway.
b591fa77-5099-4209-8d36-d1be34d4d2c9 Remove the pan from the oven and let stand until cool. Invert the brownies onto a cookie sheet and remove the foil. Cover with length of waxed paper and another cookie sheet..invert again. This cake is best covered and refrigerated for a few hours or overnight before it is cut into bars.
4f09d5a7-440b-4cb3-b7f4-119870f9b9f5 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line an 8 inch square pan with aluminum foil, letting the foil overhang two opposing sides of the pan by about 2 inches. Grease bottom of foil only.
4f09d5a7-440b-4cb3-b7f4-119870f9b9f5 Combine the butter and chopped chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 30 minutes and stir. Continue microwaving at 50% power and stirring every 30 seconds until chocolate is melted. Let cool to warm.
4f09d5a7-440b-4cb3-b7f4-119870f9b9f5 In another bowl, thoroughly stir together the flour, cocoa powder and salt; set aside.
4f09d5a7-440b-4cb3-b7f4-119870f9b9f5 In a mixing bowl, combine the sugar and brown sugar with the chocolate-butter mixture. Add the eggs and vanilla and stir until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is well blended and smooth. Stir in the flour mixture just until evenly incorporated.
4f09d5a7-440b-4cb3-b7f4-119870f9b9f5 Put batter in pan and spread evenly spreading to the edges. Bake in the middle of the oven for 28-30 minutes, or until the center is almost firm when tapped and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean except for the bottom 1/4 inch, which should still look moist.
4f09d5a7-440b-4cb3-b7f4-119870f9b9f5 Transfer the pan to a wire rack and let stand until the brownie is completely cooled. Refrigerate until well chilled.
4f09d5a7-440b-4cb3-b7f4-119870f9b9f5 Lift from pan by grasping foil. Cut into squares.
a5aa1f6a-b536-41c6-9bd2-2fa715724388 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square pan with nonstick foil.
a5aa1f6a-b536-41c6-9bd2-2fa715724388 Place chocolate and butter in a microwave-safe mixing bowl and microwave on high for 30 seconds. Stir and repeat until melted and smooth.
a5aa1f6a-b536-41c6-9bd2-2fa715724388 Using a wooden spoon, beat in sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time followed by vanilla. Beat thoroughly with spoon for about a minute. Stir in flour and salt.
a5aa1f6a-b536-41c6-9bd2-2fa715724388 Pour half of batter in lined pan and bake for 18 minutes. Let cool for at least 15 minutes. While cooling, prepare filling.
a5aa1f6a-b536-41c6-9bd2-2fa715724388 Place caramels and cream in a saucepan. Heat over medium, stirring constantly, or until caramels are melted and smooth. Stir in pecans. Pour over partially cooled brownie layer. Spread remaining brownie batter over caramel. Cook for another 18 minutes.
a5aa1f6a-b536-41c6-9bd2-2fa715724388 Let cool completely then chill Use parchment to lift brownies from pan.
a5aa1f6a-b536-41c6-9bd2-2fa715724388 Cut into squares.
fcc82304-087d-4dcb-b871-c1cc86163b2c Split the marshmallows lengthwise.
fcc82304-087d-4dcb-b871-c1cc86163b2c Line a rimmed 14x10 inch or a 13x9 inch pan with parchment paper.
fcc82304-087d-4dcb-b871-c1cc86163b2c Split the marshmallows lengthwise.
fcc82304-087d-4dcb-b871-c1cc86163b2c In a large saucepan, melt the white coating over low heat, stirring often. Add chocolate and continue stirring on low to medium low until chocolate is melted. Stir in the peanuts.
fcc82304-087d-4dcb-b871-c1cc86163b2c Spread a thin layer of the chocolate mixture onto the parchment paper, then press the marshmallows side-by-side into the chocolate. Scrape remaining chocolate peanut mixture over the top and smooth it out with the scraper.
fcc82304-087d-4dcb-b871-c1cc86163b2c Chill (or freeze) until set. Lift from the pan and cut into squares.
fcc82304-087d-4dcb-b871-c1cc86163b2c Note: Next time I make this I might try adding the peanuts AFTER spreading the thin layer of chocolate over the bottom. It worked fine the way it’s written, but it might look nicer with a flat peanut-free base.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Line an 8 inch or 9 inch square pan with parchment paper or nonstick foil.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Chop the white coating and put it in a large saucepan. Melt over medium low heat, stirring constantly.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter and peanuts.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Spread a thin layer of peanut butter mixture over bottom of lined pan, then set about 18 miniature Reese's in the pan. Pour remaining peanut butter fudge mixture over and smooth top.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Chill for an hour or until firm. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Line an 8 inch or 9 inch square pan with parchment paper or nonstick foil.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Chop the white coating and put it in a large saucepan. Melt over medium low heat, stirring constantly.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter and peanuts.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Spread a thin layer of peanut butter mixture over bottom of lined pan, then set about 18 miniature Reese's in the pan. Pour remaining peanut butter fudge mixture over and smooth top.
a6dc2b73-99ec-4bdc-8e3d-210994c71723 Chill for an hour or until firm. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a Line a baking sheet or flat surface with parchment paper.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a In a heavy 3 quart saucepan (preferably nonstick), combine both sugars and corn syrup. Put the pan over medium, insert the candy thermometer and heat until mixture reaches 250 degrees F. This should take about 10-15 minutes, and you shouldn’t really need to stir much. Keep the heat rising slowly and steady.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a Remove from heat and stir in butter, one chunk at a time until melted. Pour in the cream, then return the pan to heat, stirring constantly and keeping the candy at a slow boil/rapid simmer, until mixture reaches 242 degrees F. This should take about 15 minutes. It’s important to go slow and keep the mixture moving just enough not to burn. If temperature stalls, raise it in tiny increments.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a Line a baking sheet or flat surface with parchment paper.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a Lay the pecans on a rimmed baking sheet and bake at 375 for 7 minutes or until they start to release their oils. Pull from oven and toss with about a teaspoon of butter and a sprinkling of salt. Set aside to cool completely.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a In a heavy 3 quart saucepan (preferably nonstick), combine both sugars and corn syrup. Put the pan over medium, insert the candy thermometer and heat until mixture reaches 250 degrees F. This should take about 10-15 minutes, and you shouldn’t really need to stir much. Keep the heat rising slowly and steady.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a Remove from heat and stir in butter, one chunk at a time until melted. Pour in the cream, then return the pan to heat, stirring constantly and keeping the candy at a slow boil/rapid simmer, until mixture reaches 242 degrees F. This should take about 15 minutes. It’s important to go slow and keep the mixture moving just enough not to burn. If temperature stalls, raise it in tiny increments.
337cd38a-8dd2-4b46-90e3-e15e888f763a Remove from heat and add pecans, vanilla and salt, then stir with a wooden spoon allowing the mixture to cool and thicken just slightly. Drop by spoonfuls onto the parchment lined paper and let set. Note: You don’t have to work as quickly with chewy pralines because it takes longer for them to set. In fact, if the first one you spoon out runs just stir a bit and let the mixture cool and thicken a little before spooning out the next one.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Line a baking sheet or flat surface with parchment paper.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Lay the pecans on a rimmed baking sheet and bake at 375 for 7 minutes or until they start to release their oils. Pull from oven and toss with about a little butter and a sprinkling of salt. Set aside to cool completely.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 In a 3 quart saucepan, heat the 4 tablespoons of butter until it is partially melted, then add the ½ cup cream and heat butter and cream together just long enough to melt the butter. Remove from heat and (off heat) add both sugars and water stirring until mixture is uniformly blended. If sugar mixture has splashed up onto inside walls of pan, wipe it clean. Also, clean the spoon .
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Set the pan back on the stove and insert a deep fry candy thermometer in center. Heat over medium, stirring only occasionally, until candy reaches 235 to 236 (soft ball stage). You don’t have to stir constantly at first. Let it heat up until it gently starts simmering, then allow it to simmer/low boil with the temperature rising slowly and steadily. This should take 10 to 12 minutes.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Remove from heat and add salt, vanilla and toasted pecans, then stir with a wooden spoon for several minutes until mixture is thick enough not to flow everywhere when dropped from a spoon. Note that it may seem hopelessly loose at first, but if you heated it to soft ball stage it will start to thicken. When it does, quickly drop by large spoonfuls onto the parchment paper.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Let the pralines set, then peel off the parchment.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Line a baking sheet or flat surface with parchment paper.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Lay the pecans on a rimmed baking sheet and bake at 375 for 7 minutes or until they start to release their oils. Pull from oven and toss with about a little butter and a sprinkling of salt. Set aside to cool completely.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 In a 3 quart saucepan, heat the 4 tablespoons of butter until it is partially melted, then add the ½ cup cream and heat butter and cream together just long enough to melt the butter. Remove from heat and (off heat) add both sugars and water stirring until mixture is uniformly blended. If sugar mixture has splashed up onto inside walls of pan, wipe it clean. Also, clean the spoon .
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Set the pan back on the stove and insert a deep fry candy thermometer in center. Heat over medium, stirring only occasionally, until candy reaches 235 to 236 (soft ball stage). You don’t have to stir constantly at first. Let it heat up until it gently starts simmering, then allow it to simmer/low boil with the temperature rising slowly and steadily. This should take 10 to 12 minutes.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Remove from heat and add salt, vanilla and toasted pecans, then stir with a wooden spoon for several minutes until mixture is thick enough not to flow everywhere when dropped from a spoon. Note that it may seem hopelessly loose at first, but if you heated it to soft ball stage it will start to thicken. When it does, quickly drop by large spoonfuls onto the parchment paper.
e2525bea-dc14-4f8c-bf18-18b145ce9427 Let the pralines set, then peel off the parchment.
757da583-acd3-412a-a512-b6e54387ab17 Combine the chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in the top of a double boiler. If you don’t have a double boiler, you can do it directly over low heat in a large saucepan.
757da583-acd3-412a-a512-b6e54387ab17 Remove melted chocolate mixture from heat, then stir in noodles and peanuts. I recommend stirring in 3 cups of noodles first, then adding more as needed. Fewer noodles means more chocolate.
757da583-acd3-412a-a512-b6e54387ab17 Drop by spoonfuls onto a plate lined with wax paper or parchment paper.
757da583-acd3-412a-a512-b6e54387ab17 Put in the refrigerator and chill until firm.
8254ec72-6fc4-44e0-8f62-00b6c1045a34 In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate chips on high stirring every 30 seconds until melted.
8254ec72-6fc4-44e0-8f62-00b6c1045a34 Put the peanut butter chips in a small bowl and spoon the tahini over them to coat. Microwave at 50% power stirring every 30 seconds, until creamy. You could probably get away with using high, but I like to melt vanilla and peanut butter chips on a lower power because there's less risk of scorching.
8254ec72-6fc4-44e0-8f62-00b6c1045a34 Spread the melted chocolate evenly over a large parchment covered baking sheet, then spoon lines of tahini mixture over chocolate. Gently swirl through or make lines up and down. Sprinkle with sea salt and pepper (an Mini M&Ms if you just happen to have some)..
8254ec72-6fc4-44e0-8f62-00b6c1045a34 Put the tray in the freezer for about an hour or until set, then break into pieces.
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Preheat oven to 350°. Line an 8-inch square metal pan with nonstick foil or line with regular foil and grease foil with some extra butter (or cooking spray).
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Set the sheet of matzo in the pan.
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Put the butter in a microwave-safe 2 cup measure (I use a Pyrex liquid measuring cup) and heat the butter for 30 seconds or until it is partially melted. Add the brown sugar and stir until smooth.
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Put mixture in microwave and microwave for 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds. Pour over the matzo.
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until caramel is very hot and bubbly. Remove from oven and let cool on a wire rack very briefly -- just about 3 minutes or until caramel settles down.
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over hot caramel. Set a flat pan on top of the square pan to help hold in the heat. Let stand 5 minutes to soften chips, then spread softened chocolate chips over caramel. Sprinkle nuts over the top.
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Refrigerate until chocolate and caramel have hardened, about 1 hour. Break or cut bark.
548b446a-ded9-4e28-83a7-6de49887823f Note: To toast nuts, bake in a shallow pan in a 350° oven for 5-10 minutes or cook in a skillet over low heat until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
764fa84e-32ee-4d76-b533-da131c44f7be Preheat oven to 350°. Line a 15x10 inch rimmed baking pan with nonstick foil.
764fa84e-32ee-4d76-b533-da131c44f7be Arrange cookies evenly across pan.
764fa84e-32ee-4d76-b533-da131c44f7be In a large microwave-safe mixing bowl (I used a Pampered Chef Batter Bowl), heat the butter until melted, then whisk or stir in brown sugar.
764fa84e-32ee-4d76-b533-da131c44f7be Microwave 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until mixture is slightly thickened and looks more like a caramel sauce. It will still be fairly thin and pourable. Pour sauce over cookies, covering each completely.
764fa84e-32ee-4d76-b533-da131c44f7be Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until caramel is very hot and bubbly. Remove from oven and let cool on a wire rack very briefly -- just about 3 minutes or until caramel settles down.
764fa84e-32ee-4d76-b533-da131c44f7be Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over hot caramel. If desired, set another rimmed pan on top of the first rimmed pan to help hold in the heat. Let stand 5 minutes to soften chips, then spread softened chocolate chips over caramel. Sprinkle almonds over the top.
764fa84e-32ee-4d76-b533-da131c44f7be Refrigerate baking pan until chocolate and caramel have hardened, about 1 hour. Break or cut bark. Note: To toast nuts, bake in a shallow pan in a 350° oven for 5-10 minutes or cook in a skillet over low heat until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Add the peanut butter to the melted white chips and stir until smooth, then stir in the vanilla and 1/2 cup of the powdered sugar. The dough should be fairly soft at this point. Gradually add more powdered sugar if needed, or leave the dough soft. It should be be soft, but not so soft you can't scoop it.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Using about a heaping teaspoon measure, scoop out little mounds of peanut butter mixture and arrange them on a plate lined with plastic wrap. You should get about 32 depending on how you scooped, but the yield may vary. Chill the scooped mounds until they are no longer sticky, then shape into little balls. Press the little balls into rounds.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 In a microwave-safe bowl (I use my Pampered Chef Batter Bowl), mash the white chips and butter together so that the chips are coated with butter. Melt the white chips in the microwave using 50% power and stirring every 30 seconds. Set aside.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Add the peanut butter to the melted white chips and stir until smooth, then stir in the vanilla and 1/2 cup of the powdered sugar. The dough should be fairly soft at this point. Gradually add more powdered sugar if needed, or leave the dough soft. It should be be soft, but not so soft you can't scoop it.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Using about a heaping teaspoon measure, scoop out little mounds of peanut butter mixture and arrange them on a plate lined with plastic wrap. You should get about 32 depending on how you scooped, but the yield may vary. Chill the scooped mounds until they are no longer sticky, then shape into little balls. Press the little balls into rounds.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Put all of your little peanut butter rounds in a zipper bag and keep them in the refrigerator until you are ready to assemble the cups.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 To make the peanut butter cups, line 12 muffin cups with paper liners.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Put 8 oz of chopped chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl and heat to melt. If using semisweet chocolate you can melt it at high power and stir every 30 seconds. If using milk chocolate, use 50% power and stir every 30 seconds. If using chocolate chips, you may want to add ½ teaspoon of coconut oil or shortening for every 3 oz of chips, but this is optional.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 When the chocolate is completely melted, spoon a little chocolate over the bottom of each paper liner. Do not try to paint it up the sides or make a nest. I tried that it made things worse. All you have to do is just smooth it flat.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Take 12 of your peanut butter rounds and stick a round in the center of the chocolate. Spoon remaining chocolate over the peanut butter rounds. Put the muffin tin in the refrigerator to set the chocolate. If you are in a hurry, you can put it in the freezer. When firm, peel away the paper.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Repeat the whole procedure using the remaining peanut butter rounds. You’ll need at least 3 oz of chocolate for every 5 peanut butter cups.
483dd8ef-20e5-4a58-8b7f-340dfff70068 Store the assembled peanut butter cups in the refrigerator or freezer, then serve at room temperature.
2a52f86f-1c14-48ae-91c4-fbc0b774681f Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or wax paper or nonstick foil.
2a52f86f-1c14-48ae-91c4-fbc0b774681f Put 2 tablespoons of semisweet morsels in a freezer type zipper bag or a disposable decorating bag and set aside.
2a52f86f-1c14-48ae-91c4-fbc0b774681f Melt remaining semisweet morsels in a microwave-safe bowl on high power for 45 seconds; Stir and repeat until fully melted. Spread the melted semisweet chocolate in a thin layer across the baking sheet and let it sit while you prepare the white morsels.
2a52f86f-1c14-48ae-91c4-fbc0b774681f Melt white morsels in a microwave-safe bowl. You can use 50% power and stir at 1 minute intervals, or use high power and stir at 30 or 45 second intervals. I prefer using a lower heat with white morsels. Stir the peanut butter into the melted white morsels.
2a52f86f-1c14-48ae-91c4-fbc0b774681f Drizzle peanut butter mixture over top of set semisweet chocolate. Sprinkle crushed Butterfinger or Butterfinger Baking Bits over top and press down lightly to adhere.
2a52f86f-1c14-48ae-91c4-fbc0b774681f Microwave the reserved 2 tablespoons morsels in heavy-duty freezer plastic bag on high power for about 20 seconds; knead until smooth. Cut a tiny corner from bag; squeeze to drizzle over bark.
2a52f86f-1c14-48ae-91c4-fbc0b774681f Chill for 1 hour before breaking apart and serving. Store refrigerated in airtight container.
285382d1-6a4a-40f1-b689-e26c564e29ef Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a 10x15 inch pan with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
285382d1-6a4a-40f1-b689-e26c564e29ef Spread broken pretzels evenly in the pan.
285382d1-6a4a-40f1-b689-e26c564e29ef Combine brown sugar and butter in a heavy duty saucepan and cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a full boil. Let boil without stirring for 2 minutes.
285382d1-6a4a-40f1-b689-e26c564e29ef Pour sugar mixture over pretzels, then bake on center rack for 10 minutes (check at 8 if using thin pretzels).
285382d1-6a4a-40f1-b689-e26c564e29ef Remove from oven and sprinkle the foamy, bubbly mixture evenly with chocolate chips or chopped chocolate (I like to put milk chocolate on one half and dark chocolate on the other).
285382d1-6a4a-40f1-b689-e26c564e29ef Return to oven 1 minute to soften chocolate. Remove from oven and let stand for about 10 minutes, then gently spread chocolate over candy. Sprinkle with pecans.
285382d1-6a4a-40f1-b689-e26c564e29ef Let cool for a couple of hours at room temperature, then chill just long enough to set the chocolate. Break into chunks.
ba03c45e-7a46-4294-9a4e-f29a4f7c2025 Line a 9 inch square pan with nonstick foil.
ba03c45e-7a46-4294-9a4e-f29a4f7c2025 In a 3 quart nonstick saucepan, stir the softened butter, sugar, corn syrup and condensed milk together until fully blended. Turn on the heat and set it to medium. Cook, stirring every so often with a wooden spoon or heat proof scraper, until boiling (about 6 minutes)
ba03c45e-7a46-4294-9a4e-f29a4f7c2025 Reduce mixture to a very soft boil – a little over a simmer. Insert candy thermometer and heat to 240 (soft ball stage), stirring often and making sure the heat is rising slowly and steadily. This should take about 20 minutes, and towards the end you’ll notice the mixture darkening a bit. When mixture reaches about 240, remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Pour caramel into the pan. Let cool at room temperature for 2 hours, and then cover with melted chocolate.
ba03c45e-7a46-4294-9a4e-f29a4f7c2025 Combine chocolate chips and coconut oil (or shortening) in a microwave-safe bowl and heat at 50% power, stirring every 30 seconds, until smooth and shiny. Pour chocolate over caramel.
ba03c45e-7a46-4294-9a4e-f29a4f7c2025 Refrigerate until chocolate is set. When chocolate is set, lift from the pan and cut into squares.
ba03c45e-7a46-4294-9a4e-f29a4f7c2025 Sprinkle with sea salt before serving.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 You will need a 9x9 inch pan, buttered (Note: a 9x13 inch pan will also work).
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 In a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, pour in 1⁄2 cup of the water and sprinkle with the gelatin. Set aside to allow the gelatin to soak in.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 In a medium saucepan over high heat, add the sugar, corn syrup, salt and remaining 1⁄2 cup of water. Bring to a rolling boil and continue to boil for 1 minute. Remove from the heat.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 Turn the mixer to low and mix the gelatin once or twice to combine it with the water. Slowly add the hot sugar mixture, pouring it gently down the side of the bowl, and continue to mix on low. Be really careful at this point because the sugar mixture is smoking hot! It’s not a job for little ones.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 Turn the mixer to high and continue to whip for 10 to 12 minutes until the marshmallow batter almost triples in size and becomes very thick. Scrape down the sides of the bowl frequently to avoid the batter overflowing as it grows. Stop the mixer, add the vanilla, and then whip briefly to combine.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking pan and use a spatula or bench scraper to spread it evenly in the pan. Work quickly, as the marshmallow becomes more difficult to manipulate as it sets.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 Grease a sheet of plastic wrap with butter and lay it across the top of the marshmallow. Press down firmly on the plastic wrap, to seal it smoothly and tightly against the mixture.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 Leave the marshmallow to set at room temperature for at least 3 hours or, evenbetter , overnight. The marshmallow will be too sticky and soft to cut if you try too soon.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 Sprinkle a work surface or cutting board with the icing sugar. Run a knife along the top edge of the pan to loosen the marshmallow slab. Invert the pan and flip the marshmallow out onto the counter or board. Scoop up handfuls of the icing sugar and rub all over the marshmallow slab.
3c09eba9-b9b2-49b6-b03a-1cb03053ece5 Use a large knife to cut the slab into 1- × 1-inch squares. Roll each of the freshly cut marshmallow squares in the remaining icing sugar to coat them completely. If you—and most of your kitchen—are speckled with marshmallow by the time you finish this recipe, fear not! It’s mostly sugar, so a little hot water and elbow grease will have things as good as new in no time.
a480eb89-c87d-4a24-b469-0e5a0171abe3 Make the chocolate shells first. Set the paper baking cups in the indentations of a miniature muffin pan. If you don’t have a mini muffin pan, you can skip it and just set the cups on a tray.
a480eb89-c87d-4a24-b469-0e5a0171abe3 Combine the 3/4 cup of chocolate chips and the 5 oz milk chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl. Melt in the microwave using 50% power and stirring every 30 seconds. Spoon a little bit of the mixture into each miniature cup dividing evenly among 32 cups. Gently spread chocolate a little over halfway up the sides with the back of a small measuring spoon. Put the cups in the freezer and make the filling.
a480eb89-c87d-4a24-b469-0e5a0171abe3 Filling: Melt butter over low heat in a saucepan. Add the 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips and 5 ounces of milk chocolate to melted butter and stir until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and add your favorite flavor extract. Let cool for about 10 minutes.
a480eb89-c87d-4a24-b469-0e5a0171abe3 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat eggs and salt on high speed until foamy and lemon colored. With the mixer going, gradually add melted chocolate mixture about 1 tablespoon at a time, until mixture thickens to about the consistency of mayonnaise. This should take about 5 minutes. The mixture thickens as it cools and should get to about the consistency of mayonnaise. If it is runny, put the bowl in the refrigerator for 5 minutes and then continue beating.
a480eb89-c87d-4a24-b469-0e5a0171abe3 Using a heaping tablespoon of filling, fill the chilled baking cups with chocolate mixture, piling it in the center. Sprinkle top with toasted nuts, sprinkles or Heath bits. Freeze for 2 hours or overnight hours.
a480eb89-c87d-4a24-b469-0e5a0171abe3 To serve, remove from the freezer and allow the cups to thaw a bit so that they are cold, but not frozen. They can be kept at room temperature for a few hours, but be sure to store them in an airtight container or freezer bag in the freezer.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b Beat the butter and brown sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the vanilla extract. Add 2 cups of flour alternately with sweetened condensed milk and stir until smooth.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b At this point, taste the dough. Add the remaining flour only if the dough is too loose.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b Fold in the chocolate chips and toffee bits; mixing just enough to evenly combine.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b With a cookie scoop or a tablespoon, scoop out small mounds of dough and place them on a foil or parchment lined cookie sheet. Put the sheet in the refrigerator and chill until the dough is firm enough to shape into balls. This should only take about 40 minutes.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b Shape the cold dough into smooth balls and put them in the freezer until ready to dip.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b Chop the chocolate and melt it in a double boiler. For thinner chocolate, add about a tablespoon of coconut oil. Alternately, you may melt it in the microwave using your favorite method.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b Keep the melted chocolate just slightly warm and the cookie dough balls very cold so that the balls don't fall apart in the chocolate.
a013f772-854c-48bf-bbfa-734702cabb6b Dip the dough balls in the chocolate coating, allowing any excess to drip off. Set them on a foil lined baking sheet and refrigerate until chocolate is firm.
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 Line 13x9x2-inch metal baking pan with nonstick foil and spray foil with cooking spray. Regular foil is probably fine, but I didn't want to risk it.
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 Pour 1/2 cup of the cold water into bowl of a stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment and sprinkle gelatin over water. Let gelatin sit and “bloom” for 15 minutes.
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 Combine 2 cups (14 oz) sugar, corn syrup, salt, and remaining 1/2 cup cold water in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over medium low heat until sugar dissolves, brushing down sides of pan with wet pastry brush. As soon as it begins to boil, cover with a lid and let boil for 2 minutes. Remove lid , insert thermometer and boil until it reaches 240 degree F.
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 With mixer running at low speed, slowly pour hot syrup into gelatin mixture in thin stream down side of bowl. Gradually increase speed to high and beat until mixture is very thick and stiff, about 15 minutes. Add vanilla and beat to blend, about 30 seconds longer.
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 Pour marshmallow mixture into prepared pan. Smooth top with wet spatula. Let stand uncovered at room temperature until firm – at least four hours.
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 Stir confectioner’s sugar and cornstarch together in a small bowl, then sift a generous amount of mixture over a clean work surface covering 9x13 inches of space. Invert the marshmallow onto the sugar mixture and peel away the foil. Sift more sugar mixture over marshmallow. Using a sharp knife coated with nonstick spray, cut mixture into cubes. Toss marshmallows squares in remaining sugar mixture.
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 Chop half the chocolate and put it in the top of a double boiler or a microwave-safe bowl. Add about 2 teaspoons of coconut oil and stir. Melt over simmering water in the double boiler, or melt at 50% power in the microwave, stirring every 30 to 50 seconds (I stir ever 30 seconds for milk and every 50 for dark).
3bd8d85d-7b68-4e6a-b636-1b5bcdf8e794 Dip marshmallow squares in chocolate and allow excess to drip back into bowl. Arrange pieces on a small tray lined with nonstick foil. Chill until chocolate is set.
6a2d5b75-0ef1-4c6b-bb83-9b73e5e9a595 Put the chopped chocolate (or chips) in a microwave-safe bowl. Add the butter and heat on 50% power for 1 minute. Stir well. Repeat, microwaving at 50% and stirring every 60 seconds, until mixture is almost fully melted. Now add the peanut butter and continue the melting process, stirring after 30 seconds, until smooth.
6a2d5b75-0ef1-4c6b-bb83-9b73e5e9a595 Spread a thin layer of this mixture across the bottom of your lined loaf pan, then stand the marshmallows across the bottom of the pan.
6a2d5b75-0ef1-4c6b-bb83-9b73e5e9a595 Pour the chocolate mixture over the marshmallows, pushing it gently between the cracks and into the sides.
6a2d5b75-0ef1-4c6b-bb83-9b73e5e9a595 Chill the loaf for about 2 hours or until chocolate mixture is firmly set. Lift from the pan, peel away foil and trim edges. Cut into large blocks or cut cross-wise into strips
24b290ba-0ced-4e2a-b350-810a018cb19d Line an 8 inch metal pan with foil and grease with some butter.
24b290ba-0ced-4e2a-b350-810a018cb19d In a heavy 3 quart saucepan, combine the sugar, evaporated milk, butter and salt; bring to a rolling boil over medium heat, stirring continuously. Starting when the mixture hits a boil, set the timer for 4 minutes and reduce heat to the lowest temperature at which the mixture will maintain the boil, then boil gently until timer rings.
24b290ba-0ced-4e2a-b350-810a018cb19d Line an 8 inch metal pan with foil and grease with some butter.
24b290ba-0ced-4e2a-b350-810a018cb19d Put the vanilla, chocolate chips, marshmallows and nuts in a large mixing bowl and set aside.
24b290ba-0ced-4e2a-b350-810a018cb19d In a heavy 3 quart saucepan, combine the sugar, evaporated milk, butter and salt; bring to a rolling boil over medium heat, stirring continuously. Starting when the mixture hits a boil, set the timer for 4 minutes and reduce heat to the lowest temperature at which the mixture will maintain the boil, then boil gently until timer rings.
24b290ba-0ced-4e2a-b350-810a018cb19d Remove from heat and gradually add the boiled mixture to chocolate chip mixture. I do this in thirds rather than all at once -- 1/3 and stir, add 1/3 and stir and 1/3 and stir until smooth.
24b290ba-0ced-4e2a-b350-810a018cb19d Pour into prepared pan. Let sit at room temperature for about an hour, then chill until 4 hours or overnight. Lift from pan and cut into 1-inch squares. Store in refrigerator or freezer in a sealed container.
92af0fd5-9f7b-4a19-bae1-83832d84760f Line a 9x13 inch baking pan with nonstick foil.
92af0fd5-9f7b-4a19-bae1-83832d84760f In a medium saucepan (mine was 3 quarts) over medium heat, combine sugar, corn syrup and vinegar and stir for about 3 minutes or until sugar dissolves and mixture appears shiny and smooth. Continue cooking over medium heat, without stirring, to 300 degrees on a candy thermometer. At exactly 300 degrees, remove from heat and stir in baking soda. Pour into prepared pan and let it fan out, but do not spread. Let the candy cool, then break it into chunks.
92af0fd5-9f7b-4a19-bae1-83832d84760f Melt the chocolate in the microwave using 50% power and stirring every 30 seconds or in the top of a double boiler. Dip chunks of candy in the chocolate and let it set.
fe78822d-c5ff-453d-b352-e49bc67a66f6 Line the bottom and sides of an 8 x 8in baking pan with aluminum foil, leaving an overhang on all sides. Set aside.
fe78822d-c5ff-453d-b352-e49bc67a66f6 In a medium saucepan over a low-medium heat, combine the chocolate chips, butter, and sweetened condensed milk. Stir constantly until the chocolate chips are completely melted. The mixture will be very thick.
fe78822d-c5ff-453d-b352-e49bc67a66f6 Remove from the heat and allow to slightly cool for 3–4 minutes. Gently fold in the marshmallows and Graham cracker pieces. The marshmallows will melt slightly, creating swirls. Spoon the chocolate mixture into the prepared pan, smoothing down the top as best you can. Chill in the refrigerator for 4–6 hours until firm. Using a very sharp knife, cut into squares.
fe78822d-c5ff-453d-b352-e49bc67a66f6 Cover the fudge tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
fe78822d-c5ff-453d-b352-e49bc67a66f6 Sally Says: This is my go-to chocolate fudge recipe. Instead of s’mores fixings, try adding walnuts, candy cane pieces, peanut butter swirls, or crushed Oreo® cookies
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Line the inside of a 9x5 inch loaf pan with nonstick foil.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Place unsweetened chocolate, milk chocolate and vanilla in a metal bowl; set aside.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Combine sugar, condensed milk, water, cream, salt (if using) and butter in heavy 3 to 3 ½ quart saucepan. I like to grease the sides of the saucepan to help prevent sugar crystals from forming.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Stir over medium-low heat (without scraping sides) until butter is melted and sugar dissolves. Brush down the sides of the pan with a damp pastry brush to keep sugar crystals from forming.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Increase heat to high and bring mixture to rolling boil. Don't let it boil over! It will foam and rise quite a bit, so lift it from the heat if this starts to happen.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Reduce heat to medium-high and cook, stirring slowly, until a candy thermometer registers 230F. Time will vary due to humidity levels, stoves, pots, etc., but keep the mixture at a steady boil and a slowly rising temp. It might hover around 220 for a while. When it hits 230 it should be fragrant and just slightly off white.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Without scraping the brown residue that forms on the bottom of the saucepan, pour boiling mixture over the chocolate and stir stir until chocolate melts. Mix in the almonds and transfer to the loaf pan, smoothing the top.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Transfer fudge to prepared pan and smooth top. Sprinkle with reserved nuts. Refrigerate uncovered until firm enough to cut, about 2 hours.
329f9e4d-e0e2-44d0-bb8f-e2f1c00c29b1 Lift fudge from pan and cut into pieces
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c Line a 13x18 inch rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper or nonstick foil.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c In a small cup, combine the soda and water. Set next to the stove.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c Soften the peanut butter in your microwave or in the top of a double boiler and have it ready to go. You won’t have time to waste scraping it out of the jar. Mix the vanilla into the peanut butter.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c Also, have ready two frozen dinner forks for spreading.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c In a large heavy saucepan that is not so heavy that you can’t lift it to pour (I used a 3 ½ quart, thick, nonstick saucepan), combine the sugar, corn syrup and water. Heat over high, stirring often (I didn't really need to stir that much), until mixture reaches 260 degrees. Bob notes mixture should be a light yellow tan color. Mine was very light yellow and barely tan, but it was definitely 260 degrees.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c At 260 degrees, immediately remove from burner, and lower the stove heat to medium.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c While off the burner, quickly add the margarine (or butter) and stir vigorously, then add the peanuts. Return to the stove and cook over medium heat, stirring continuously until mixture reaches 270 degrees. This process should take about 4 or 6 minutes, but make sure to go by the reading on the thermometer and not time.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c Remove from heat and quickly stir in the baking soda mixture. Candy will bubble up.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c Stir in the peanut butter/vanilla mixture -- everything will start thickening at this point so work quickly.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c Pour onto the lined baking sheet and spread evenly with two frozen dinner forks (I completely ignored the part about the forks and just spread it). This part is tricky. If you spread with a spoon or scraper, the top might not look as pretty.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c Let it cool completely. Don’t even think about breaking it apart until it is completely cool. It will still be chewy and “bend-y” while warm
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c When completely cool, break it apart into big chunks.
ee954890-d4a9-4d9b-9442-ffa47f2b6e9c This recipe makes a little over 3 pounds of candy.
aee28ce2-15b2-48c7-9b02-2003bd839cf9 Line a baking tray with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
aee28ce2-15b2-48c7-9b02-2003bd839cf9 Mix together the broken pretzels, toffee bits and peanuts and set aside.
aee28ce2-15b2-48c7-9b02-2003bd839cf9 In a small bowl, combine the white chips, coconut oil and peanut butter and stir to coat chips in oil and peanut butter. Microwave at about 40% power for 20 seconds and stir. Repeat, stirring at 20 or 30 second intervals (if you have a more powerful microwave, you might want to go with the 20 seconds) until white chocolate mixture is creamy and smooth.
aee28ce2-15b2-48c7-9b02-2003bd839cf9 Add the pretzel mixture and stir to coat. Add more or pretzels/peanuts/toffee if needed. Dry bits should be coated with white chocolate mixture
aee28ce2-15b2-48c7-9b02-2003bd839cf9 Drop spoonfuls of candy mixture onto the lined tray and chill until firm.
a6c2bcbe-0bfc-4ca9-bb38-bae61a285eda Melt the white chips and 1 tablespoon of the butter in the microwave using 50% power and stirring every 30 seconds. Set aside.
a6c2bcbe-0bfc-4ca9-bb38-bae61a285eda Beat the remaining tablespoon of softened butter, the peanut butter and vanilla until well mixed, then add the melted chip mixture and 1/2 cup of the powdered sugar. Continue adding powdered sugar until you've used the full 1 1/2 cups. The dough should be thick enough to shape, but if it's not you can throw it in the refrigerator for a few minutes.
a6c2bcbe-0bfc-4ca9-bb38-bae61a285eda Shape into about 32 balls (see note). Put the balls on a parchment or wax paper lined tray or a couple of plates -- something you can fit in the freezer. Freeze the balls for about 30 minutes before dipping.
a6c2bcbe-0bfc-4ca9-bb38-bae61a285eda Melt chocolate chips and shortening (if using) in a microwave-safe bowl at 50% power, stirring every 30 to 60 seconds (60 is usually fine).
a6c2bcbe-0bfc-4ca9-bb38-bae61a285eda Using a toothpick, dip peanut butter balls partially into chocolate, keeping the top uncovered. Chill until chocolate has hardened.
824e6175-1e6f-46b1-a3a5-3ae748e73536 Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.
824e6175-1e6f-46b1-a3a5-3ae748e73536 Put the olives on a small sheet tray and bake them until they are dry – about 1 hour.
824e6175-1e6f-46b1-a3a5-3ae748e73536 In a medium saucepan on high heat, combine the water, sugar and corn syrup. Cook the mixture until it turns a golden brown, about 8 to 10 minutes.
824e6175-1e6f-46b1-a3a5-3ae748e73536 Stir in the butter. Continue cooking until the butter is melted and thoroughly incorporated. Take off heat and stir in the baking soda.
824e6175-1e6f-46b1-a3a5-3ae748e73536 Stir in the olives and immediately pour the mixture out onto a Silpat or a parchment lined sheet pan. Flatten with another Silpat or a layer of wax paper and a rolling pin if needed (I didn’t really flatten it because I didn’t want to lose too many bubbles).
824e6175-1e6f-46b1-a3a5-3ae748e73536 Once the brittle has cooled completely, break it into bite-sized pieces. You can store this in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
b756a4a3-4277-437e-a8c8-97791b5456f9 Combine 5 oz of chocolate and butter in a fairly large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at 50% power, stirring every 30 seconds, until smooth and creamy.
b756a4a3-4277-437e-a8c8-97791b5456f9 In a microwave-safe measuring cup, combine the cream and honey. Microwave on high for about 40 seconds or until simmering around edges. Pour the hot cream mixture into the melted chocolate and stir until smooth. Stir in the Amaretto.
b756a4a3-4277-437e-a8c8-97791b5456f9 Chill for at least one hour or until the mixture is thick enough to scoop.
b756a4a3-4277-437e-a8c8-97791b5456f9 When the mixture is thick, use a heaping teaspoon to scoop up chocolate and shape into messy balls. They will not be perfectly shaped at this point. Put the messy balls on a waxed paper lined tray and chill until they are firm. When firm, re-shape the balls with the palms of your hand so that they are nicely rounded. Transfer to the freezer and keep covered until frozen.
b756a4a3-4277-437e-a8c8-97791b5456f9 When chocolate centers are frozen, melt your dipping chocolate (or temper your regular chopped chocolate using the microwave method). Dip the frozen balls in the melted chocolate and lift them out of the chocolate with two forks. Let the remaining chocolate run back into the bowl.
