Set on a wax paper lined tray or a couple of lined plates. Let chill until coating is firm.
47254394-16fb-4c9f-ba23-b806284c07c1 Cover a tray with parchment paper. Place however many pretzels you’d like to make on the parchment.
47254394-16fb-4c9f-ba23-b806284c07c1 Melt some white wafers and drizzle white chocolate in the loops, gently brushing the white chocolate so it comes up against the sides of the pretzel. You are making the bottoms at this point, so don’t fill the loops completely with white chocolate.
47254394-16fb-4c9f-ba23-b806284c07c1 Set the chocolate by putting it in the refrigerator. When set, spoon little bits of Biscoff spread in the loops. Melt more white chocolate wafers and drizzle over pretzels, covering the filling and sides. Let set. At this point they still look kind of messy, so it’s time for a drizzle.
47254394-16fb-4c9f-ba23-b806284c07c1 Put a little Biscoff in an empty decorator bag or heavy duty freezer bag. Snip off the tip (or corner) and squeeze lines of Biscoff over the pretzel. That’s all there is to it! You can store these in the freezer, refrigerator or at room temperature.
e85d2fef-d747-4438-aecf-ef6c8a857953 Put the chopped chocolate in a heat proof bowl.
e85d2fef-d747-4438-aecf-ef6c8a857953 Put the cream in a small saucepan and heat just until it starts to boil. Pour the hot cream over the chocolate. Stir until chocolate is melted, then stir in bourbon. Chill for 30 minutes to an hour, or just until it’s thick enough to scoop. Using a spoon or small cookie scoop, scoop up chocolate and roll it into ball between gloved palms. Chill the chocolate balls for a few hours or until they are very cold and firm.
e85d2fef-d747-4438-aecf-ef6c8a857953 Melt your dipping chocolate in the microwave using 50% power and stirring every 30 seconds. Dunk the chocolate balls in the chocolate and lift them out using two forks. Let excess chocolate drip back into the bowl. Set on a waxed paper line cookie sheet and chill until firm. Put white chocolate in a zipper bag or heavy duty pastry bag. Put the bag in the microwave for 15 seconds, knead bag, then repeat until white chocolate is melted. Snip off bottom corner (or tip) of bag and let white chocolate cool slightly so it doesn’t come out of the bag too fast. Squeeze it over the dipped truffles and let it set.
e85d2fef-d747-4438-aecf-ef6c8a857953 to 25 depending on how big you make them
7e38f5f9-5ddc-4e46-90c4-43852c01a9dd Line a baking sheet or tray with waxed paper. Alternatively, you can use a couple of plates if a baking sheet won't fit in your refrigerator.
7e38f5f9-5ddc-4e46-90c4-43852c01a9dd In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine peanut butter and cream cheese. Microwave, uncovered, on high (100% power) for 30 seconds or until mixture is slightly softened, stirring once. If you have a high powered microwave, start with 10 seconds. Stir in powdered sugar and pretzels. Shape the peanut butter mixture into 1-inch balls. Place balls on the prepared baking sheet. Cover and freeze for 15 minutes or until firm.
7e38f5f9-5ddc-4e46-90c4-43852c01a9dd Place Ghirardelli® Dark Melting Wafers in a microwave-safe container. Microwave at half power or defrost setting for 30 seconds. Stir thoroughly (product keeps its original shape until stirred). If not completely melted, continue to microwave at 15 second intervals and stir until smooth. Overheating will cause wafers to burn.
7e38f5f9-5ddc-4e46-90c4-43852c01a9dd Using a fork, dip balls into melted mixture, allowing excess to drip back into bowl. Place dipped balls back on baking sheet. Chill for 30 minutes or until firm.
7e38f5f9-5ddc-4e46-90c4-43852c01a9dd To store, place in a single layer in an airtight container. Refrigerate for up to 1 week or freeze for up to 1 month. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes before serving.
db9c61c1-624d-4358-b171-00158ece2993 Grease two large roasting pans or rimmed cookie sheets. I prefer using roasting pans.
db9c61c1-624d-4358-b171-00158ece2993 In a very large (4 quart) saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the brown sugar and next 3 ingredients, stirring constantly until mixture boils. Boil gently, uncovered and without stirring, for 5 minutes. Remove from burner and add baking soda and vanilla. Pour warm mixture over popcorn and toss until coated. If you are using two roasting pans, you can do this directly in the roasting pans. If using rimmed cookie sheets, you might want to divide the popcorn among a few large bowls or put it in a really big one to stir.
db9c61c1-624d-4358-b171-00158ece2993 Spread popcorn out in the pans and bake at 250° for one hour. Every 15 minutes stir the popcorn to keep it from burning. Let cool completely.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Line a tray or baking sheet with parchment paper.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl at 50% power, stirring after 30 seconds. Repeat, microwave for another 30 seconds and stirring until completely melted.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Dip a pretzel in the chocolate and let excess chocolate drip back into the bowl.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Lay it on the parchment paper. Spoon a small amount of chocolate into each pretzel loop -- don't fill it completely, just put in enough to make a "floor" to hold the peanut butter.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Repeat until you've used all the pretzels, then put them in the refrigerator to set.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Remove from the refrigerator. Spoon tiny bits of peanut butter into each pretzel loop.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Return melted chocolate to microwave and heat at 50% power for about 20 seconds to re-soften.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Spoon chocolate over tops of each pretzel so that it completely covers the peanut butter.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 Return to the refrigerator to set or attempt to let set at room temperature. This will take much longer, but it might give you a shinier pretzel. It really depends on what type of chocolate you are using and whether it was in temper when you put it on.
71b31b06-8fe5-4ed9-bdfb-1a35246dcc45 When chocolate is set, repeat melting procedure with white chocolate. Drizzle the white chocolate. Scatter a few sprinkles on top if you feel like it, then put in the refrigerator to set.
d1ee408e-2d3b-4a92-bd4a-f7cc8dbbed86 Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
d1ee408e-2d3b-4a92-bd4a-f7cc8dbbed86 Put the dark chocolate in a large bowl and microwave at 50% power for 30 seconds. Stir well, even if the chocolate doesn't appear to have melted. Repeat, microwaving for another 30 seconds at 50% power and stirring well after 30 seconds. Continue until all the chocolate is fully melted. Repeat with the white chocolate.
d1ee408e-2d3b-4a92-bd4a-f7cc8dbbed86 Stir 1/2 cup of the cashews into each bowl.
d1ee408e-2d3b-4a92-bd4a-f7cc8dbbed86 Spoon both melted chocolates onto the parchment paper to make a marbled pattern.
d1ee408e-2d3b-4a92-bd4a-f7cc8dbbed86 Chill until set, then break into pieces. If your kitchen is cool, you can try to let it set at room temperature, but this will take much longer.
80c25a21-ae26-4aff-8f02-aac592a3f46e Line 20 to 24 mini muffin cups with miniature muffin papers or squares of nonstick foil or parchment paper. If you don't have liners, you could probably get away with rubbing generously with butter and chilling the greased pan before filling.
80c25a21-ae26-4aff-8f02-aac592a3f46e Put the almonds in a dry skillet and toast over medium to medium high heat, stirring often, until they start to brown. Remove from heat and put in a bowl to cool.
80c25a21-ae26-4aff-8f02-aac592a3f46e Break the graham crackers up into small 1/2 inch (ish!) chunks. Put them in the bowl with the almonds. Stir in the toffee bits.
80c25a21-ae26-4aff-8f02-aac592a3f46e In a microwave safe bowl, melt the chocolate using 50% power and stirring every 30 seconds.
80c25a21-ae26-4aff-8f02-aac592a3f46e Combine the chocolate and graham mixture and stir well.
80c25a21-ae26-4aff-8f02-aac592a3f46e Spoon mixture into lined mini muffin pan and chill until set. If using squares of parchment or foil, lift from pan and peel it away. If using cups, you can serve from the cups. If using a buttered tin, just pry the candies out.
0e31559c-f0ff-490b-9138-035ea91cc4b8 Line 24 cupcake cups with paper liners.
0e31559c-f0ff-490b-9138-035ea91cc4b8 In a large microwave-safe bowl or in the top of a double boiler, combine chips and peanut butter and stir well, coating the chips in peanut butter. Heat in the double boiler until melted, or melt in the microwave using high and stirring every 30 seconds.
0e31559c-f0ff-490b-9138-035ea91cc4b8 Stir in the frozen marshmallows, cashews and pretzel pieces.
0e31559c-f0ff-490b-9138-035ea91cc4b8 Divide the mixture evenly between the cups and put in the refrigerator to set the chocolate.
0e31559c-f0ff-490b-9138-035ea91cc4b8 To serve, peel away the paper liners.
0e31559c-f0ff-490b-9138-035ea91cc4b8 Store in the refrigerator.
9e57c115-af9e-459a-9ee6-79c872a952a7 Combine potato flakes and water in large bowl. Allow to stand 2 minutes or until potato flakes are fully hydrated.
9e57c115-af9e-459a-9ee6-79c872a952a7 Beat in peanut butter, butter and almond extract with an electric mixer on low speed until blended. Add powdered sugar 1 cup at a time, beating until smooth. Make 36 1-inch balls using 2 teaspoonfuls of mixture for each ball.
9e57c115-af9e-459a-9ee6-79c872a952a7 Melt chocolate chips and shortening in a microwave-safe bowl at 50% power, stirring every 30 seconds. Dip peanut butter balls partially into chocolate, keeping the top uncovered. Chill until chocolate has hardened.
cba1c8bf-7b13-4db4-acde-f05d4df6b36d Finely chop 8 ounces of the chocolate and put in a bowl.
cba1c8bf-7b13-4db4-acde-f05d4df6b36d Combine the orange zest and the heavy cream in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Strain the orange infused cream over the chocolate and let it set for one minute. Stir gently with a whisk (do not beat or you’ll incorporate air), starting in the center and working your way to the edge, until the ganache is smooth. Stir in the liqueur if using.
cba1c8bf-7b13-4db4-acde-f05d4df6b36d Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap and let set at room temperature until thick enough to hold its shape, approximately 2 hours.
cba1c8bf-7b13-4db4-acde-f05d4df6b36d Using a pastry bag with a 3/8-inch opening tip OR using a small cookie scoop (in which case the truffles will be much larger), pipe or scoop mounds (about 3/4 inch high and 3/4 inch wide if piping) on parchment-lined baking sheets.
cba1c8bf-7b13-4db4-acde-f05d4df6b36d Refrigerate until firm, about 15 minutes.
cba1c8bf-7b13-4db4-acde-f05d4df6b36d Meanwhile, melt the remaining 3 ounces of chocolate. With gloves on, coat the palm of your hands with melted chocolate and gently coat each chilled truffle. Immediately toss the coated truffles in chocolate powder with a fork.
cba1c8bf-7b13-4db4-acde-f05d4df6b36d Store the truffles inside an airtight box at room temperature.
5fe45ea2-2cdd-4620-9a1f-94726f19cab5 Line a 9x13 inch pan with parchment paper or nonstick foil.
5fe45ea2-2cdd-4620-9a1f-94726f19cab5 In a large double boiler or in a heat-proof bowl set over simmering water, melt the chips.
5fe45ea2-2cdd-4620-9a1f-94726f19cab5 Add the peanut butter and stir until smooth, then stir in the peanuts.
5fe45ea2-2cdd-4620-9a1f-94726f19cab5 Remove from heat, let cool slightly, then add marshmallows.
5fe45ea2-2cdd-4620-9a1f-94726f19cab5 Spread mixture in pan and refrigerate for at least two hours. Lift from pan, set on a cutting board and cut into desired size squares/bars.
5fe45ea2-2cdd-4620-9a1f-94726f19cab5 The mud should be stored in the refrigerator or freezer.
2b64213e-1e15-4cfd-afaf-332c4689ac68 Line a 9x13 inch baking pan with non-stick foil.
2b64213e-1e15-4cfd-afaf-332c4689ac68 Combine butter, chocolate chips and sweetened condensed milk in a large saucepan and melt over medium low heat.
2b64213e-1e15-4cfd-afaf-332c4689ac68 Meanwhile, combine peanuts and marshmallows in large bowl. Stir in chocolate mixture. Spread in prepared pan.
2b64213e-1e15-4cfd-afaf-332c4689ac68 Chill 2 hours or until firm. Remove from pan by lifting edges of foil.
2b64213e-1e15-4cfd-afaf-332c4689ac68 Peel off the foil and cut into squares.
2b64213e-1e15-4cfd-afaf-332c4689ac68 Alternatively, you can make the recipe in the microwave. Heat the condensed milk and butter for 1 minute in a microwave-safe bowl. Add the chips and stir well. Microwave for another 30 seconds, stir until chips are melted and smooth. Then stir in peanuts and marshmallows. Press into the lined pan. Let set, then cut
d25aa6f0-0890-4c41-aef6-ab0193e74204 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lay the pecans on a baking sheet and bake at 350 for anywhere from 6 to 10 minutes. This will vary with the type of pecans you use. Check at 7 minutes. When pecans are fragrant, remove from oven and toss with butter and salt. Let cool completely, then chop.
d25aa6f0-0890-4c41-aef6-ab0193e74204 Line a 9 inch square pan with parchment paper, or line with foil and grease the foil.
d25aa6f0-0890-4c41-aef6-ab0193e74204 Put the chocolate chips, marshmallow cream and nuts in a large bowl and set next to the stove. Also, measure out the vanilla and have it ready to go.
d25aa6f0-0890-4c41-aef6-ab0193e74204 Cut the butter into chunks and put it in the saucepan. If you forgot to soften it, warm it gently in the saucepan. Off heat, add the sugar and stir to blend with the butter, then stir in the evaporated milk.
d25aa6f0-0890-4c41-aef6-ab0193e74204 Set the pan over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves (mixture will be shiny). When mixture begins to boil, start the timer for 4 minutes and insert the candy thermometer. After 4 minutes, your candy should hit between 234 and 236 degrees F. Remove from heat and pour in the chocolate chips, marshmallow crème and nuts. Also, add the vanilla. Stir with a wooden spoon, scraping just enough to push the fudge out.
d25aa6f0-0890-4c41-aef6-ab0193e74204 Pour fudge into the 9 inch square pan and tilt the pan back and forth to even the surface. Allow it to cool for several hours. It should start setting immediately, but it won’t be quite ready for cutting for a while. As mentioned in the blog post, it seems to taste better the second day.
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae Toast 1/2 cup of the almonds in a dry skillet. Set aside to cool.
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae Line a large rimmed sheet pan or jellyroll pan with parchment paper and set next to stove.
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae Place butter in a heavy bottomed, medium sized (3 qt) saucepan and melt over medium heat. When butter is mostly melted, stir in sugar, warm water and salt.
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae Set a deep fry thermometer in the pan, being careful that bulb is not touching bottom, and cook without stirring over medium heat until mixture reaches 240 degrees F.
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae At 240 degrees, add the remaining 1 cup sliced almonds to sugar mixture and begin stirring constantly, keeping heat at medium, until mixture reaches 295 degrees F. If temperature is not rising at a slow and steady rate, raise heat a tiny bit until mercury starts rising
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae When mixture reaches 290 (make sure it's no less than 290 and no more than 295 degrees F), immediately remove from heat and stir in baking soda. It will bubble up and lighten a bit and seem almost fluffy. Pour into parchment lined pan. The mixture should be kind of a liquid blob at this point and if you are on track, the saucepan will be clean when you dump the blob of candy onto the parchment. Mixture will begin to firm, and butter may pool and separate. Do not pour off any excess butter. Do not panic, because if you cooked the toffee to between 290 and 295, your candy should set. Sometimes it just takes longer.
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae While candy is still very hot and in the process of setting, scatter chopped chocolate across top of hot and let chocolate melt into and over the candy as candy firms. Using back of a spoon, spread melted chocolate evenly over candy. Crush your toasted almonds and sprinkle over melted chocolate. Let candy cool for a 1/2 hour or more at room temperature. Transfer to refrigerator and chill for about 1 hour to firm chocolate.
328328bf-b040-44c4-a08c-0dacd8331aae When chocolate is set is set, lift candy from pan by grasping parchment. Break candy into large chunks.
c5098d89-0ca8-4924-ad55-ff91d5117b39 In a food processor, process the Oreos.
c5098d89-0ca8-4924-ad55-ff91d5117b39 Cut the cream cheese into chunks and process along with the Oreos until everything is blended together.
c5098d89-0ca8-4924-ad55-ff91d5117b39 Using a cookie scoop (small or medium) scoop out equal portions of dough. If you are using a medium cookie scoop you should get about 18 large balls, which you can divide in half to make about 36 smaller ones. At this point the dough balls don't need to be perfect circles.
c5098d89-0ca8-4924-ad55-ff91d5117b39 Set the dough on a plastic wrap lined tray and chill until dough is somewhat stiff, then shape into perfect balls. Put the ball in a freezer bag and freeze for at least an hour before dipping.
c5098d89-0ca8-4924-ad55-ff91d5117b39 Melt the white chocolate using your favorite method or the method on the package. Using two forks, dip each Golden Oreo ball into the chocolate and let it drip off.
c5098d89-0ca8-4924-ad55-ff91d5117b39 Set on wax paper or parchment to set. Before the white chocolate is completely set, top with sprinkles.
9853e7b7-39bd-411c-83bf-43d178bb3a51 Line a large rimmed baking sheet with non-stick foil or parchment paper.
9853e7b7-39bd-411c-83bf-43d178bb3a51 Dissolve baking soda in water and set next to the stove.
9853e7b7-39bd-411c-83bf-43d178bb3a51 In a microwave-safe bowl or Pyrex measuring cup, heat the peanut butter for 30 seconds or until it is soft and warm. Add the vanilla to the peanut butter.
9853e7b7-39bd-411c-83bf-43d178bb3a51 Combine the 2 tablespoons water, sugar and corn syrup in a large, heavy, nonstick saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until a candy thermometer reads 275F. Lower heat slightly, add butter and and peanuts and stir constantly over medium until candy thermometer reads 300 degrees.
9853e7b7-39bd-411c-83bf-43d178bb3a51 Remove from heat. Quickly stir in baking soda mixture and softened peanut butter mixture. Pour candy onto prepared cookie sheet and spread as thinly as you can. If you have trouble spreading it, grab a second sheet of parchment paper or non-stick foil and press it down slightly. It should be no more than 1/2 inch thick, but preferably thinner.
9853e7b7-39bd-411c-83bf-43d178bb3a51 Sprinkle the finely chopped nuts over the top if desired.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spread 1/4 cup of the almonds on a non-stick cookie sheet and bake for 6-8 minutes or until toasted and aromatic. Set aside. If you prefer you can just toast them quickly in a dry skillet or use almonds that have already been toasted.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 Line a 13×9 inch pan or other rimmed pan with parchment paper and set next to stove.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 Place butter, water and salt in a heavy bottomed (I use a nonstick anodized black pan), 2 or 3 quart saucepan and melt over medium heat. When butter is completely melted, add sugar. Set a deep fry thermometer in pan, being careful that bulb is not touching bottom of pan. Cook mixture over medium heat, stirring once or twice until it reaches 240 degrees F.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 At 240 degrees, add the remaining 1/2 cup sliced almonds to sugar mixture. After adding almonds, stir constantly, keeping heat at medium, until mixture reaches 290 degrees F. If temperature is not rising at a slow and steady rate, raise heat a tiny bit until mercury starts rising. (going from 240 to 290 should not take any longer than 13 minutes). When mixture reaches 290 degrees F (better a little above than below), immediately remove from heat and stir in baking soda. It will bubble a bit and the candy will develop air bubbles. Pour into parchment lined pan. The mixture should be kind of a bubbly blob at this point and if you are on track, the saucepan will be relatively clean after you've dumped the blob of candy onto the parchment. Mixture should begin to firm and butter may pool and separate, Do not pour off any excess butter if this happens, and don't panic if the toffee doesn't set immediately. If you cooked the toffee to 290, your candy should set. Sometimes it just takes longer.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 Scatter chopped chocolate across top of hot almond mixture and let chocolate melt into and over the candy as candy firms. Using back of a spoon, spread melted chocolate evenly over candy.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 Crush your toasted almonds and sprinkle over melted chocolate. Let candy cool for 1/2 hour at room temperature. Transfer to refrigerator or freezer and chill for about 1 hour to set the chocolate.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 When chocolate is set is set, lift candy from pan by grasping parchment. Break candy into large chunks.
30f17def-38b4-49c6-bdc0-90702c746898 Makes about 10 ounces
6fe659ab-7302-4427-a3fa-ed3e70ea8a39 Let mixture cool to about 170 degrees F. then stir in pecans and vanilla.
6fe659ab-7302-4427-a3fa-ed3e70ea8a39 In a 3 to 3 1/2 quart saucepan, combine the sugar, cream, corn syrup and salt.
6fe659ab-7302-4427-a3fa-ed3e70ea8a39 Set pan over medium heat and bring mixture to a boil. Cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until mixture reaches 236 degrees F..
6fe659ab-7302-4427-a3fa-ed3e70ea8a39 Remove from heat at 236 degrees and butter, but do not stir.
6fe659ab-7302-4427-a3fa-ed3e70ea8a39 Let mixture cool to about 170 degrees F. then stir in pecans and vanilla.
6fe659ab-7302-4427-a3fa-ed3e70ea8a39 Beat with a spoon by hand until candy is slightly thick and begins to lose its gloss.
6fe659ab-7302-4427-a3fa-ed3e70ea8a39 Quickly drop heaping tablespoons onto a tray lined with parchment paper and allow candy to set.
67e9124f-6e55-4be3-8d4c-054de1c4367e Line a 9x5 loaf pan with parchment or nonstick foil.
67e9124f-6e55-4be3-8d4c-054de1c4367e Melt butter over medium-low heat. Add golden syrup, sugar and condensed milk. Cook, stirring gently, over medium-low heat to 245 degrees F. Remove from heat, add vanilla and beat with a wooden spoon for 1 minute. Dump into lined pan and let cool. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
67e9124f-6e55-4be3-8d4c-054de1c4367e Note: If you have a scale, it's a good idea to weigh out your condensed milk rather than just eyeball it.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Line a large rimmed baking sheet (around 17x12 inches) with nonstick foil.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Put 2 cups of broken pretzels (or minis) onto the rimmed baking sheet, then add 2 cups of Fritos -- you can leave them whole or break them up. Throw in the peanuts.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Unwrap peanut butter cups, but don't throw them in quite yet.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Place butter in a large non-stick saucepan and melt over medium heat. When butter is melted, stir in brown sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil and boil for 1 minute, stirring once or twice.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Working quickly, drizzle hot sugar mixture over Frito mixture, stirring a little to coat the Fritos and Pretzels. Immediately place in the oven and bake for 8 minutes.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c After 8 minutes, pull from oven and sprinkle on the unwrapped peanut butter cups. If you want, you can also throw in some Reese's candies or chocolate chips.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Allow the mixture to cool slightly.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c Put the chopped chocolate (or chips) in a large microwave-safe bowl and heat on high for 30 seconds. Stir and repeat until chocolate is melted and smooth. Drizzle the melted chocolate over the candy. Allow it to set at room temperature or let it cool somewhat and then transfer to the freezer to quick set it.
955215fa-9325-4f7d-9f19-565a7873fa2c When chocolate is set, lift from pan and break the candy up as you would almond toffee. You can eat it cold or let it come back down to room temp.
313d2cd6-e633-40f0-be7e-3307bf9caf5b Place cream in a microwave-safe glass measuring cup. Microwave 1 minute or just to boiling. Submerge tea bag in cream. With back of spoon, press tea bag firmly against sides of the cup to release flavor. Steep for 10 minutes, pressing bag halfway through and before removing.
313d2cd6-e633-40f0-be7e-3307bf9caf5b Place white morsels in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Pour chai flavored cream over white morsels and place bowl in microwave. Microwave on high for 30 seconds, then stir. Repeat until smooth.
313d2cd6-e633-40f0-be7e-3307bf9caf5b Place melted chai morsel mixture in refrigerator and chill until mixture is thick enough to scoop.
313d2cd6-e633-40f0-be7e-3307bf9caf5b Using a spoon, scoop chai mixture out of the bowl and form into marble size balls -- you can make them whatever size you like. Set the little chai balls on a plate covered with waxed paper. Place in freezer for 30 minutes.
313d2cd6-e633-40f0-be7e-3307bf9caf5b In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate morsels and vegetable shortening on high for 1 1/2 minutes, stopping every 30 seconds to stir. Stir and microwave for one minute more, stirring halfway through. Dip frozen chai balls in melted chocolate and refrigerate until chocolate sets.
bcdab622-e49a-4119-8178-86fe782905d9 Let cool at room temperature for about an hour, then transfer to the refrigerator or freezer to chill and set. I usually use the freezer.
bcdab622-e49a-4119-8178-86fe782905d9 Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
bcdab622-e49a-4119-8178-86fe782905d9 Line a 10x15 inch pan with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
bcdab622-e49a-4119-8178-86fe782905d9 Lay Saltines side-by-side over bottom of pan - sides touching.
bcdab622-e49a-4119-8178-86fe782905d9 Combine butter and sugar in a large saucepan and bring to a gentle boil. If the butter is cold, let it warm slightly before adding the sugar. When mixture starts to boil, set timer for 3 minutes and boil, stirring once or twice. Pour over crackers and spread evenly.
bcdab622-e49a-4119-8178-86fe782905d9 Bake in oven for 5 minutes. Quickly sprinkle chocolate over hot candy and let stand for about 3 minutes or until chocolate starts to melt. Spread chocolate over crackers, then sprinkle with nuts. Note: If chocolate isn't melting fast (mainly, if you are using chips instead of chocolate chocolate), throw the pan back in the oven for a minute.
bcdab622-e49a-4119-8178-86fe782905d9 Let cool at room temperature for about an hour, then transfer to the refrigerator or freezer to chill and set. I usually use the freezer.
84b32cfa-8872-41a7-a790-87c4bba2197a Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 or a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
84b32cfa-8872-41a7-a790-87c4bba2197a Put 2 cups of Bran Flakes cereal in a large mixing bowl and crush to make about 1 cup.
84b32cfa-8872-41a7-a790-87c4bba2197a Add the 1/3 cup milk, 2 eggs, oil and vanilla and stir by hand or with low speed of a mixer. Add the brown sugar and let stand for 10 minutes.
84b32cfa-8872-41a7-a790-87c4bba2197a In a separate bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, soda and salt, and in another bowl mash the banana.
84b32cfa-8872-41a7-a790-87c4bba2197a Stir the mashed banana into the bran mixture, then add the flour mixture and stir until well blended. Stir in the walnuts.
84b32cfa-8872-41a7-a790-87c4bba2197a Spread evenly in the prepared loaf pan and bake for 50 to 55 minutes.
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9 ½ x 5 ½ inch loaf pan. If you are worried about the bread sticking, grease the pan and line with a strip of parchment. Flour sides.
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 Combine the mashed bananas and the eggs in a large bowl and set aside.
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 In a second large mixing bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, instant pudding mix, baking soda,and salt. Make sure to mix it very, very well.
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 Add the mashed banana mixture to the dry mixture and stir until thoroughly blended.
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 Pour the oil over the batter and mix with a heavy duty scraper until blended.
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 Stir in the coconut and chocolate
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 Empty batter into the loaf pan and bake at 325 for about an hour and 15 minutes (check at an hour).
6da3a0d0-408e-4a4d-b66e-d0be9b7bfa56 Let cool for an hour or so.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch metal loaf pan.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 Brown the butter in a saucepan or skillet and set it aside.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 In a mixing bowl, mash the bananas with a fork (or potato masher), then stir in the eggs.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 In a separate bowl, very thoroughly mix together the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, salt and spices. It's very important that all ingredients are evenly distributed, so take the time to really mix well.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture in thirds, stirring until evenly blended.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 Pour the browned butter over the top and stir until fully blended.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan, then sprinkle almonds over the top. Sprinkle sugar over the almonds.
604ffc94-80a1-4a19-b0c7-232a91df2ce4 Bake on center rack for about 1 hour. Bread should rise up and have a nice domed top.
6f0ca7bd-4685-4bbd-83b0-2e06bffd2dbe Preheat oven to 350°. Grease 3 small (3x5 inch) loaf pans and line with strips of parchment if desired.
6f0ca7bd-4685-4bbd-83b0-2e06bffd2dbe Whisk together flour, baking soda and salt; set aside.
6f0ca7bd-4685-4bbd-83b0-2e06bffd2dbe In a mixing bowl, using a big spoon or a heavy duty scraper, stir the butter, sugar and sour cream until well blended. Stir in the beaten egg and the vanilla.
6f0ca7bd-4685-4bbd-83b0-2e06bffd2dbe Add the mashed bananas and stir until blended, then add the flour mixture and stir until blended. Stir in nuts (if using).
6f0ca7bd-4685-4bbd-83b0-2e06bffd2dbe Divide the batter among the loaf pans and set on a rimmed baking sheet.
6f0ca7bd-4685-4bbd-83b0-2e06bffd2dbe Bake for 42-45 minutes or until the internal temperature of the bread (you can poke a meat thermometer in it) is around 200 or slightly over.
6f0ca7bd-4685-4bbd-83b0-2e06bffd2dbe Makes 3 loaves and each loaf serves about 4 people.
5759bb91-b949-415a-bd63-f8933bb1e754 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch or two 8x4 inch loaf pans. Line with strips of parchment, then grease again and dust with flour. Alternatively, you can line the inside of the pans with nonstick foil and skip greasing.
5759bb91-b949-415a-bd63-f8933bb1e754 In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt, then whisk in the cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves.
5759bb91-b949-415a-bd63-f8933bb1e754 In a large bowl beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the vanilla extract, rum and sour cream. Beat until blended. Add flour mixture and stir until blended, then stir in bananas. Lastly, stir in the chocolate chips. Batter should be fairly thick.
5759bb91-b949-415a-bd63-f8933bb1e754 Spoon the batter into the pan; bake for 10 minutes at 350. Reduce the temperature to 300 degrees and bake for 80 minutes until the bread pulls away slightly from the sides of the pan and a toothpick inserted comes away clean. I use a meat thermometer and take it out when it has reached at least 205 degrees.
5759bb91-b949-415a-bd63-f8933bb1e754 Let the bread cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes, then loosen from edge of pan and let cool completely.
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease the bottom and short sides of an 8 ½ by 4 ½ or a 9x5 inch loaf pan and line with a strip of parchment. Grease again, then dust with flour.
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 Whisk together both of the flours, sugar, baking soda, salt, and salt. When you whisk, do it very thoroughly so that all dry ingredients are evenly distributed.
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork, then stir in the sour cream, eggs, and vanilla.
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 With a heavy duty scraper, stir the dry ingredients into the banana mixture.
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 Pour the melted butter and oil over the batter and stir with a heavy scraper until well blended – do not overbeat, just gently fold.
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 Transfer batter to the pan and spread evenly. Sprinkle nuts over the top.
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 Bake for 60 minutes or until it appears cracked on top and a toothpick inserted comes out clean
6f4a81b5-ddcb-4b46-878a-d08660cdab55 Let cool for about half an hour, then loosen from pan. Let cool for another half hour, then remove from pan and let cool completely.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a a 9x5 inch loaf pan, line with a strip of parchment, grease again and dust with flour.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a In a small mixing bowl, beat the softened cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Stir in the egg and vanilla. Set aside.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt and sugar. For best results, whisk for at least a minute to ensure all of the ingredients are thoroughly blended.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a In a mixing bowl, mash the bananas, then add the eggs, oil, buttermilk and vanilla and stir until blended.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a Add flour mixture to banana mixture and stir until combined.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a Pour all but about 2 tablespoons of batter in the loaf pan. Spoon cream cheese mixture on top of batter, then spoon remaining 2 tablespoons of banana bread batter over so it has a marbled look.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a Bake in the lower third of the oven for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
d316f3bb-6d8e-48d4-bcea-2c9769a2d14a Let cool for 15 minutes. Loosen sides of loaves with a knife, then carefully turn from pan and let cool completely before slicing. If you want, chill slightly before serving so that the cream cheese mixture will be cool rather than room temperature.
1a282821-5a1a-4525-98fa-3320cb259bdf Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease and flour an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch or a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
1a282821-5a1a-4525-98fa-3320cb259bdf In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt and sugar. For best results, whisk for at least a minute to ensure all of the ingredients are thoroughly blended.
1a282821-5a1a-4525-98fa-3320cb259bdf In a mixing bowl, mash the bananas, then add the eggs, oil, buttermilk and vanilla.
1a282821-5a1a-4525-98fa-3320cb259bdf Add flour mixture to banana mixture and stir until combined. Fold in nuts.
1a282821-5a1a-4525-98fa-3320cb259bdf Pour into loaf pan. Bake at 325° for 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 hours or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool on wire rack.
383f1f87-d7b0-46e7-81bb-a517ac58447b Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease two 8 ½ by 4 ½ inch loaf pans. Dust with flour.
383f1f87-d7b0-46e7-81bb-a517ac58447b Mash the bananas with a fork or potato masher and set aside. They should still be slightly lumpy.
383f1f87-d7b0-46e7-81bb-a517ac58447b In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt.
383f1f87-d7b0-46e7-81bb-a517ac58447b In a mixing bowl, using a rubber scraper or large mixing spoon, mix together the shortening and sugar so that it is like a gritty paste. If using vanilla, add that too. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating with the scraper (or spoon) until mixed. Mix in bananas, then add the nuts if using.
383f1f87-d7b0-46e7-81bb-a517ac58447b Using the rubber scraper, fold in the flour mixture and stir until fully blended, then stir in the walnuts.
383f1f87-d7b0-46e7-81bb-a517ac58447b Divide batter between the pans and spread evenly.
383f1f87-d7b0-46e7-81bb-a517ac58447b Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until fully cooked.
391447b6-cfea-4235-a17f-9ef4dc9e2757 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. I like using a Pyrex loaf pan that I’ve greased and lined lengthwise with a sling of parchment or foil. The parchment/foil is optional, but good insurance.
391447b6-cfea-4235-a17f-9ef4dc9e2757 If you do not weigh your flour, sift it and then measure one cup. Mix the flour, baking powder and cocoa powder together very well and set aside.
391447b6-cfea-4235-a17f-9ef4dc9e2757 In a mixing bowl, mash the bananas. Stir in the egg until well mixed, then stir in the butter and salt (if using unsalted butter). Stir in the vanilla and brown sugar. With a heavy duty scraper or mixing spoon, gradually stir in the flour mixture. When well blended, stir in the chocolate chips and half of the pecans.
391447b6-cfea-4235-a17f-9ef4dc9e2757 Spread mixture in the loaf pan, then sprinkle top with pecans and cinnamon sugar
391447b6-cfea-4235-a17f-9ef4dc9e2757 Bake the bread at 350 for about 1 hour (check it after about 45 minutes) or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Let the bread cool for about 20 minutes, then gently run a knife between bread and sides of pan to loosen. Do not remove bread from pan quite yet. Allow it to cool completely, then turn from pan or lift.
f1e354d7-8f68-4de4-aff4-4992cefe59fc Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
f1e354d7-8f68-4de4-aff4-4992cefe59fc Whisk together the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda and salt. This step is important, so be sure to whisk or stir very, very, well to make sure baking soda is evenly distributed.
f1e354d7-8f68-4de4-aff4-4992cefe59fc In a mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time.
f1e354d7-8f68-4de4-aff4-4992cefe59fc Add flour mixture to butter mixture, stirring until blended.
f1e354d7-8f68-4de4-aff4-4992cefe59fc Fold in the bananas, vanilla and walnuts, then transfer to the pan.
f1e354d7-8f68-4de4-aff4-4992cefe59fc Bake 50-60 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean. If using a glass loaf pan the bread may take up to 75 minutes.
56560e96-a667-4813-809f-5382a502eba7 Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan and line with a strip of parchment paper.
56560e96-a667-4813-809f-5382a502eba7 On medium speed of an electric mixer, beat together mashed bananas, yogurt (or substitute), tahini, melted butter and vanilla. Add sugars; beat until combined.
56560e96-a667-4813-809f-5382a502eba7 Whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt , then stir into the banana mixture until evenly blended. Fold in chocolate.
56560e96-a667-4813-809f-5382a502eba7 Pour batter into prepared pan and sprinkle top with sesame seeds or nuts.
56560e96-a667-4813-809f-5382a502eba7 Bake at 350°F for 55 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Let cool completely, then remove from pan.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Preheat oven to 325. Grease bottom and 1/2 inch up the sides of an 8x4 inch loaf pan and line with a strip of parchment. Also, grease a small 1 cup capacity custard cup for extra batter. Alternatively, skip this and use an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch 6 cup capacity loaf pan.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Put the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and spices in a bowl and whisk for a minute.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg, sugar, and vegetable oil until smooth, then whisk in the vanilla and the milk.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Mash the banana with a fork or potato masher (or your whisk!), making sure you have 10 oz or 1 1/4 cups. Add to the batter and stir until blended.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Add the flour mixture in 3 parts, stirring after each addition.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Fold 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts. The batter should be fairly thick.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Scrape batter into prepared loaf pan, but makes sure you leave room for it to climb up the sides. Try to keep it about an inch from the top. Put remaining batter in a custard cup.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Draw a knife through it to release air bubbles. Sprinkle top with remaining nuts. Pour remaining batter into custard cup.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Bake for about 65 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean. If using a larger loaf pan start checking at 45 minutes. The custard cup version should be done in 40.
710c36bd-f45d-4bc9-8eff-0159dd1af99b Loosen sides with a knife, but do not remove from pan. Let cool in pan for about 20 minutes, then remove from pan and let cool for several hours. Preferably, let cool then freeze and thaw. The bread has an even better texture after being frozen and thawed.
38e66064-7a21-4835-ad37-cb87d9520270 Preheat the oven 350°F Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
38e66064-7a21-4835-ad37-cb87d9520270 Whisk or sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Make sure all the ingredients are very thoroughly mixed at this point because the batter is thick.
38e66064-7a21-4835-ad37-cb87d9520270 Combine the sugar and butter in the bowl of a stand mixer and beat until creamy. Scrape sides of bowl and add the eggs one at a time, beating just until blended.
38e66064-7a21-4835-ad37-cb87d9520270 Add the vanilla and the bananas and stir well, then add the flour mixture and the buttermilk alternately, mixing until blended.
38e66064-7a21-4835-ad37-cb87d9520270 Stir in the walnuts.
38e66064-7a21-4835-ad37-cb87d9520270 Transfer batter to loaf pan and bake for about 60 to 75 minutes (test it after 60) or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
38e66064-7a21-4835-ad37-cb87d9520270 Let cool on a rack for 10 minutes.Loosen edges with a knife and let cool for another 30 minutes, then invert from pan and let cool completely.
dd9e5cd8-53c3-4595-bdf4-027ee6482019 Preheat the oven 350°F Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan. I always use Pyrex for this one.
dd9e5cd8-53c3-4595-bdf4-027ee6482019 In a large bowl, thoroughly whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
dd9e5cd8-53c3-4595-bdf4-027ee6482019 Combine the sugar, eggs, oil, and vanilla in a mixing bowl and mix just until blended.
dd9e5cd8-53c3-4595-bdf4-027ee6482019 Add the bananas and sour cream and mix until just blended. Scrape down the sides of the bowl, add the flour mixture, and mix until just blended.
dd9e5cd8-53c3-4595-bdf4-027ee6482019 Transfer batter to loaf pan and bake for about 75 minutes (test it after 60) or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
dd9e5cd8-53c3-4595-bdf4-027ee6482019 Let cool on a rack for 10 minutes.Loosen edges with a knife and let cool for another 30 minutes, then invert from pan and let cool completely.
24698577-a186-47c1-9bc2-842e71ac27a9 Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake at 350 for 45 minutes to an hour. My loaves usually take a full hour.
24698577-a186-47c1-9bc2-842e71ac27a9 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. I suggest lining it lengthwise with a strip of parchment paper for easy lifting, but that is optional.
24698577-a186-47c1-9bc2-842e71ac27a9 Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon, then whisk to make sure dry ingredients are well blended.
24698577-a186-47c1-9bc2-842e71ac27a9 Beat sugar and eggs with a whisk until light and fluffy, about 10 minutes (I used a stand mixer with whisk attachment for this). Drizzle in the oil. Add mashed bananas, creme fraiche or sour cream, and vanilla.
24698577-a186-47c1-9bc2-842e71ac27a9 Fold in the flour mixture and stir until blended, then stir in the nuts (if using).
24698577-a186-47c1-9bc2-842e71ac27a9 Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake at 350 for 45 minutes to an hour. My loaves usually take a full hour.
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 Preheat the oven to 350°.
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 Grease a 10x5x3 1/2 inch loaf pan (see note regarding other sizes).
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 In one bowl, whisk together the sugar, flour, baking soda, baking powder, nutmeg and salt.
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, then stir in the mashed bananas.
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and mix together until just combined.
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 Stir in the melted butter until fully incorporated.
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 Pour the batter into prepared pan (or pans) and bake until a skewer or cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour and 10 minutes.
cd450b26-7c6a-4830-8f80-9756f2425885 Let cool completely before slicing.
5dd4d49e-bace-4757-bbe9-71aa1c22abc2 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 9x5 inch loaf pan or two 8x4 inch loaf pans.
5dd4d49e-bace-4757-bbe9-71aa1c22abc2 Put all the ingredients in a large mixing bowl and beat on medium speed, scraping side and bottom of bowl often, until well blended. Pour into the pan (or pans).
5dd4d49e-bace-4757-bbe9-71aa1c22abc2 Bake the large loaf for 55 to 65 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. For smaller loaves, start checking at 45 minutes.
5dd4d49e-bace-4757-bbe9-71aa1c22abc2 Let cool in the pan for about 30 minutes, then carefully remove from pan. Let the bread cool before slicing.
4855dac3-b12d-4fde-970e-0bf1f0ad284c Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch loaf pan or line the inside with nonstick foil.
4855dac3-b12d-4fde-970e-0bf1f0ad284c In a large mixing bowl, whisk together melted butter, oil, brown sugar and cocoa powder until smooth. Whisk in the egg, and vanilla.
4855dac3-b12d-4fde-970e-0bf1f0ad284c Whisk in baking soda, salt and cinnamon until fully blended.
4855dac3-b12d-4fde-970e-0bf1f0ad284c Add flour and stir until it is absorbed, then stir in mashed bananas and chocolate chips.
4855dac3-b12d-4fde-970e-0bf1f0ad284c Transfer to the loaf pan and sprinkle more chocolate chips on top if desired.
4855dac3-b12d-4fde-970e-0bf1f0ad284c Bake for 50 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
4855dac3-b12d-4fde-970e-0bf1f0ad284c Let cool in pan for 10 to 15 minutes, then loosen with a knife and let cool completely before removing from the pan. If you used a foil lined pan, just let it cool in the pan and then lift it out.
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Line the pan with a strip of parchment, then dust with flour.
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 In a large bowl, whisk together the oat flour, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon; set aside.
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 Put the bananas in a mixing bowl and beat them with your electric mixer until they are fully mashed. Pour the bananas into a small bowl and set aside.
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 In the mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugar until creamy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating until fluffy and scraping bowl often. Beat in the vanilla and the milk.
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 Fold the flour mixture into the batter until it is incorporated. Do not overbeat.
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 Stir in the mashed bananas, then stir in the nuts (if using).
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 Spread the batter evenly in the pan and bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
24a93077-1760-4759-be65-e7460bae4ae4 Let cool in the pan for about 20 minutes, then carefully remove from pan.
29fb28a8-1ddc-45d0-973d-4cba09cb49c1 Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan (no smaller) and line with a strip of parchment if desired.
29fb28a8-1ddc-45d0-973d-4cba09cb49c1 Whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt and set aside.
29fb28a8-1ddc-45d0-973d-4cba09cb49c1 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the sugar and oil. Add the eggs and beat on high speed, incorporating a lot of air into the mixture. Beat in the vanilla and almond extract.
29fb28a8-1ddc-45d0-973d-4cba09cb49c1 Combine the mashed banana and coconut milk, then add to the batter alternately with the flour mixture.
29fb28a8-1ddc-45d0-973d-4cba09cb49c1 Pour the batter to the prepared baking pan and bake for 60 to 75 minutes (mine took 70) or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean.
29fb28a8-1ddc-45d0-973d-4cba09cb49c1 Let cool for about half an hour, then remove from pan.
bb3b3f71-a343-4e2d-8272-f9e38089053c Let cool in the pan for a few minutes, then carefully loosen sides by sliding a knife between the loaf and the pan.
bb3b3f71-a343-4e2d-8272-f9e38089053c Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease bottom only of an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch loaf pan. If desired, line vertically with a strip of parchment paper to make a sling.
bb3b3f71-a343-4e2d-8272-f9e38089053c In a large mixing bowl, mix together the self rising flour and the sugar. Add the eggs, buttermilk and vanilla and stir until well blended, then stir in the oil.
bb3b3f71-a343-4e2d-8272-f9e38089053c Lastly, mash the bananas and stir them into the batter along with the nuts.
bb3b3f71-a343-4e2d-8272-f9e38089053c Spread batter evenly in the baking pan and bake for 60-65 minutes.
bb3b3f71-a343-4e2d-8272-f9e38089053c Let cool in the pan for a few minutes, then carefully loosen sides by sliding a knife between the loaf and the pan.
bb3b3f71-a343-4e2d-8272-f9e38089053c Let cool until bread feels sturdy enough to lift from pan, then remove from pan and set on a rack to cool completely.
3cb888ee-5546-4ec0-8727-abbfa0be58b1 Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease muffin pans or line with paper liners.
3cb888ee-5546-4ec0-8727-abbfa0be58b1 Combine the flours, sugar, flaxseed, baking soda, salt, nutmeg, and ginger in a medium bowl and whisk thoroughly with a fork.
3cb888ee-5546-4ec0-8727-abbfa0be58b1 Whisk together the oil, eggs, bananas, and buttermilk in a large bowl until well combined.
3cb888ee-5546-4ec0-8727-abbfa0be58b1 Add the dry mixture to the wet ingredients, and mix well with a fork until everything is well incorporated. Fold in the chocolate chips.
3cb888ee-5546-4ec0-8727-abbfa0be58b1 Scoop the batter into the muffin pans, filling the cups three fourths full. (An ice cream scoop works well for this purpose.)
3cb888ee-5546-4ec0-8727-abbfa0be58b1 Bake for 18 to 22 minutes until muffins are golden brown and the tops spring back when touched. Cool them in the pan for about 5 minutes, then remove to a wire rack.
dbfbacc5-485b-45d1-961a-5416e6ee03eb Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease and flour a loaf pan (around 9x5, but a little over if possible) and line with a strip of parchment. Dust with flour. Alternatively, you can use two 8x4 inch loaf pans.
dbfbacc5-485b-45d1-961a-5416e6ee03eb With an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until well mixed. Add honey and beat well. Add eggs and bananas and beat until blended, then stir in sour cream and vanilla.
dbfbacc5-485b-45d1-961a-5416e6ee03eb In a separate bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda and salt together for about 15 seconds.
dbfbacc5-485b-45d1-961a-5416e6ee03eb Add the flour mixture to the banana mixture and stir until fully blended, then stir in nuts and chocolate chunks. Pour into pan.
dbfbacc5-485b-45d1-961a-5416e6ee03eb Bake until firm on top and toothpick inserted comes out with moist crumbs or internal temperature is between 205 and 210 -- about 70 minutes (cover loosely with foil after 40).
dbfbacc5-485b-45d1-961a-5416e6ee03eb Let cool in pan set on a rack for 30 minutes, then remove from pan and let cool completely.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Make sure the rack in the center.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 Grease and flour an 8 ½ x 4 ½ x 2 ½ inch loaf pan. Line with a strip of parchment if desired, then grease the parchment and dust with more flour. Set the loaf pan on two stacked baking sheets (or use one insulated sheet). This is supposed to protect the bottom from burning.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 Whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt and nutmeg.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 In a small bowl, mash the bananas with the lemon juice and zest (if using), then stir in the rum if using.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 Melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons of the butter together in the microwave or using your favorite method.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 With an electric mixer (I use a handheld), beat the remaining stick (8 tablespoons) of butter at medium speed until creamy. Add the sugars and beat for another 2 to 3 minutes, until light and smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition, then beat in the vanilla. The batter will look curdled, and it will continue to look curdled as you add ingredients. By hand or using the lowest speed of mixer, add half the flour mixture. Pour in the milk and stir until blended, then add the remaining flour mixture. Scrape down the bowl and mix in the mashed bananas.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 Pour a little less than half the batter (I weighed out 16 oz) and blend with the melted chocolate to make a chocolate batter. Drop alternating spoonfuls of both batters into the prepared pan, then very carefully draw a knife through the batter in a zig-zag fashion just to get a marble effect going.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 Bake for 80 to 90 minutes, or until a knife inserted deep into the center of the cake comes out clean. NOTE: Check after 30 minutes and if the cake starts to brown too much, cover it loosely with a foil tent.
a62d2cf3-30ba-479a-8648-ff54bf988871 Transfer the cake to a cooling rack and let it rest for about 15 minutes before unmolding (I let mine cool longer), then let the cake cool to room temperature directly on the rack.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 Preheat oven at 350°. Grease an 8-1/2" x 4-1/2" loaf pan and set aside.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 Mash the bananas and set aside.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 In a mixing bowl, beat together eggs, oil and maple syrup and set aside.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 In a large bowl mix together flour, flaxseed meal, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 Add egg mixture and mashed bananas alternately to dry ingredients, stirring until dry ingredients are moistened. Do not over mix. Pour into prepared pan.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 Combine cinnamon and brown sugar and toss with walnuts. Sprinkle over batter.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 Bake 55-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean.
3c1a4a18-9abf-479d-839f-73d5cb1fdb14 Let cool before slicing. This bread is slightly crumblier than some others.
64528333-2042-49bf-a2e5-8ca31b0f58df Preheat oven at 350°F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Line with a strip of parchment if desired.
64528333-2042-49bf-a2e5-8ca31b0f58df Thoroughly whisk together flour, flax, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
64528333-2042-49bf-a2e5-8ca31b0f58df In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, oil and vanilla.
64528333-2042-49bf-a2e5-8ca31b0f58df Add the bananas and flour mixture alternately to the egg mixture, stirring until blended. It will be very thick. Stir in the nuts.
64528333-2042-49bf-a2e5-8ca31b0f58df Bake 55-60 minutes, then let cool for about 20 minutes before loosening from pan. Remove from pan and let cool completely before slicing.
1030c8b2-cf03-4699-b3e0-f1ace74f51e7 Preheat oven to 300 degrees F.
1030c8b2-cf03-4699-b3e0-f1ace74f51e7 Grease and flour an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch or a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Line with a strip of parchment paper.
1030c8b2-cf03-4699-b3e0-f1ace74f51e7 In a small bowl, thoroughly stir together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and cinnamon.
1030c8b2-cf03-4699-b3e0-f1ace74f51e7 In a mixing bowl, stir together the oil, brown sugar, vanilla, eggs and bananas.
1030c8b2-cf03-4699-b3e0-f1ace74f51e7 Add half the flour mixture and stir until incorporated, then add the Coca Cola and remaining flour mixture and stir until mixed. Stir in the pecans.
1030c8b2-cf03-4699-b3e0-f1ace74f51e7 Pour into pan. Bake for about 75 minutes (1 hour and 15 minutes).
86fc9fa1-e544-41ec-a11b-e6155cd27c34 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour an 8x4 inch loaf pan.
86fc9fa1-e544-41ec-a11b-e6155cd27c34 In a mixing bowl, beat together the butter and sugar.
86fc9fa1-e544-41ec-a11b-e6155cd27c34 Add the egg and beat until light and fluffy, then add bananas, buttermilk and vanilla and stir until smooth. Batter may look curdled at this point.
86fc9fa1-e544-41ec-a11b-e6155cd27c34 Thoroughly whisk or sift together the baking soda, salt and flour, then gradually add the flour mixture to the batter and stir with a rubber scraper until incorporated. Add nuts if using.
86fc9fa1-e544-41ec-a11b-e6155cd27c34 Pour into pan and smooth to edges. Bake for 45 minutes, and if banana bread isn't done continue baking for another 15 or so. Bread is done when a skewer or pick inserted comes out clean.
d26fe9a9-bdd2-4ad7-a562-e99c464193e3 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
d26fe9a9-bdd2-4ad7-a562-e99c464193e3 In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter and sugar until creamy.
d26fe9a9-bdd2-4ad7-a562-e99c464193e3 With mixer on low speed, beat in the eggs one at a time. Increase speed to high and beat for 30 seconds. Beat in vanilla.
d26fe9a9-bdd2-4ad7-a562-e99c464193e3 In a second bowl, thoroughly whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt. Add to the batter and stir by hand until mixed. Stir in the bananas, then stir in the sour cream and nuts.
d26fe9a9-bdd2-4ad7-a562-e99c464193e3 Pour into the pan (make sure to leave at least an inch for it to rise, so not quite full) and bake for 55 minutes to an hour or until a meat thermometer inserted in the center registers between 205 and 210.
d47f6e24-fd75-44dc-abb6-fcb7ef941ddf Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Thoroughly grease about 24 muffin cups.
d47f6e24-fd75-44dc-abb6-fcb7ef941ddf In a large mixing bowl, beat together the egg and mayonnaise. Add the ripe bananas and beat until smooth. You can do this by hand or preferably, with a handheld electric mixer.
d47f6e24-fd75-44dc-abb6-fcb7ef941ddf Beat in the sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, baking soda and salt. Stir in the flour.
d47f6e24-fd75-44dc-abb6-fcb7ef941ddf Divide the batter between muffin cups (it should be about 2/3 of the way full) and bake for about 25 minutes or until muffins are set. Let cool slightly, then turn from pan. The muffins have flat tops, so I like to serve them upside down with a dab of cream cheese icing. To make as a loaf, bake in a 9x5 inch baking pan for 1 hour.
9dbd255d-cf53-4878-ad27-575880cb8e7d Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour an 8 ½ by 4 ½ inch metal loaf pan.
9dbd255d-cf53-4878-ad27-575880cb8e7d In a medium size bowl, thoroughly mix together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and graham cracker crumbs.
9dbd255d-cf53-4878-ad27-575880cb8e7d In a large mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the butter until creamy and smooth. Add the sugar and continue beating for another 3 minutes or until mixture is light and creamy. With the mixer on lowest speed, gradually add egg a few tablespoons at a time. When all the egg is incorporated, beat on high for 1 minute. Beat in the vanilla and the mashed banana.
9dbd255d-cf53-4878-ad27-575880cb8e7d With a mixing spoon, gradually stir in the dry mixture, followed by the pecans.
9dbd255d-cf53-4878-ad27-575880cb8e7d Bake the bread in the lower third (not complete bottom, but not right in the center) of the oven for about 50 minutes or until it is brown and fully set. Let cool in pan for about 10 minutes, then carefully invert onto a cooling rack and let cool completely.
7a656db4-8f93-4684-9a6e-e62964069f1e Preheat oven to 275 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan, line with parchment paper and grease the parchment. Dust with flour. This is important, because the loaf is rather sticky!
7a656db4-8f93-4684-9a6e-e62964069f1e In a blender, puree the bananas, sugar and baking soda.
7a656db4-8f93-4684-9a6e-e62964069f1e Empty banana mixture into a mixing bowl. Mix in the eggs and the flour alternately, stirring until well blended.
7a656db4-8f93-4684-9a6e-e62964069f1e Mix in the oil, buttermilk and salt, beating with a spoon until blended and smooth. Add the vanilla (if using) and the nuts.
7a656db4-8f93-4684-9a6e-e62964069f1e Pour batter into prepared loaf pan and bake for 2.5 hours (though check for doneness at 2). Let cool completely, then carefully remove from the pan. If baking at 300, check at 1 .5 hours.
7a656db4-8f93-4684-9a6e-e62964069f1e Internal temperature of banana bread should be around 205 so if you are not sure you can stick a probe in it to test.
e2ffdf27-d361-413e-baba-14bcaeeccd69 Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Spray a 12 indentation mini bar pan with flour-added baking spray.
e2ffdf27-d361-413e-baba-14bcaeeccd69 In a large mixing bowl, mash the banana with a hand-held electric mixer or a spoon (depending on ripe it is). Beat in the sugar and the egg and continue beating until smooth.
e2ffdf27-d361-413e-baba-14bcaeeccd69 Beat in the vanilla and oil, then beat in the baking powder, baking soda and salt.
e2ffdf27-d361-413e-baba-14bcaeeccd69 By hand, stir in the flour, then stir in the milk.
e2ffdf27-d361-413e-baba-14bcaeeccd69 Divide the batter equally among all 12 indentations and bake on center rack for about 25 minutes or until golden.
e2ffdf27-d361-413e-baba-14bcaeeccd69 Let cool for 10 minutes, then carefully remove from the pan.
e0a76393-d688-490f-90eb-c0e3e454dfc9 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch metal loaf pan.
e0a76393-d688-490f-90eb-c0e3e454dfc9 In a large bowl, stir together the flour, bran, baking soda, baking powder, salt, nutmeg and cinnamon.
e0a76393-d688-490f-90eb-c0e3e454dfc9 In a mixing bowl, stir together the mashed bananas, yogurt, syrup and oil.
e0a76393-d688-490f-90eb-c0e3e454dfc9 Add the flour mixture to the yogurt mixture and stir until blended. Pour in the pan and bake on center rack for about 55 minutes.
e0a76393-d688-490f-90eb-c0e3e454dfc9 Let cool completely.
3944a646-a390-410e-a875-75aa07771fa8 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
3944a646-a390-410e-a875-75aa07771fa8 In a large mixing bowl using an electric mixer, beat the butter and both sugars until creamy. Beat in the vanilla.
3944a646-a390-410e-a875-75aa07771fa8 Add the eggs one at a time, beating until mixed. Beat in the milk, baking soda dissolved in water and the salt. When mixed, beat in the bananas, then stir in the flour. Stir in the pecans.
3944a646-a390-410e-a875-75aa07771fa8 Pour into the pan and bake on center rack for 45 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with moist crumbs
a819ad97-d833-4f32-9454-53f5f92ab14e Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch metal loaf pan and dust with flour. If you have some, line the bottom with parchment. This bread is kind of sticky.
a819ad97-d833-4f32-9454-53f5f92ab14e Mix together the flour, soda, cinnamon and salt and set aside.
a819ad97-d833-4f32-9454-53f5f92ab14e In bowl of stand mixer, beat the sugar, butter and egg. Beat in the bananas, followed by the vanilla and the milk.
a819ad97-d833-4f32-9454-53f5f92ab14e Add the flour mixture and stir until blended.
a819ad97-d833-4f32-9454-53f5f92ab14e Stir in all but 2 tablespoons of the pecans and the butterscotch morsels. Sprinkle the pecans on top of the banana bread and bake for 1 hour. After 45 minutes, lay a sheet of foil over the bread to prevent over-browning. Let bread cool in pan on a rack for about 15 minutes, then remove from pan.
55d39192-359b-45f8-af95-550b2be5b865 Preheat oven to 350 F. Rub a loaf pan with oil and line with a rectangle of parchment. Alternatively, you can use 3 small (3x5 inch) loaf pans.
55d39192-359b-45f8-af95-550b2be5b865 Mix together the soy milk and vinegar; set aside for about 2 minutes.
55d39192-359b-45f8-af95-550b2be5b865 Stir together flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.
55d39192-359b-45f8-af95-550b2be5b865 Beat together the oil, brown sugar and granulated sugar, then beat in the bananas. Continue beating on high until very light. Reduce speed to low and add milk/vinegar mixture.
55d39192-359b-45f8-af95-550b2be5b865 By hand, stir the flour mixture into the banana mixture, being careful not to overbeat. I like stirring flour mixture in with a heavy duty scraper. Sprinkle some nuts on top if using.
55d39192-359b-45f8-af95-550b2be5b865 Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool on a rack for about 15 minutes then flip from pan. Makes 1 awesome loaf.
55d39192-359b-45f8-af95-550b2be5b865 If using small loaf pan, check at 35 minutes.
5b074a02-3340-4514-89e8-26569c5e2d51 Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. and grease five muffins cups.
5b074a02-3340-4514-89e8-26569c5e2d51 Mix together the mashed banana, sugar, vegetable oil and egg yolk. Stir in the sour cream and vanilla.
5b074a02-3340-4514-89e8-26569c5e2d51 Mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. By hand, stir flour mixture into banana mixture.
5b074a02-3340-4514-89e8-26569c5e2d51 Scoop up batter and divide evenly among greased cups.
5b074a02-3340-4514-89e8-26569c5e2d51 Make topping. Mix together brown sugar, flour, salt, and cinnamon. Stir in nuts. Add melted butter and stir until you have moist crumbs. Sprinkle tops of muffins with crumbs (you will have leftovers).
5b074a02-3340-4514-89e8-26569c5e2d51 Bake on center rack at 400 degrees for 8 minutes.
5b074a02-3340-4514-89e8-26569c5e2d51 Reduce oven heat to 350 degrees F and bake for another 15 minutes or until a cake tester or toothpick inserted in the muffins comes out clean. My muffins didn’t really seem done, but the toothpick came out free of crumbs so I knew they were.
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 Preheat oven 400 degrees F. Line 8 jumbo muffin tins with liners.
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 Beat the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl until creamy. Add the eggs and beat for another minute. Stir in the bananas, vanilla and buttermilk.
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 Mix together the flour, baking powder and soda; gradually add flour mixture to banana mixture, stirring just until blended. Stir in the chocolate chips. Divide batter evenly among muffin tins.
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 Set muffins on center rack of oven and close door.
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 Bake muffins at 400 degrees for 5 minutes.
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 REDUCE oven heat to 375 degrees F. and bake muffins at 375 degrees F for about 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out with moist crumbs.
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 Makes 8 Jumbo Muffins
90244ccc-d617-4c5b-a926-f10114e65812 *********If using unsalted butter, add 3/8 tsp. salt
2459ed9b-97d5-4e9d-93bc-d8a0ff911533 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray two 8x4 inch loaf pans with flour-added cooking spray.
2459ed9b-97d5-4e9d-93bc-d8a0ff911533 Stir flour, sugars, baking powder, salt and cinnamon together in a large mixing bowl.
2459ed9b-97d5-4e9d-93bc-d8a0ff911533 Combine mashed bananas, milk, peanut butter, oil, vanilla and egg in a second bowl. Add banana mixture to flour mixture, stirring just until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour batter into the two loaf pans and bake on center rack for 50 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick or cake tester inserted in the middle comes out clean.
2459ed9b-97d5-4e9d-93bc-d8a0ff911533 Cool in pans for 10 minutes. Remove from pans; cool thoroughly on a wire rack. Wrap and store overnight before serving.
df850103-ee65-4018-a3f8-d613848e295b Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease and flour a 6 ½ x 3-inch loaf pan or use an 8x4 inch loaf pan. This recipe is designed for a smaller loaf pan, so if you use a standard size pan you'll need to adjust the bake time (and expect the loaf to be short and stumpy).
df850103-ee65-4018-a3f8-d613848e295b Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla extract.
df850103-ee65-4018-a3f8-d613848e295b Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt together in a separate bowl, then add to creamed mixture alternately with banana. Fold in chopped white chocolate. Scrape batter into pan and spread evenly.
df850103-ee65-4018-a3f8-d613848e295b Bake for 30 minutes until a tester inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Let cool 10 minutes in the pan, then turn out onto a plate.
df850103-ee65-4018-a3f8-d613848e295b When cool, melt remaining white chocolate and drizzle over the top of the loaf.
0cd33293-6b43-4301-99f1-d50ad277ea45 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan. For a taller loaf, use a slightly smaller pan such as an 8x4 or 8 1/2 by 4 1/2.
0cd33293-6b43-4301-99f1-d50ad277ea45 Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt together in a mixing bowl; set aside.
0cd33293-6b43-4301-99f1-d50ad277ea45 Beat cream cheese, butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add bananas, eggs and vanilla and beat until mixed.
0cd33293-6b43-4301-99f1-d50ad277ea45 Add flour mixture and stir until it is almost mixed in. Add the ¾ cup of the pecans and stir pecans mixed and flour has disappeared - -batter should still be pretty lumpy.
0cd33293-6b43-4301-99f1-d50ad277ea45 Pour into pan. Toss remaining 1/4 cup pecans with cinnamon/sugar mixture and sprinkle over top. Bake at 350 for 1 hour and 10 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan.
0cd33293-6b43-4301-99f1-d50ad277ea45 Makes 1 loaf
5ef13692-b86c-4559-bfc4-8d821e4deb3c Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch metal loaf pan and line with a strip of parchment if desired.
5ef13692-b86c-4559-bfc4-8d821e4deb3c Whisk flour, baking soda and salt together in a bowl. Set aside.
5ef13692-b86c-4559-bfc4-8d821e4deb3c Cream butter and sugar in a mixing bowl, using high speed of an electric mixer; add eggs, one by one, beating 30 seconds after each egg. Beat in vanilla and bananas. Stir in pineapple.
5ef13692-b86c-4559-bfc4-8d821e4deb3c Stir flour mixture into banana mixture in three parts -- mixing (not beating) with a spoon. Stir in pecans. Transfer to loaf pan.
5ef13692-b86c-4559-bfc4-8d821e4deb3c Set loaf pan on a cookie sheet, place on center rack of oven and bake for 60 minutes or until loaf appears done and a skewer inserted in center comes out with moist crumbs.
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease the bottom and short sides of an 8 ½ by 4 ½ or a 9x5 inch loaf pan and line with a strip of parchment. Grease again, only going up about ¼ inch up the sides, then dust with flour.
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 Whisk together both of the flours, sugar, baking soda, salt, and salt. Add cinnamon (if using). When you whisk, do it very thoroughly so that all dry ingredients are evenly distributed.
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork, then stir in the yogurt, eggs, and vanilla.
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 With a heavy duty scraper, stir the dry ingredients into the banana mixture.
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 Pour the melted butter and coconut oil over the batter and stir with a heavy scraper until well blended – do not overbeat, just gently fold.
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 Transfer batter to the pan and spread evenly. Sprinkle nuts over the top.
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 Bake for 60-70 minutes or until it appears cracked on top and a toothpick inserted comes out clean
01a7b985-2a37-4d28-a340-4383362771e2 Let cool for about half an hour, then loosen from pan. Let cool for another half hour, then remove from pan and let cool completely.
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease the bottom and short sides of an 8 ½ by 4 ½ or a 9x5 inch loaf pan and line with a strip of parchment. Grease again, only going up about ¼ inch up the sides, then dust with flour.
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb Mix together the flours, sugar, baking soda, salt, salt and cinnamon.
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb In a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork, then stir in the cottage cheese, eggs, and vanilla.
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb With a heavy duty scraper, stir the dry ingredients into the banana mixture.
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb Pour the melted butter and oil over the batter (don't forget this step! It's easy to forget the butter since it's usually not added last) and stir with a heavy scraper until well blended – do not overbeat, just gently fold. Stir in the nuts (if using).
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb Transfer batter to the pan and spread evenly.
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb Bake for 60-70 minutes or until it appears cracked on top and a toothpick inserted comes out clean
3527bb7b-b542-4f95-bd6a-a116ab23c8cb Let cool for about half an hour, then loosen from pan. Let cool for another half hour, then remove from pan and let cool completely.
db964b23-f06a-4faa-96fa-18d4a6084518 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
db964b23-f06a-4faa-96fa-18d4a6084518 In a mixing bowl, beat the softened butter and both sugars until creamy. Beat in the egg and egg white, then beat in the vanilla extract, baking soda and salt. Stir in the almond flour until it is well blended, then stir in the chocolate and nuts.
db964b23-f06a-4faa-96fa-18d4a6084518 Using a medium cookie scoop or a tablespoon, drop rounds onto a parchment lined baking sheet and bake for about 12 to 15 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned.
db964b23-f06a-4faa-96fa-18d4a6084518 Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for about 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely.
b29a34d0-3783-4176-92dd-0fd70e9235ef Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
b29a34d0-3783-4176-92dd-0fd70e9235ef Mix together the almond flour, baking soda and salt and set aside.
b29a34d0-3783-4176-92dd-0fd70e9235ef In a second bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the sugar, vanilla, almond butter and coconut oil for 1 minute, scraping the side of the bowl often. Beat in the flax egg.
b29a34d0-3783-4176-92dd-0fd70e9235ef Add the almond flour mixture and stir by hand until blended.
b29a34d0-3783-4176-92dd-0fd70e9235ef If the dough looks too wet, sprinkle in some more almond flour. The dough should be the consistency of thick mashed potatoes. Stir in chocolate chunks.
b29a34d0-3783-4176-92dd-0fd70e9235ef Using a tablespoon, scoop up 18 heaps of dough and arrange on the parchment lined baking sheet spacing about 2 1/2 inches apart. Bake one sheet at a time for about 10-12 minutes.
b29a34d0-3783-4176-92dd-0fd70e9235ef Let cool on the baking sheet for about 3 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely.
0fc59a16-d1dc-44bb-bd7b-586f253ad5e2 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Rub the pan generously with butter to grease.
0fc59a16-d1dc-44bb-bd7b-586f253ad5e2 Separate the eggs first. Put the whites in the bowl of a stand mixer with a whisk attached (or a large mixing bowl) and put the egg yolks in another bowl. Let them sit while you prepare the chocolate.
0fc59a16-d1dc-44bb-bd7b-586f253ad5e2 Combine the chopped chocolate and 7 tablespoons of butter in a microwave safe bowl and heat on high, stirring after 60 seconds, then every 30 seconds or until melted and smooth. You can do this in a saucepan if you prefer.
0fc59a16-d1dc-44bb-bd7b-586f253ad5e2 Meanwhile, in the bowl of a stand mixer with the whisk attached, beat the egg whites until stiff. Scrape them onto a plate or into a bowl to wait.
0fc59a16-d1dc-44bb-bd7b-586f253ad5e2 In the same bowl you used for the egg whites, beat the granulated sugar and yolks until pale and yellow. Scrape in the melted chocolate and beat until mixed, then stir in the cornstarch and salt (if using) and vanilla (if using). Lastly, fold the beaten egg whites.
0fc59a16-d1dc-44bb-bd7b-586f253ad5e2 Transfer the batter to the springform pan and bake for about 20 minutes. Do not overbake.
0fc59a16-d1dc-44bb-bd7b-586f253ad5e2 Allow the cake to cool for 30 minutes. It will collapse as it cools. Loosen from edges, remove springform and serve with your favorite berries.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the inside of an 8-inch square metal pan with nonstick foil.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Bring the eggs to room temperature by dropping them in bowl with warm water or leaving them out.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Melt the coconut oil in a saucepan set over medium-low heat. When it is about halfway melted, add the chocolate chips, then stir in the cocoa powder. Remove from heat and stir until smooth.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Put the eggs in the bowl of a stand mixer and beat with the whisk attachment for about a minute. With mixer going, add coconut sugar and beat until mixture is pale and thick and tan (another 2 minutes). Beat in the salt and vanilla.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Pour the melted chocolate mixture into the mixing bowl and beat until blended, then stir in the gluten-free flour.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Spread batter in pan and bake for 25-27 minutes or until top appears set.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Quick cool the brownies by setting the hot pan in a larger pan (a roasting pan) filled with ice water. The ice water should come about 2/3 of the way up the sides of the smaller pan. Allow the small pan of brownies to sit in the water bath for about 30 minutes, then remove from water and lift foil of brownies from pan.
ba9596d6-076d-4f9e-97f3-a048616f6e71 Alternately, you can just let the brownies cool at room temperature for several hours, but I’ve always had great luck with the quick cool method so I tend to use that every time.
2e23ac96-f68c-4dd1-973b-5db7232f0179 Preheat oven to 350°F. Line inside of a 9 ½ by 5 ½ inch loaf pan with nonstick foil.
2e23ac96-f68c-4dd1-973b-5db7232f0179 With a hand-held mixer, beat the egg, brown sugar, salt, baking soda and vanilla in a bowl until well blended and sort of foamy (about a minute). Add the peanut butter and beat until blended, then stir in the chocolate chips and nuts.
2e23ac96-f68c-4dd1-973b-5db7232f0179 Scrape into the loaf pan and smooth to make an even layer.
2e23ac96-f68c-4dd1-973b-5db7232f0179 Bake for 20-25 minutes or until bars appear set. Let cool completely, then lift from pan and if desired, put the bars in the refrigerator for a few hours to chill (this makes them chewier). Cut into squares.
5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Line a 9 inch square metal pan with nonstick foil or use parchment if you prefer.
5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 In a large metal saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Remove from heat and add the chocolate. Let the chocolate sit in the hot butter for about 2 minutes to melt, then stir until smooth. Stir in the cocoa powder, coffee/water mixture, salt and vanilla.
5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer (I use my stand mixer with the whisk for this), beat the eggs. Gradually add the granulated sugar, beating constantly. Beat for about 5 minutes or until mixture is thick and yellow.
