5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 Add the peanut butter to the chocolate mixture and stir until blended, then pour the chocolate peanut butter mixture into the egg mixture and stir until blended. Stir in in peanuts, but hold off on stirring in the chocolate chips if the batter is still warm.
5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 Pour the mixture in the pan. Make the peanut butter swirl mixture (you can double it if you want) by mixing 1 tablespoon of unsweetened peanut butter with 1 teaspoon of melted butter and ½ teaspoon of honey. Taste test, then add a dash of salt if you want. Drop mixture by spoonfuls over top of batter and drag a knife through to make a swirl pattern. Sprinkle chocolate chips over the top.
5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 Bake on center rack for 45 to 50 minutes. Remove from the oven. The peanut butter swirl will have dried out a little, so what I like to do is take a few dabs of sweetened peanut butter and spoon just a tiny bit over the peanut butter swirl. Let the fresh peanut butter kind of melt over the baked on peanut butter so it will look less dry.
5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 Let cool completely, then chill for about 2 hours or until firm and cold. Lift from pan and cut.
5dc32acf-62c6-4790-93e0-981db8824a03 Alternatively, as soon as you take the brownies from the oven, plunge the pan into a roasting pan with ice water to quick cool. Put them in the refrigerator.
d212aa3d-97b4-4ae8-a1b0-851f66ae13b6 Mix together gluten-free flour, baking soda, salt; set aside.
d212aa3d-97b4-4ae8-a1b0-851f66ae13b6 In a mixing bowl, beat the shortening, butter and both sugars until creamy.
d212aa3d-97b4-4ae8-a1b0-851f66ae13b6 Add the egg and beat well, scraping sides of bowl often. Beat in the vanilla.
d212aa3d-97b4-4ae8-a1b0-851f66ae13b6 Add the flour mixture and stir until it is fully blended, then stir in the chocolate chips and nuts
d212aa3d-97b4-4ae8-a1b0-851f66ae13b6 Using a heaping tablespoon, scoop out about 18 gobs of dough and put them on a plate lined with plastic wrap. Cover and chill for several hours or overnight.
d212aa3d-97b4-4ae8-a1b0-851f66ae13b6 When ready to bake, preheat the oven and bake cookies 2 inches apart at 350 degrees F for about 10 to 12 minutes.
852a83cd-9a5b-4a23-a07f-755decb715d1 Whisk together the gluten free flour, baking soda and salt. Whisk in the oats and set aside.
852a83cd-9a5b-4a23-a07f-755decb715d1 In a mixing bowl whisk together the cooled melted butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla, then whisk in the egg.
852a83cd-9a5b-4a23-a07f-755decb715d1 With a heavy duty scraper or mixing spoon, stir in the flour/oat mixture. When fully blended, stir in the nuts, coconut and chocolate chips. Batter will be soft and will need to be chilled, so cover bowl and chill for 2 hours or until firm enough to scoop.
852a83cd-9a5b-4a23-a07f-755decb715d1 When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
852a83cd-9a5b-4a23-a07f-755decb715d1 Using a tablespoon measure, scoop dough onto parchment lined or unlined (for crisper cookies) baking sheets and shape into neat rounds. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until cookies are golden brown around the edges and slightly pale in the center. .
852a83cd-9a5b-4a23-a07f-755decb715d1 Sprinkle cookies with sea salt.
852a83cd-9a5b-4a23-a07f-755decb715d1 Let them cool on the baking sheet, then carefully transfer to a wire rack.
5986b9f0-5854-489c-a3d4-afd06b2257d9 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line two large baking sheets with parchment.In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the gluten free flour, coconut sugar, flax meal, xanthan gum, baking soda and salt.
5986b9f0-5854-489c-a3d4-afd06b2257d9 In a second bowl, whisk together the applesauce, vanilla and all but 2 tablespoons of the coconut oil.
5986b9f0-5854-489c-a3d4-afd06b2257d9 Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until blended. If the batter seems too greasy before you’ve add the last couple of tablespoons, you can leave them out and add the chocolate chips. Otherwise, add the remaining 2 tablespoons coconut oil and stir until you have a soft but scoopable dough. Stir in the chips.
5986b9f0-5854-489c-a3d4-afd06b2257d9 Scoop about 24 equal size portions of dough (about 40 grams each) and arrange 3 inches apart on baking sheets. Press down to make 1/2 inch thick rounds.
5986b9f0-5854-489c-a3d4-afd06b2257d9 Bake at 350 for about 12 minutes, turning the tray halfway after the first 8 minutes. For smaller cookies, divide the dough sections in half and bake the cookies at 325 for about 10 to 12 minutes.
28db63d7-1946-45f6-a3d4-b491adbdcdab Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square pan with nonstick foil.
28db63d7-1946-45f6-a3d4-b491adbdcdab Mix together almond flour, protein powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
28db63d7-1946-45f6-a3d4-b491adbdcdab In a second bowl, whisk together the melted butter and coconut sugar until blended, then whisk in the egg, almond butter and vanilla.
28db63d7-1946-45f6-a3d4-b491adbdcdab Fold the almond flour mixture into the butter mixture and stir until blended, then stir in the chocolate chips and nuts.
28db63d7-1946-45f6-a3d4-b491adbdcdab Press the mixture firmly into the pan and bake for about 18-20 minutes or until top appears dry. Let cool completely, then lift from pan and cut into squares.
e6fa5c24-59e1-4f97-bd31-3893fa1d21d6 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
e6fa5c24-59e1-4f97-bd31-3893fa1d21d6 In a mixing bowl, stir together gluten free flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and salt.
e6fa5c24-59e1-4f97-bd31-3893fa1d21d6 In a second bowl, mix brown sugar, shortening, molasses and vanilla.
e6fa5c24-59e1-4f97-bd31-3893fa1d21d6 Add flour mixture to brown sugar mixture and stir until mixed. Add 1 tablespoon of applesauce. If dough is dry, add a second. Otherwise, just use 1.
e6fa5c24-59e1-4f97-bd31-3893fa1d21d6 Divide the dough into 12 pieces and roll each piece into a ball.
e6fa5c24-59e1-4f97-bd31-3893fa1d21d6 Place the balls about 2 ½ inches apart on parchment lined baking sheets and press tops down slightly.
e6fa5c24-59e1-4f97-bd31-3893fa1d21d6 Sprinkle tops with sparkly sugar. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool for 2 minute on sheet, then transfer to wire rack to cool.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Stir flour, baking soda and salt together in a mixing bowl. Set aside
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 In a second bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the eggs until light and foamy. Add the sugar and vanilla and beat for another minute.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Stir the dry ingredients into the liquid ingredients. If the dough seems dry, add water one teaspoon at a time until it comes together. You may not need any.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Add the nuts (if using) and using your hands, knead them into the dough so they are evenly distributed. The dough will be thick, yet pliable and easy to shape.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Shape the dough into a 10 x 2 1/2 inch log directly on the baking sheet.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Bake log at 300 degrees F. for 40 minutes. It will spread a just a bit and the top should crack slightly. Remove from the oven and let cool for about 5 to 10 minutes.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Transfer log to a large cutting board and using a sharp knife, cut the log every 1/2 to 3/4 inch on the diagonal. Stand the cut biscotti on the baking sheet and bake at 300 for about 20-30 minutes. If you sliced the biscotti thinly (1/2 inch thick or less) check at 20 minutes.
24169960-411f-4ba1-afcd-adb881e7ab24 Let cool on a wire rack. It should crisp as it cools.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square metal pan with nonstick foil.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Beat the softened butter and both sugars with an electric mixer until creamy, scraping bowl often.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Add salt, vanilla and peanut butter and beat until incorporated. Beat in egg, the egg yolk and vanilla.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Add the gluten-free flour and stir until blended, then stir in the chocolate chunks.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Spread batter evenly in pan.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Bake on center rack for 28 to 30 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Let cool completely.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Melt the chocolate and coconut oil (or butter or shortening if you prefer) together in the microwave by heating at 30 second intervals and stirring. Drizzle over the bars and put in the refrigerator to quick set.
5be4d56e-fba6-4c23-87db-97fc6375b199 Lift the bars from the pan and cut into squares. They will get softer and absorb more moisture as they sit, so you may not want to serve them immediately. Store in the freezer or in a tightly closed zipper bag or box.
6ac41fbb-a7dc-4b20-b6a7-2d91e5ad68f2 Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line 6 muffins cups with paper liners.
6ac41fbb-a7dc-4b20-b6a7-2d91e5ad68f2 Put the bananas in a mixing bowl and mash them. Measure or weigh to make sure you have 2/3 of a cup mashed banana or 160 grams weight.
6ac41fbb-a7dc-4b20-b6a7-2d91e5ad68f2 Whisk the egg, melted coconut oil, honey and vanilla in with the banana.
6ac41fbb-a7dc-4b20-b6a7-2d91e5ad68f2 Add the almond flour, coconut flour, baking soda and salt; stir until blended.
6ac41fbb-a7dc-4b20-b6a7-2d91e5ad68f2 Divide batter between the muffin cups (it should come about 1/2 inch from the top) and bake 25 minutes or until muffins appear brown and set.
6ac41fbb-a7dc-4b20-b6a7-2d91e5ad68f2 Let the muffins cool for about 5 minutes in the pans, then remove from pans and let cool completely.
78cd19ab-cad5-40fb-b134-3e58683d7b05 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the inside of a 9x5 inch or an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch metal loaf pan with nonstick foil.
78cd19ab-cad5-40fb-b134-3e58683d7b05 Melt the coconut oil in a saucepan set over medium heat. When it is about halfway melted, add the chocolate and reduce heat to low. Stir until chocolate melts, then stir in the cocoa powder and 3/4 oz of chocolate chips.
78cd19ab-cad5-40fb-b134-3e58683d7b05 Beat the egg with an electric mixer for 1 minute. With mixer going, gradually add the coconut sugar and continue beating for 2 minutes. Add the honey and continue beating on high for 2 to 3 more minutes. Beat in salt and vanilla.
78cd19ab-cad5-40fb-b134-3e58683d7b05 Fold about 1/3 cup of the egg mixture into the warm chocolate mixture, then fold the chocolate mixture back into the bowl with the egg mixture. Stir in the coconut flour and almond flour.
78cd19ab-cad5-40fb-b134-3e58683d7b05 Spread batter in pan and sprinkle chocolate chips on top. Bake for 25-27 minutes or until top appears set. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
8c190229-1699-4ca2-9c30-aa8ddac1bea4 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the inside of an 8 inch square metal pan with nonstick foil.
8c190229-1699-4ca2-9c30-aa8ddac1bea4 Melt the butter in a saucepan set over medium heat. When it is about halfway melted, add the chocolate and reduce heat to low. Stir until chocolate melts, then stir in the cocoa powder and 1 oz of chocolate chips. Stir in only 1/2 cup of the sugar, then remove from heat.
8c190229-1699-4ca2-9c30-aa8ddac1bea4 Put the eggs in the bowl of a stand mixer and beat with the whisk attachment for about a minute. With mixer going, add remaining 1/2 cup sugar and continue beating for about 5 minutes or until mixture is pale and thick and falls off the whisk attachment in ribbons. Beat in the salt and vanilla.
8c190229-1699-4ca2-9c30-aa8ddac1bea4 Fold about 1/3 cup of the egg mixture into the warm chocolate mixture, then fold the chocolate mixture back into the bowl with the egg mixture. Stir in the gluten free flour.
8c190229-1699-4ca2-9c30-aa8ddac1bea4 Spread batter in pan and sprinkle chocolate chips on top.
8c190229-1699-4ca2-9c30-aa8ddac1bea4 Bake for 25-27 minutes or until top appears set. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
d263144b-2190-46a4-811c-4782559e4304 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
d263144b-2190-46a4-811c-4782559e4304 Combine the almond flour, coconut flour, baking soda and salt; set aside.
d263144b-2190-46a4-811c-4782559e4304 In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine the coconut sugar, coconut oil and almond butter. Beat until well combined, then beat in the vanilla and egg.
d263144b-2190-46a4-811c-4782559e4304 Add the almond meal mixture and stir until combined, then stir in the chocolate chips.
d263144b-2190-46a4-811c-4782559e4304 Shape the dough into 8 large balls. You can bake these immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.
d263144b-2190-46a4-811c-4782559e4304 Arrange on a parchment lined baking sheet, spacing 3 inches apart, and press tops down slightly.
d263144b-2190-46a4-811c-4782559e4304 Bake for 10-14 minutes (mine take 12). Let cool on the baking sheet for 3-5 minutes, then move them to a cooling rack to cool completely.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e Let the cake cool in the pan for 30 minutes before turning it out onto a rack to cool completely. Let cake cool completely before slicing. Note: I let mine cool completely in the pan and didn't have any issues.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8 1/2 x 4 1/2-inch loaf pan. Line with a strip of parchment if desired and dust with cocoa powder.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e Thoroughly whisk together the coconut flour and baking powder.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e In a large, microwave-safe bowl, melt the butter with the cocoa, stirring until well blended.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e Whisk the sugar, salt, vanilla, and eggs into the butter-cocoa mixture. Add the coconut flour and baking powder, whisking until smooth.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e Pour the batter into the prepared pan and let it rest for exactly 10 minutes.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e Bake until set, and a cake tester inserted into the middle comes out clean. Mine took exactly 35 minutes.
b410ddc4-6350-4b49-b1fe-adba4de5b43e Let the cake cool in the pan for 30 minutes before turning it out onto a rack to cool completely. Let cake cool completely before slicing. Note: I let mine cool completely in the pan and didn't have any issues.
0487bcab-a378-45c4-86ff-8f572d0708d7 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the inside of a 9×5 inch or 8 ½ by 4 ½ inch metal loaf pan with non-stick foil.
0487bcab-a378-45c4-86ff-8f572d0708d7 Melt the butter and chocolate together over medium low heat. Add half of the sugar to the warm chocolate and stir gently so that sugar dissolves somewhat in the hot chocolate. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
0487bcab-a378-45c4-86ff-8f572d0708d7 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat eggs for 2 minutes or until foamy and light. Add remaining 1/2 cup of sugar gradually to eggs and continue beating for another two minutes.
0487bcab-a378-45c4-86ff-8f572d0708d7 Fold about 1/3 cup of the egg mixture into the warm chocolate mixture, then fold the chocolate mixture back into the bowl with the egg mixture. Mix together the salt, xanthan gum and gluten free flour (or salt and regular flour) and fold into the batter, keeping it as light as possible.
0487bcab-a378-45c4-86ff-8f572d0708d7 Pour into pan and bake for 27-30 minutes or until top appears set. The toothpick test doesn’t really work with these – it will still come out wet. Internal temp should be around 190 degrees in center. Let cool completely and chill for several hours or until very cold and set. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
0487bcab-a378-45c4-86ff-8f572d0708d7 Store in the refrigerator.
783b0cff-64a1-4159-8d64-57c8d2d24057 Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread the pecan halves on a baking sheet and toast for about 7 minutes or until pecans are aromatic. Alternatively, you can toast them in a large skillet. Let the pecans cool.
783b0cff-64a1-4159-8d64-57c8d2d24057 Reduce oven heat to 325 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
783b0cff-64a1-4159-8d64-57c8d2d24057 In a large bowl, sift together powdered sugar, cocoa and salt. Stir in chopped chocolate and chopped pecans. Add egg whites and stir with a heavy duty scraper or large mixing spoon until mixture is shiny.
783b0cff-64a1-4159-8d64-57c8d2d24057 Using a generously heaping tablespoon measure, drop mounds of batter about 3 inches apart onto baking sheets. Bake until cookie tops are dry and crackled, about 20 minutes, rotating baking sheets halfway through. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for about 5 to 8 minutes, then carefully peel away from parchment and let cool completely.
144315a2-4e43-426f-9bc6-3532c75a2dbf Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
144315a2-4e43-426f-9bc6-3532c75a2dbf Measure the flour carefully. Pour a little over a cup in a bowl and stir it around. Now spoon it into the measuring cup and tablespoons. If you have a scale, it should weigh about 4.7 ounces.
144315a2-4e43-426f-9bc6-3532c75a2dbf In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and xanthan gum. Set aside.
144315a2-4e43-426f-9bc6-3532c75a2dbf In a mixing bowl, beat together softened butter and both sugars. Beat in vanilla, then add the egg and beat just until blended. Add the flour mixture and stir. Add the chocolate chips and stir until blended.
144315a2-4e43-426f-9bc6-3532c75a2dbf Scoop cookies up by tablespoons measures (slightly rounded) or rounded teaspoons and arrange on a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake cookies for about 10 minutes or until they appear set. Let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.
144315a2-4e43-426f-9bc6-3532c75a2dbf The yield is approximate. You can make 14 larger cookies or use smaller balls of dough and make up to 20. Keep a close eye on them as they bake because the edges brown rapidly.
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line two large baking sheet with parchment paper or nonstick foil.
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 Stir powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and salt together in a small bowl.
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 Place cold egg whites in very clean metal or glass mixing bowl.
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 With an electric mixer, beat until the egg whites are just past foamy and soft peaks are just beginning to form. Add the sugar mixture gradually (but not too gradually – a couple of tablespoons at a time is fine) and continue mixing on medium and scraping sides of bowl.
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 When dry ingredients are completely blended, beat for exactly two minutes. Mixture will thicken slightly, but it will not be light and fluffy like meringue. Stir in nuts and chocolate chips (if using).
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 Working quickly, drop heaping tablespoons of batter onto the baking sheets – try to keep them as tall as you can, but if they spread that is okay, spacing about 2 1/2 inches apart.
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 Bake the cookies on the center and lower rack for 10-12 minutes or until dry, puffed and cracked on the surface. If you like your cookies with very soft centers, take them out and let them cool. For slightly dryer (but still chewy) centers, turn off the oven and let the cookies sit in the “off” oven for 20 minutes, them remove from oven.
9832517e-a5b1-4033-9c4f-7147ab42ff64 Let the cookies cool for about 5 minutes on the parchment paper. Carefully remove cookies and let cool completely on a wire rack.
18946f1e-c85d-44f6-b6f8-1a3ca42439e1 Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Line 12 muffin cups with paper liners.
18946f1e-c85d-44f6-b6f8-1a3ca42439e1 In a saucepan, heat the butter over medium until it melts. Remove from heat and add the chopped chocolate. Let the chocolate sit in the hot butter for about 2 minutes, then stir until melted and smooth. Stir in the cocoa powder, coffee, salt and vanilla.
18946f1e-c85d-44f6-b6f8-1a3ca42439e1 In a mixing bowl using a handheld electric mixer, beat the eggs. Gradually add the granulated sugar, beating constantly. Beat for about 5 minutes – mixture should be very frothy and light. Beat in the almond butter until smooth.
18946f1e-c85d-44f6-b6f8-1a3ca42439e1 Stir in the chocolate mixture. Divide mixture evenly among cupcake cups (they’ll be a little less than halfway full) and bake on center rack for 18 minutes or until they appear set.
18946f1e-c85d-44f6-b6f8-1a3ca42439e1 Remove from the oven and let cool completely. I let mine cool, then chilled them to help develop the fudgy texture.
0b651849-9ffb-492c-acce-d4a1eb2f9035 Preheat the oven to 300°F . Line a 9 inch square metal pan with parchment paper. If making a half batch, use a 9x5 inch loaf pan instead.
0b651849-9ffb-492c-acce-d4a1eb2f9035 In a large mixing bowl, combine the cereal, cashews, almonds, pistachios, pecans, dried fruit, sesame seeds, flaxseed meal, and flaked coconut. Set aside.
0b651849-9ffb-492c-acce-d4a1eb2f9035 In a medium saucepan, combine the honey, brown sugar, salt, and cornstarch. Bring to a gentle boil over medium heat. Pour the mixture over the dry ingredients and toss until evenly coated.
0b651849-9ffb-492c-acce-d4a1eb2f9035 Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan. Use another piece of parchment paper to press down the mixture so that it is flat and evenly distributed to the corners of the pan. Remove top layer of parchment and bake for 30 minutes. Let cool completely in the pan for several hours.
0b651849-9ffb-492c-acce-d4a1eb2f9035 Turn the mixture out onto a cutting board, peeling away the parchment paper on the bottom. Using a serrated knife, cut into 16 squares. Store in a zipper-top bag or an airtight container at room temperature for about a week.
1a287b26-1f56-492d-a51a-141250deb210 Heat the oven to 300 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
1a287b26-1f56-492d-a51a-141250deb210 In a mixing bowl, combine all dry ingredients and make a well in the center.
1a287b26-1f56-492d-a51a-141250deb210 Add the oil, syrup and vanilla to the well, then mix everything together to form a soft dough.
1a287b26-1f56-492d-a51a-141250deb210 Empty the mixture onto the baking sheet and shape it into an 8 inch circle.
1a287b26-1f56-492d-a51a-141250deb210 Bake on center rack for about 12-14 minutes or just until cookies looks less shiny and appears set.
1a287b26-1f56-492d-a51a-141250deb210 Let cool directly on the baking sheet. When ready to decorate, use a cake lifter to put it on your decorating surface. This cookie cake freezes well.
4e3fd831-2aa7-4127-9743-664b84225f7b Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. Line a 9 inch round metal cake pan with foil and spray foil with cooking spray.
4e3fd831-2aa7-4127-9743-664b84225f7b With a handheld electric mixer, beat the butter and both sugars until creamy. Add the egg and beat until incorporated, then beat in the vanilla. Add the baking mix and stir to make a soft dough, then stir in the chocolate chips.
4e3fd831-2aa7-4127-9743-664b84225f7b Weigh out about 12 ounces of dough. If you don’t have a scale, just eyeball it and go with about 2/3 of the mixture. Put the dough in the center of the pan. Dampen your hands with a little water and press the dough into a circle so that it comes to about ½ inch from the sides and the cookie has plenty of room to spread.
4e3fd831-2aa7-4127-9743-664b84225f7b Bake the cookie at 300 F for about 30 to 33 minutes or until it appears set and lightly browned. Let cool in the pan for about 15 minutes, then carefully lift and let cool completely. You can decorate the cookie as soon as it’s cool or freeze it and decorate when you are ready.
4e3fd831-2aa7-4127-9743-664b84225f7b To make the icing, beat the butter until creamy. Gradually add the sugar and vanilla. Add milk as needed until you get the consistency you like. Pipe around edges of cookie cake.
7d2614c3-efc1-4199-ae05-464e168f6d86 Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a blender or coffee grinder, process 3/4 cup oats into a fine meal. Whisk together ground oats, cornstarch, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt.
7d2614c3-efc1-4199-ae05-464e168f6d86 In a large bowl, using a mixer, beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla. With mixer on low, gradually add oat mixture, beating until combined. Fold in raisins, and remaining oats.
7d2614c3-efc1-4199-ae05-464e168f6d86 In batches, drop dough in 2-tablespoonful mounds onto a parchment-lined baking sheet, 2 inches apart. Bake until cookies are golden brown at edges, 15 to 18 minutes. Let cool on sheet on a wire rack 2 minutes, then transfer to rack and let cool completely.
861b8ec4-70ef-4f23-b9b7-a52173accbc8 Heat the oven to 300 degrees F.
861b8ec4-70ef-4f23-b9b7-a52173accbc8 In a stand mixer, with the paddle attachment, mix the dry ingredients together. Add the liquid ingredients and paddle until well combined.
861b8ec4-70ef-4f23-b9b7-a52173accbc8 Scoop cookies firmly with an ice cream scoop onto a parchment-lined sheet pan. Flatten each mound of cookie dough fully with the palm of your hand.
861b8ec4-70ef-4f23-b9b7-a52173accbc8 Bake cookies for 8 minutes, or until golden brown. Store in an airtight container or eat right away!
a981b5ec-35db-4bc1-9c7b-edd3b4d706cc Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Line a 13x18 inch heavy duty rimmed baking pan with nonstick foil or parchment paper;
a981b5ec-35db-4bc1-9c7b-edd3b4d706cc In a large bowl, stir together the butter, corn syrup, sugar, salt, vanilla and baking powder. Add the oats and coconut and stir until thorough mixed. Spread the mixture as thinly as you can across the baking sheet.
a981b5ec-35db-4bc1-9c7b-edd3b4d706cc Set in preheated oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until edges are browned. Let cool completely on a wire rack. When cool, the cookie should be perfectly crisp. Break it into pieces.
a21741ba-72af-49a3-b1d9-d1552d8dc779 Preheat oven to 350°F. Have ready an ungreased or foil lined baking sheet. You can use parchment or nonstick foil, but it might cause the cookies to spread a little more.
a21741ba-72af-49a3-b1d9-d1552d8dc779 With an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla. Stir in the cocoa powder and beat until smooth, then stir in the coconut flour. Add the chocolate chips. At this point you can also stir in the walnuts, or you can leave them out and just sprinkle them on top of the unbaked cookies.
a21741ba-72af-49a3-b1d9-d1552d8dc779 Let the cookie dough sit for about 5 to 10 minutes to thicken (coconut flour absorbs moisture).
a21741ba-72af-49a3-b1d9-d1552d8dc779 Drop the cookie dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a baking sheet, leaving 2 inches between cookies. Bake 13 minutes, or until cookies are slightly set in the center. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to finish cooling.
16705531-0b4f-4154-938b-3204403a8748 Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line 6 muffin cups with foil liners or grease using your preferred method – I used a little butter and dusted it with extra cocoa powder. Foil cupcake liners would probably be ideal.
16705531-0b4f-4154-938b-3204403a8748 Mix the coconut flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt together in a bowl and set aside.
16705531-0b4f-4154-938b-3204403a8748 In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, agave, melted butter, and vanilla.
16705531-0b4f-4154-938b-3204403a8748 Add the flour mixture to the liquid mixture and stir until blended, then add chocolate chips.
16705531-0b4f-4154-938b-3204403a8748 Divide batter between 6 muffin cups and bake for about 15 minutes or until muffins appear set. Let cool in the pan for about 10 minutes, then carefully remove from muffin cups.
18a6ce87-bdd5-4d9e-94c0-2384aae60c59 Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square metal pan with nonstick foil.
18a6ce87-bdd5-4d9e-94c0-2384aae60c59 In a saucepan, heat the butter over medium, swirling every couple of minutes, until the butter foams and eventually starts to turn brown around the edges. Remove from heat and add the chocolate. Let the chocolate sit in the hot butter for about 2 minutes to melt, then stir until smooth. Stir in the cocoa powder, coffee/water mixture, salt and vanilla.
18a6ce87-bdd5-4d9e-94c0-2384aae60c59 In a mixing bowl using an electric mixer, beat the eggs. Gradually add the granulated sugar, beating constantly. Beat for about 5 minutes. Mixture should almost triple in volume (though I ‘m not sure mine did!). Beat in the almond butter until smooth.
18a6ce87-bdd5-4d9e-94c0-2384aae60c59 Add the chocolate mixture and beat until smooth. Pour the mixture in the pan. Bake on center rack for 45 to 50 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely, then chill for about 2 hours or until firm and cold. Lift from pan and cut. Alternatively, as soon as you take the brownies from the oven, plunge the pan into a roasting pan with ice water to quick cool. Put them in the refrigerator.
c67df95e-99f6-43e2-8579-9c8bdcd37be9 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the inside of 9×5 inch baking pan non-stick foil.
c67df95e-99f6-43e2-8579-9c8bdcd37be9 Stir together the rice flour, tapioca flour and salt; set aside.
c67df95e-99f6-43e2-8579-9c8bdcd37be9 In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. When butter starts to melt and coats pan bottom, add unsweetened chocolate and reduce heat to low. Stir constantly until chocolate is melted. Add 1/2 cup of the sugar to melted chocolate and stir over low heat for about 40 seconds. Remove chocolate mixture from heat and let cool for about 5 minutes. Stir in vanilla.
c67df95e-99f6-43e2-8579-9c8bdcd37be9 Meanwhile, using an electric mixer (hand-held or stand okay), beat eggs for a full 2 minute or until foamy and light. Gradually add remaining 1/2 cup of sugar to eggs and continue beating for another minute.
c67df95e-99f6-43e2-8579-9c8bdcd37be9 Using a rubber spatula, fold a small amount (about 1/3 cup) of the egg mixture into the warm chocolate mixture, then fold the lightened chocolate into the bowl with the egg mixture. Stir in the rice/tapioca flour/salt mixture, being careful not to over-mix. Pour into pan and bake for 25-28 minutes or until top is set. Let cool completely. Transfer to refrigerator and chill for a few hours or overnight. Lift from pan and cut.
4b70aaa7-2975-493c-bee7-2a1c381710ff Mix together the flour, baking soda, salt and xanthan gum. Set aside.
4b70aaa7-2975-493c-bee7-2a1c381710ff In a mixing bowl, beat the shortening and both sugars until creamy. Beat in the eggs, then beat in the vanilla.
4b70aaa7-2975-493c-bee7-2a1c381710ff Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and stir until blended, then stir in the chips and nuts.
4b70aaa7-2975-493c-bee7-2a1c381710ff Drop heaping teaspoons of dough 2 inches apart on parchment or nonstick foil lined baking sheets.
4b70aaa7-2975-493c-bee7-2a1c381710ff Bake one sheet at a time at 375 degrees F. for 10 minutes or until cookies are brown around the edges.
4b70aaa7-2975-493c-bee7-2a1c381710ff Let cool for about 5 minutes on baking sheets, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely.
0655f466-2e6c-498a-86d1-82738c39c7c0 Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line 36 mini muffin cups with paper liners. If you are halving the recipe, use 18.
0655f466-2e6c-498a-86d1-82738c39c7c0 Melt the butter in a large microwave-safe mixing bowl for about a minute or until melted and very hot. Add the chocolate and stir until it melts. If it doesn’t melt, microwave butter and chocolate together for another 30 seconds and stir. Stir the cocoa into the melted chocolate mixture.
0655f466-2e6c-498a-86d1-82738c39c7c0 In a food processor, puree the chickpeas, agave and salt until smooth. Add the eggs and vanilla and process until smooth. Pour the chickpea mixture into the bowl of melted chocolate and stir until blended. Make sure it’s sufficiently cool, then stir in chocolate chips.
0655f466-2e6c-498a-86d1-82738c39c7c0 Spoon batter into mini muffin cups dividing equally among the 36. Bake at 325 F for 20 minutes or until brownies appear set and a toothpick inserted comes out with moist crumbs rather than batter. Let cool completely.
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc In chilled bowl, beat cream just past the soft-peak stage. Fold a quarter of the egg mixture into chocolate mixture to lighten, then fold chocolate mixture back into remaining egg mixture. Fold in whipped cream. Transfer to prepared pans, smooth top, and tap filled pans lightly on work surface a few times to settle any air pockets.
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Butter insides of 2 mini springform pans (4 inch size) and line bottoms with circles of parchment paper.
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc Melt chocolate with coffee in a double boiler or bowl set over simmering water. Alternatively, you can use the microwave.
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc Whisk sugar and egg together in a metal stand-mixer bowl. Set the mixer bowl over a saucepan of simmering, not boiling, water, and whisk until mixture is warm to the touch and sugar is dissolved – make sure not to cook the mixture! Put on mixer stand and beat at medium speed until light and almost tripled in volume, about 3 minutes. Reduce speed to medium-low and continue beating another 2 minutes.
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc In chilled bowl, beat cream just past the soft-peak stage. Fold a quarter of the egg mixture into chocolate mixture to lighten, then fold chocolate mixture back into remaining egg mixture. Fold in whipped cream. Transfer to prepared pans, smooth top, and tap filled pans lightly on work surface a few times to settle any air pockets.
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc Place pans in larger (I used a 9 inch) baking pan. Add enough hot water to baking pan to come halfway up sides of cake pans. Bake 30 minutes. Open oven door 30 seconds to release any excess moisture that builds in oven. Continue baking until center of cake feels somewhat firm when pressed lightly with your fingers, another 15-20 minutes. Remove cakes from oven and let cool at room temperature (note, if baking the larger cakes you cool them in the closed oven for two hours).
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc Run a warm knife around inside of pans, and carefully remove from pans. Transfer to refrigerator and chill until very firm. Wrap in plastic wrap and keep chilled until ready to serve
b4bff20b-77a8-4c66-b793-00438ff3d7dc Remove cakes from refrigerator and return to room temperature. At least 1 hour before serving, preheat oven to its lowest setting. If you have just used the oven, turn it off. Unwrap cakes and set on oven proof serving plates. Warm them in the oven for about 20-30 minutes or until they are warm throughout.
d452defc-905f-4a6b-b14a-e303abd4d3f6 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8x8-inch square baking pan with non-stick foil or parchment
d452defc-905f-4a6b-b14a-e303abd4d3f6 Melt the dark chocolate and butter together in microwave or in a bowl set over simmering water.
d452defc-905f-4a6b-b14a-e303abd4d3f6 In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs with an electric mixer until frothy. Add the brown sugar and beat until smooth. Add the melted chocolate mixture to the egg-sugar mixture a little at a time and beat well.
d452defc-905f-4a6b-b14a-e303abd4d3f6 In a bowl, combine the nut meal, rice flour, salt and baking soda. Add the dry mixture to the chocolate mixture and stir until well mixed. Add the vanilla, beat another half a minute or so. Stir in the chocolate chips. Pour into the lined pan.
d452defc-905f-4a6b-b14a-e303abd4d3f6 Bake on center rack for 33 to 35 minutes, or until the brownies are set. Don't overcook.
d452defc-905f-4a6b-b14a-e303abd4d3f6 Cool on a wire rack; and remove the brownies from the pan by gripping the foil edges. Chill before cutting.
d452defc-905f-4a6b-b14a-e303abd4d3f6 Makes 9-12 servings.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir well then add the chocolate chips and pecans
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Add the oil, 2 tablespoons of the aquafaba (or almond milk) and vanilla to the dry ingredients and mix well. If the batter seems too dry, add about 1/2 tablespoon to 1 tablespoon more liquid.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Using a tablespoon or a small cookie scoop, scoop up the dough and attempt to shape it into balls. They might be a little messy, especially if you used the milk rather than the aquafaba. Pat down slightly.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Bake for about 15 minutes or until the edges are slightly browned.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Let cool on the pan for about 10 minutes, then transfer and let cool on the baking sheet. These are better when completely cool. I think they're also good frozen.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir well then add the chocolate chips and pecans
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Add the oil, 2 tablespoons of the aquafaba (or almond milk) and vanilla to the dry ingredients and mix well. If the batter seems too dry, add about 1/2 tablespoon to 1 tablespoon more liquid.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Using a tablespoon or a small cookie scoop, scoop up the dough and attempt to shape it into balls. They might be a little messy, especially if you used the milk rather than the aquafaba. Pat down slightly.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Bake for about 15 minutes or until the edges are slightly browned.
b782e0f2-118f-40df-bba3-f1936c58473c Let cool on the pan for about 10 minutes, then transfer and let cool on the baking sheet. These are better when completely cool. I think they're also good frozen.
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 Preheat the oven to 350 if you plan on baking right away.
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 Mix together flour, salt and baking soda. Set aside
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 With a spoon, mash together the Country Crock plant butter, cane sugar and coconut sugar until blended.
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 In a small bowl, whisk the flaxseed with 1 tablespoon water to combine. Add the flax and the vanilla and stir until blended, then stir in the flour mixture. Add the chocolate chips and chunks last.
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 Scoop the dough into 4 large mounds, each weighing a little more than 100 grams. This really depends on how generous you were with the chocolate
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 Time to bake! I baked one cookie right away (the one in the photo) and am chilling the rest of the dough. Put the cookie dough mound (or all of them) on a parchment lined baking sheet and press down to around ½ inch thick (like in the picture). Sprinkle with some pretzel salt or sea salt. Bake for 18 to 21 minutes. I think my cookie was done in about 19 minutes. Chilled dough might take a full 21.
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 Also, when you suspect the cookies are close to being ready, pull from the oven and squish the edges inward nudging the cookies into neat circle. a
c15caa87-17e3-4538-8453-e9ab75b93fe3 Allow the cookie (or cookies) to cool, then put in the freeze long enough to set the chocolate. Bring back to room temperature before serving.
6d36ff65-974e-474b-a81e-3519c5f9fe68 Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line 6 muffin cups with paper liners or grease with extra coconut oil.
6d36ff65-974e-474b-a81e-3519c5f9fe68 In a mixing bowl, stir together the coconut oil, pumpkin, aquafaba and vanilla.
6d36ff65-974e-474b-a81e-3519c5f9fe68 In a second bowl combine the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Add the Swerve (or sugar) and stir until uniformly blended.
6d36ff65-974e-474b-a81e-3519c5f9fe68 Add flour mixture to the pumpkin mixture and stir until blended. Stir in the chocolate chips. Batter will be thick.
6d36ff65-974e-474b-a81e-3519c5f9fe68 Divide the batter among muffin tins. It should be thick enough so that you are actually piling it.
6d36ff65-974e-474b-a81e-3519c5f9fe68 Put in the 400 degree oven and bake for 10 minutes. After first 10 minutes, reduce heat to 350 and bake for another 8 to 10 minutes (18-20 minutes total).
6d36ff65-974e-474b-a81e-3519c5f9fe68 Let the muffins cool for about 10 minutes, then carefully loosen from pan.
e0bdc519-11a5-4733-b90a-e203790404b0 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
e0bdc519-11a5-4733-b90a-e203790404b0 Stir together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt until very well blended. Add the brown sugar and pumpkin pie spice and mix again until well blended. Set aside.
e0bdc519-11a5-4733-b90a-e203790404b0 In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer or just a heavy duty rubber scraper, beat or mash the plant butter until creamy. Add the pumpkin, coconut milk and vanilla and stir with the mixer or by hand just until blended – no need to whip it.
e0bdc519-11a5-4733-b90a-e203790404b0 Add the flour mixture to the pumpkin mixture to make a fairly soft but scoopable dough, then stir in the chocolate chips. Using a medium cookie scoop, scoop out 14 rounds of dough. You can bake all the dough rounds immediately or put them on a plastic wrap lined plate, cover and chill.
e0bdc519-11a5-4733-b90a-e203790404b0 Space dough about 2 ½ inches apart on the baking sheet and bake at 350 for about 12-14 minutes. Let cool slightly on baking sheet, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
fed5a9bd-d701-41cd-a43c-93954502d1ea Preheat the oven to 350°F Have ready two parchment lined baking sheets. If you plan to chill the dough don’t preheat.
fed5a9bd-d701-41cd-a43c-93954502d1ea In a small bowl, mix together the flaxseed and water. Set aside.
fed5a9bd-d701-41cd-a43c-93954502d1ea In a large mixing bowl combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
fed5a9bd-d701-41cd-a43c-93954502d1ea Using an electric mixer, beat plant butter and sugar until creamy. Add the flax egg and vanilla and stir until well mixed
fed5a9bd-d701-41cd-a43c-93954502d1ea Gradually add the flour mixture and stir until combined, then add the chips, nuts and cherries (if using)
fed5a9bd-d701-41cd-a43c-93954502d1ea With a medium cookie scoop, scoop out about 20 mounds of dough and space about 2 ½ inches apart on two baking sheets. Press down slightly. For larger cookies, use a large scoop and scoop out about 12 mounds of dough.
fed5a9bd-d701-41cd-a43c-93954502d1ea Bake for about 10-12 minutes or until cookies appear set. Remove from oven. If the cookies have spread, tap in the edges a bit with the back of a spatula while the cookies are still hot. Set a few more chocolate chips on top of the hot cookies.
091ef005-2e69-42a4-a7b1-57f900f6c705 Mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
091ef005-2e69-42a4-a7b1-57f900f6c705 In a mixing bowl, beat the vegan butter, sugar, vanilla and date paste until creamy. You can do this with a mixer or by hand since the butter is already creamy and soft.
091ef005-2e69-42a4-a7b1-57f900f6c705 Add the flour mixture to the sugar mixture and stir by hand to make soft dough.
091ef005-2e69-42a4-a7b1-57f900f6c705 Using a medium size cookie scoop, scoop about 12 to rounds of dough onto a dinner plate and chill for about 30 minutes or until firm enough to roll.
091ef005-2e69-42a4-a7b1-57f900f6c705 Roll the rounds in cinnamon sugar.
091ef005-2e69-42a4-a7b1-57f900f6c705 Arrange rounds about 2 1/2 inches apart on a parchment lined baking sheet.
091ef005-2e69-42a4-a7b1-57f900f6c705 Bake at 350 for 12-14 minutes. Tops should appear set and slightly cracked. Let the cookies cool for about 5 minutes on the baking sheet, then carefully transfer to a wire rack and cool completely.
4df84ba2-120a-4f7e-8650-7c240b0a4650 First, you'll need to make some date paste. Take about 10 pitted Medjool dates (7 oz) and put them in a 2 cup glass measure or a saucepan if you prefer. Pour 1/2 cup boiling water over the dates and press them down so they are fully submerged in water. Let dates sit for about 20 minutes. They should absorb most of the water and you should not need to drain (though you can if you want thicker paste). Add soaked dates to food processor and process into a somewhat lumpy paste. You should have 1 cup (which should weigh about 10 oz) of paste. Pulse in food processor to make a paste. You'll only use half for this recipe.
4df84ba2-120a-4f7e-8650-7c240b0a4650 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
4df84ba2-120a-4f7e-8650-7c240b0a4650 In a mixing bowl, beat together 1/2 cup of date paste, coconut oil and vanilla. If you still have your food processor out from making date paste, you can process the ingredients instead.
4df84ba2-120a-4f7e-8650-7c240b0a4650 In a medium bowl, whisk together the almond flour, baking soda, salt, cocoa powder and arrowroot (or cornstarch)
4df84ba2-120a-4f7e-8650-7c240b0a4650 Add the dry mixture to the date mixture and stir to make a dough. Stir or knead in the chocolate chips.
4df84ba2-120a-4f7e-8650-7c240b0a4650 Cover and chill for about half an hour.
4df84ba2-120a-4f7e-8650-7c240b0a4650 Spoon dough by even tablespoons and shape into balls. Press to 1/4 inch thick. Bake 7 to 9 minutes. Let cool.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 In a medium size bowl, thoroughly stir together the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and sugar.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 In a second bowl (or in a 2 cup microwave-safe measuring cup) melt the plant butter in the microwave, stirring every 30 seconds, until gently melted.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 Add the maple syrup and vanilla to the melted plant butter.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 Add the syrup mixture to the flour mixture and stir with a heavy duty scraper until well mixed. Dough will be soft and a bit shiny.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 Stir in the chocolate chips. Put the bowl in the refrigerator for about 10 minutes or until it is thick enough to scoop.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 Using a rounded tablespoon or a medium cookie scoop, scoop out about 14 rounds of dough. Put them on a plastic wrap lined plate and chill until ready to bake or bake immediately.
ff91db8b-f27f-4797-af34-891fb5e8ec33 Arrange about 2 inches apart on a parchment lined baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 Preheat oven to 325F. Grease an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch loaf pan (original recipe called for a 9x5 inch pan) with coconut oil or your favorite vegan fat, then line with a strip of parchment paper and grease again.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 Pulse pistachios in a food processor until coarsely ground, then set aside about 1 tablespoon. Pulse until finely ground.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 In a mixing bowl, whisk or stir together lemon zest, flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, salt, and remaining pistachios. Make sure all of the dry ingredients are very thoroughly mixed.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, 1/3 cup melted coconut oil, and 1/2 cup water.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 Pour oil mixture into dry ingredients and fold with a rubber spatula to combine, being very careful not to overmix, as this will result in a gummy texture. The batter is fairly thick.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 Transfer to greased pan and spread evenly.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 Bake cake until golden brown all over, it springs back when gently pressed, and a tester inserted into the center comes out clean, 50–60 minutes (mine took a full 60 minutes in the 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch pan).
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 Let cool completely for at least two hours.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 Using parchment overhang, lift cake out of pan and place on rack. Peel away parchment.
0756c246-3441-488a-b945-81aad25037e7 To make the icing put 1 1/2 to 2 cups powdered sugar in a bowl and begin adding lemon juice one tablepoon at a time, stirring after each addition, until the icing is a pourable consistency. Drizzle over and down the sides, then sprinkle with reserved ground pistachios.
cb5d86cb-c5fe-4a44-952c-89ed3b97e3b9 Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
cb5d86cb-c5fe-4a44-952c-89ed3b97e3b9 Mix together the almond flour, baking soda and salt and set aside.
cb5d86cb-c5fe-4a44-952c-89ed3b97e3b9 In a second bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the sugar, vanilla, almond butter and coconut oil for 1 minute, scraping the side of the bowl often. Beat in the flax egg.
cb5d86cb-c5fe-4a44-952c-89ed3b97e3b9 Add the almond flour mixture and stir by hand until blended.
cb5d86cb-c5fe-4a44-952c-89ed3b97e3b9 If the dough looks too wet, sprinkle in some more almond flour. The dough should be the consistency of thick mashed potatoes. Stir in chocolate chunks.
cb5d86cb-c5fe-4a44-952c-89ed3b97e3b9 Using a tablespoon, scoop up 18 heaps of dough and arrange on the parchment lined baking sheet spacing about 2 1/2 inches apart. Bake one sheet at a time for about 10-12 minutes.
cb5d86cb-c5fe-4a44-952c-89ed3b97e3b9 Let cool on the baking sheet for about 3 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely.
0a6357d6-e32d-463d-83a7-70560b94fd3b Line a mini loaf pan (3x5 inch) with plastic wrap. If you don't have a mini loaf pan you can use a small bowl, custard cups or even muffin tins.
0a6357d6-e32d-463d-83a7-70560b94fd3b Measure out soy milk, then stir in 1 teaspoon of apple cider vinegar and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Allow mixture to stand for about 10 minutes so that it curdles and thickens.
0a6357d6-e32d-463d-83a7-70560b94fd3b Put the melted coconut oil and the canola oil in the bowl of a food processor or blender, then add the soy milk, lecithin and turmeric (if using). Process for about 2 minutes or until smooth.
0a6357d6-e32d-463d-83a7-70560b94fd3b Carefully pour mixture into the mini loaf pan, then transfer to the freezer for 1 hour to set.
0a6357d6-e32d-463d-83a7-70560b94fd3b You should get about 1 cup of vegan butter. To use it in baking, weigh out 114 grams for every half cup.
c507766d-b0e0-4cc7-8840-38e27c8e1bce Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease a 6 cup muffin tin or line with paper liners.
c507766d-b0e0-4cc7-8840-38e27c8e1bce Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and spices. Do this for about a minute so that everything is very well blended. Create a well in the center and add pumpkin, almond milk, oil, and molasses. Whisk those things together, then stir the liquid mixture into the flour mixture until everything is blended.
c507766d-b0e0-4cc7-8840-38e27c8e1bce Fill muffin cups two-thirds full and bake for 18 to 20 minutes, until a toothpick or knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
c507766d-b0e0-4cc7-8840-38e27c8e1bce For the blueberry variation, add fresh blueberries to individual muffins as you pile the batter into the cups. For chocolate chip, add chocolate chips to batter or to individual muffins cups.
05cf2716-f403-4d69-84e6-23d171de5814 With an electric mixer,beat the softened vegan butter, shortening, both sugars and vanilla until creamy. Beat in the aquafaba.
05cf2716-f403-4d69-84e6-23d171de5814 In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder and cream of tartar.
05cf2716-f403-4d69-84e6-23d171de5814 Add flour mixture to batter and stir until very well mixed, then stir in the chocolate chips and about half of the Oreos (if using).
05cf2716-f403-4d69-84e6-23d171de5814 Using a cookie scoop, shape dough into 24 balls. Cover and chill for an hour or until ready to use (if you can wait a day, the cookies bake up even nicer with dough that's been chilled 24 hours).
05cf2716-f403-4d69-84e6-23d171de5814 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Arrange cookie dough pieces on a parchment or foil lined baking sheet spacing about 3 inches apart. Bake 10-12 minutes (these are better underbaked than over!) or until golden brown around the edges.
05cf2716-f403-4d69-84e6-23d171de5814 As soon as the cookies come out of the oven, set reserved Oreo pieces on hot cookie, crème side down to they will adhere. If the cookies have spread during baking, gently push edges inward with inverted tip of a spatula.
05cf2716-f403-4d69-84e6-23d171de5814 Let cool until firm enough to remove from baking sheet.
c3b84dda-357a-44cf-a2b0-7da7804496fc Line an 8 inch square pan with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
c3b84dda-357a-44cf-a2b0-7da7804496fc In a food processor or high powered blender, grind the almonds and coconut. Add the cashews and process briefly, then add the dates, hemp seeds, vanilla, water and salt. Process until dates are broken down.
c3b84dda-357a-44cf-a2b0-7da7804496fc Transfer to a bowl and fold in the chocolate chunks. Press dough into the pan and chill for 4 hours.
c3b84dda-357a-44cf-a2b0-7da7804496fc Lift from pan and cut into 16 to 20 bars.
fc4c664e-326a-4c01-9255-2f45518e2c63 Weigh out your flour(s), then whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
fc4c664e-326a-4c01-9255-2f45518e2c63 In a mixing bowl, whisk the sugars briskly with the oil and water until smooth and incorporated, then whisk in the vanilla.
fc4c664e-326a-4c01-9255-2f45518e2c63 Add the flour mixture to the sugar mixture, and then stir with a wooden spoon or a rubber spatula until just combined and no flour is visible. Do not overmix.
fc4c664e-326a-4c01-9255-2f45518e2c63 Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts. Divide dough into 18 portions, arrange on foil or parchment lined plates, then cover rightly and chill for 12 to 24 hours.
fc4c664e-326a-4c01-9255-2f45518e2c63 Preheat the oven to 350° F. Line two rimmed sheet pans with parchment paper.
fc4c664e-326a-4c01-9255-2f45518e2c63 Sprinkle the balls of dough with coarse-grained sea salt and bake for 12 to 13 minutes, or until the edges are just golden. For smaller cookies, divide each chilled dough ball in half so that you have about 36 cookies and cut the baking time to about 10 minutes. Do not overbake.
fc4c664e-326a-4c01-9255-2f45518e2c63 Let the cookies cool completely before serving.
d6b54cf5-f026-4776-82a8-3adf3b410fb2 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
d6b54cf5-f026-4776-82a8-3adf3b410fb2 In a mixing bowl, stir together gluten free flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and salt.
d6b54cf5-f026-4776-82a8-3adf3b410fb2 In a second bowl, mix brown sugar, shortening, molasses and vanilla.
d6b54cf5-f026-4776-82a8-3adf3b410fb2 Add flour mixture to brown sugar mixture and stir until mixed. Add 1 tablespoon of applesauce. If dough is dry, add a second. Otherwise, just use 1.
d6b54cf5-f026-4776-82a8-3adf3b410fb2 Divide the dough into 12 pieces and roll each piece into a ball.
d6b54cf5-f026-4776-82a8-3adf3b410fb2 Place the balls about 2 ½ inches apart on parchment lined baking sheets and press tops down slightly.
d6b54cf5-f026-4776-82a8-3adf3b410fb2 Sprinkle tops with sparkly sugar. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool for 2 minute on sheet, then transfer to wire rack to cool.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Put the banana in a mixing bowl and beat it until it is completely mashed. Add the sugar and beat until smooth, then beat in the coconut oil and vanilla.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Mix the flour, baking soda and salt together in a bowl.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Add flour mixture to banana mixture and stir until blended, then stir in oats and nuts.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Chill the dough for about an hour or until it is easy to scoop and you can shape it into balls.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Spoon up tablespoons of dough and shape into balls.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Arrange 2 inches apart on baking sheets, press balls down slightly, and bake for about 10 minutes or until cookies appear set.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Remove from baking sheet and let cool completely. Transfer to the freezer and let the cookies get very cold.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Microwave the chocolate chips on high, stirring every 30 seconds. If you'd like a softer, shinier, chocolate, coat them in a small bit of coconut oil before melting.
bda36252-c52a-4a9d-91aa-902e1e0bf6c8 Drizzle the melted chips over the cookies, then put on a parchment lined plate and freeze until chocolate is set.
a417bcd5-7e05-46f7-83aa-f898a70181e7 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
a417bcd5-7e05-46f7-83aa-f898a70181e7 Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, espresso powder, cornstarch, baking soda and salt together in a bowl and set aside.
a417bcd5-7e05-46f7-83aa-f898a70181e7 In a mixing bowl. stir together date paste, almond milk and both sugars until blended. Add the oil and vanilla and stir until smooth.
a417bcd5-7e05-46f7-83aa-f898a70181e7 Add the flour mixture to the oil mixture and stir to form a soft dough. Stir in the chocolate chips.
a417bcd5-7e05-46f7-83aa-f898a70181e7 Drop the dough by tablespoons onto a baking sheet. Gently shape the dough into little balls and press down slightly -- dough should be soft, but not at all runny.
a417bcd5-7e05-46f7-83aa-f898a70181e7 Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool on baking sheet for 3 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
19c33733-aa9b-4971-b799-a403deef8621 Whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and sugar. Set aside.
19c33733-aa9b-4971-b799-a403deef8621 In a mixing bowl using an electric mixer, beat the butter until creamy. Beat in the vanilla, date paste and coconut milk until smooth.
19c33733-aa9b-4971-b799-a403deef8621 Combine the date mixture and flour mixture and stir until blended, then stir in chocolate chips.
19c33733-aa9b-4971-b799-a403deef8621 Using a large cookie scoop, scoop up 8 rounds of dough (they should weigh around 2 oz each). Arrange on a parchment lined baking sheet.
19c33733-aa9b-4971-b799-a403deef8621 Bake at 325 for about 15 minutes. Let cool slightly on baking sheet, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. These cookies are better when completely cool.
19c33733-aa9b-4971-b799-a403deef8621 For thicker cookies, chill the dough balls overnight before baking.
ca71761d-64e2-4ed0-8da9-ae6ba4cc1672 Preheat the oven to 375degrees F. and line a couple of baking sheets with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
ca71761d-64e2-4ed0-8da9-ae6ba4cc1672 Mix the flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl and set aside.
ca71761d-64e2-4ed0-8da9-ae6ba4cc1672 In a mixing bowl, combine the softened peanut butter, maple syrup and vanilla. Stir well, then add the flour mixture and stir until blended. Stir in the chocolate chips.
ca71761d-64e2-4ed0-8da9-ae6ba4cc1672 Using about 2 tablespoons per cookie, drop mounds of dough onto baking sheets. Flatten slightly and bake at 375 for about 12 to 15 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned and appear set. Let cool completely.
a0996fb0-c388-43af-9562-2a85d15abe58 Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C, or gas mark 5).
a0996fb0-c388-43af-9562-2a85d15abe58 Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.
a0996fb0-c388-43af-9562-2a85d15abe58 In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, combine the nut butter, oil, sugars, milk, and vanilla.
a0996fb0-c388-43af-9562-2a85d15abe58 In a large bowl, combine the flour, oats, baking powder, salt,pecans, and cherries.
a0996fb0-c388-43af-9562-2a85d15abe58 Add the dry ingredients to the wet and mix to combine. Add extra milk, 1 tablespoon (15 ml) at a time, if the cookie dough is too dry and crumbly. It needs to be moist enough to hold together easily when pinched, without being too wet. Pack a 1⁄4-cup measure with dough (approximately 90 g per cookie, weight will vary with add-ins), place the dough on the sheet, and flatten slightly, because the cookies won’t spread much while baking. Repeat with the remaining dough, placing 7 cookies on each sheet.
a0996fb0-c388-43af-9562-2a85d15abe58 Bake for 14 minutes, or until the cookies are golden brown around the edges. Leave the cookies on the baking sheet for minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool. Let cool completely before storing in an airtight container, at room temperature or in the refrigerator.
960f8c8d-623b-4014-8ccd-ad26eafa8df1 Heat the oven to 300 degrees F.
960f8c8d-623b-4014-8ccd-ad26eafa8df1 In a stand mixer, with the paddle attachment, mix the dry ingredients together. Add the liquid ingredients and paddle until well combined.
960f8c8d-623b-4014-8ccd-ad26eafa8df1 Scoop cookies firmly with an ice cream scoop onto a parchment-lined sheet pan. Flatten each mound of cookie dough fully with the palm of your hand.
960f8c8d-623b-4014-8ccd-ad26eafa8df1 Bake cookies for 8 minutes, or until golden brown. Store in an airtight container or eat right away!
715aff16-852f-4be9-b09f-4b71be2a68d2 Preheat oven to 350ºF. Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper muffin cups or just grease and dust with cocoa.
715aff16-852f-4be9-b09f-4b71be2a68d2 In a large mixing bowl bowl, stir together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
715aff16-852f-4be9-b09f-4b71be2a68d2 Puree avocado in food processor until smooth. Add maple syrup, milk, oil and vanilla, and process until creamy. Stir the avocado mixture into the flour mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips.
715aff16-852f-4be9-b09f-4b71be2a68d2 Divide batter evenly between the muffin cups and bake on center rack for 25 minutes.
35f6421f-c35a-4a4d-a5be-d64f593c6d65 Whisk the sugar, cornstarch, cocoa and salt in a medium (2 quart) nonstick saucepan.
35f6421f-c35a-4a4d-a5be-d64f593c6d65 Slowly whisk in the almond milk. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat, whisking constantly.
35f6421f-c35a-4a4d-a5be-d64f593c6d65 Reduce heat to low and simmer, whisking occasionally, until mixture thickens. It usually takes about 3 minutes, but I continue whisking for a total of 4.
35f6421f-c35a-4a4d-a5be-d64f593c6d65 Set a sieve over a bowl and drain pudding into the bowl to ensure that there aren’t any lumps. Stir in the extracts and the butter. Pour into 2 serving bowls. Cover exposed area with a small sheet of waxed paper or parchment or plastic wrap, then cool slightly and chill until cold.
35f6421f-c35a-4a4d-a5be-d64f593c6d65 Serve with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
47a09790-66d4-4fc8-9cf7-80ba7119480a Drain the applesauce if you haven’t already. To do that, just spread ½ cup on a stack of paper towels and let the towels soak up the extra moisture. Set aside.
47a09790-66d4-4fc8-9cf7-80ba7119480a In a mixing bowl, beat the Earth Balance until creamy. Beat in the sugar, brown sugar and vanilla, then beat in the applesauce.
47a09790-66d4-4fc8-9cf7-80ba7119480a Mix the flour, baking soda and salt together in a separate bowl, then add to the batter and stir until mixed. Stir in the oats and chocolate chips. Chill the dough until it's easy enough to handle, then divide it into 6 parts and wrap each part around an Oreo.
47a09790-66d4-4fc8-9cf7-80ba7119480a Spray 6 paper muffin cups with cooking spray or use the foil type and skip the spray. Put the dough wrapped cookies in cups, set the cups in a muffin tin and bake at 350 for 17-20 minutes or until cookies appear set and the edges are nicely browned. Let cool completely. I actually like cooling and chilling briefly before removing the muffin paper.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb Drain the applesauce to make 1/4 cup as indicated in the directions. To do this, just spread a half cup of applesauce in a 6 inch circle on top of a stack of paper towels. Let it sit for about 10 minutes, then scrape up 1/4 cup or 56 grams.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb Beat the buttery spread and both sugars together until mixed. Batter will be a little lumpy, but that’s okay. Beat in the vanilla and drained applesauce.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb Mix the flour, baking soda and salt and stir flour mixture into batter. Stir in the oats, followed by the chocolate chunks.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb Chill the dough for about an hour or until it is easier to handle, then shape it into 6 large balls.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb Arrange the dough balls on the lined baking sheet spacing 3 inches apart. Press tops down slightly and bake for about 15 to 18 minutes or until cookies appear set.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb Let cookies cool for about 10 minutes on the baking sheet, then carefully transfer to a wire rack to cool some more.
bb40d951-ed40-42c6-a56e-52093ef12ddb If desired, chill cookies briefly to set the chocolate. Bring back to room temperature and serve. You can skip all of the chilling if you want the chocolate to be melt-y and soft.
7497ac35-5d24-4159-9e7b-6337cd9add5a Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
7497ac35-5d24-4159-9e7b-6337cd9add5a In a medium size bowl, thoroughly stir together the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and sugar.
7497ac35-5d24-4159-9e7b-6337cd9add5a In a mixing bowl, stir together maple syrup, coconut oil and vanilla extract.
7497ac35-5d24-4159-9e7b-6337cd9add5a Add the flour mixture to the oil mixture and stir until combined. Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.
7497ac35-5d24-4159-9e7b-6337cd9add5a Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 11 minutes.
2fdc7e46-9e69-4334-907a-1a76d7db93db Mix the oil, coffee, molasses and sugar together in a large mixing bowl. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger and cayenne. Stir well. Stir in the cranberries and candied ginger to form a soft dough.
2fdc7e46-9e69-4334-907a-1a76d7db93db Chill the dough for 30 minutes.
2fdc7e46-9e69-4334-907a-1a76d7db93db Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
2fdc7e46-9e69-4334-907a-1a76d7db93db After dough is chilled lightly moisten hands and divide dough in half. Make it into two logs about 13 inches long and 3 1/2 inches wide. Sprinkle the tops with sugar.
2fdc7e46-9e69-4334-907a-1a76d7db93db Bake 24 to 26 minutes till edges are lightly browned and the logs feel firm. Cool for 15 minutes (I didn’t). Cut the logs into approximately 2 inch slices (or however you like them). Cool on wire racks.
2fdc7e46-9e69-4334-907a-1a76d7db93db Makes 16 large cookies
f6175bec-e36b-4ce0-814f-b6daab504567 Preheat oven to 350 F. Rub a loaf pan with oil and line with a rectangle of parchment. Alternatively, you can use 3 small (3x5 inch) loaf pans.
f6175bec-e36b-4ce0-814f-b6daab504567 Mix together the soy milk and vinegar; set aside for about 2 minutes.
f6175bec-e36b-4ce0-814f-b6daab504567 Stir together flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.
f6175bec-e36b-4ce0-814f-b6daab504567 Beat together the oil, brown sugar and granulated sugar, then beat in the bananas. Continue beating on high until very light. Reduce speed to low and add milk/vinegar mixture.
f6175bec-e36b-4ce0-814f-b6daab504567 By hand, stir the flour mixture into the banana mixture, being careful not to overbeat. I like stirring flour mixture in with a heavy duty scraper. Sprinkle some nuts on top if using.
f6175bec-e36b-4ce0-814f-b6daab504567 Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool on a rack for about 15 minutes then flip from pan. Makes 1 awesome loaf.
f6175bec-e36b-4ce0-814f-b6daab504567 If using small loaf pan, check at 35 minutes.
a83ad37e-fc1d-465c-a801-a8cdebb17e19 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 8 muffin cups or line with paper liners.
a83ad37e-fc1d-465c-a801-a8cdebb17e19 Whisk the flour, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder and salt together in a bowl.
a83ad37e-fc1d-465c-a801-a8cdebb17e19 Whisk the maple syrup, milk, vanilla and oil together in a second bowl.
a83ad37e-fc1d-465c-a801-a8cdebb17e19 Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until mixed. Stir in the chocolate chips. Divide evenly among muffin cups and bake on center rack for 18-20 minutes.
a83ad37e-fc1d-465c-a801-a8cdebb17e19 Cool completely on a wire rack.
ac475e9d-6199-44ea-a209-df9a7a52bc20 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two cookie sheets with Silpats.
ac475e9d-6199-44ea-a209-df9a7a52bc20 Mix together the flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Set aside.
ac475e9d-6199-44ea-a209-df9a7a52bc20 Mix both sugars, maple syrup, apple sauce, oil and vanilla together in a medium bowl. Add the flour mixture and stir until blended. Stir in the oats, followed by raisins.
ac475e9d-6199-44ea-a209-df9a7a52bc20 Let sit for 10 minutes.
ac475e9d-6199-44ea-a209-df9a7a52bc20 Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto the cookie sheets. Bake for 12-14 minutes. Let cool for about 5-8 minutes on cookie sheets then carefully scoop up onto a wire rack.
8c70855e-86d8-4aeb-b849-2b764466024d Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 inch square pan with non-stick foil or parchment.
8c70855e-86d8-4aeb-b849-2b764466024d Mix together flour, salt and baking soda.
8c70855e-86d8-4aeb-b849-2b764466024d In a mixing bowl, beat together butter and brown sugar. Beat in egg (or flax), bananas and vanilla.
8c70855e-86d8-4aeb-b849-2b764466024d Add flour mixture to banana mixture and stir until absorbed, then stir in oats, chocolate chips and walnuts. Spread batter in the pan and bake for 25 minutes or until set. Set pan on a rack to cool, then lift from pan and cut into 16 squares or 12 bars.
539d8561-3819-40da-b350-7a50b99226e8 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
539d8561-3819-40da-b350-7a50b99226e8 Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper or a Silpat.
539d8561-3819-40da-b350-7a50b99226e8 In a large mixing bowl, stir together ground flax seeds and water and let stand while mixing other ingredients.
539d8561-3819-40da-b350-7a50b99226e8 In a food processor, process sugar and oats until mixture is fine. Add flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt and pulse to mix.
539d8561-3819-40da-b350-7a50b99226e8 To bowl with flax mixture, add the oil, maple syrup, vanilla and water. Mix until well blended, then add flour mixture and stir together to make a thick dough; try not to over-handle it. Add chocolate chips and nuts.
539d8561-3819-40da-b350-7a50b99226e8 Using about ¼ cup measure, scoop up dough and shape into a balls. Press the balls into large rounds 2 inches wide by about 3/4 inch tall. Place about 2 1/2 inches apart on cookie sheet and bake for 12 minutes. Cookies should look set, but should appear a bit soft and underbaked. Let them sit on the cookie sheet for 5 minute, then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.
539d8561-3819-40da-b350-7a50b99226e8 Makes 16 big cookies
760c00ed-2296-420f-9eba-0a36cd832ca3 Preheat oven to 325 degrees F or 165 degrees C.
760c00ed-2296-420f-9eba-0a36cd832ca3 In a mixing bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and salt.
760c00ed-2296-420f-9eba-0a36cd832ca3 In a second bowl, mix brown sugar, vegetable oil, molasses, vanilla and apple sauce.
760c00ed-2296-420f-9eba-0a36cd832ca3 Add flour mixture to brown sugar mixture and stir until mixed. Using a tablespoon measure, scoop up dough and form nice mounds. Place the mounds about 2 ½ inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet (Silpat is okay) and sprinkle tops with sparkly sugar. Bake for 13-16 minutes. Let cool for 2 minute on sheet, then transfer to wire rack to cool.
760c00ed-2296-420f-9eba-0a36cd832ca3 Makes about 14 cookies
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8 inch pan with coconut oil (or any other vegan fat you like) and line with parchment paper. If desired, grease the parchment with a little more coconut oil and sprinkle some sea salt across the bottom. This gives an extra bite of salt in each bite of brownie.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f In a mixing bowl, mix the boiling water, unsweetened chocolate and cocoa powder and stir until smooth. Let cool slightly.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Add both sugars, oil and vanilla and stir until smooth.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Mix together the flour, baking powder and salt, then stir into the batter. Make sure the batter is not so hot that it will melt the chips, then stir in the chocolate chips. Give the batter 40 or so good strokes with a heavy duty scraper.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Spread mixture in the pan. If desired, spread nuts over the top. and bake on center rack for 25-30 minutes or until brownies appear set (the middle should puff up slightly and will lose its glossiness). Let cool completely and chill. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8 inch pan with coconut oil (or any other vegan fat you like) and line with parchment paper. If desired, grease the parchment with a little more coconut oil and sprinkle some sea salt across the bottom. This gives an extra bite of salt in each bite of brownie.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f In a mixing bowl, mix the boiling water, unsweetened chocolate and cocoa powder and stir until smooth. Let cool slightly.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Add both sugars, oil and vanilla and stir until smooth.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Mix together the flour, baking powder and salt, then stir into the batter. Make sure the batter is not so hot that it will melt the chips, then stir in the chocolate chips. Give the batter 40 or so good strokes with a heavy duty scraper.
34e42825-fdbc-46c9-8cb9-09455888e02f Spread mixture in the pan. If desired, spread nuts over the top. and bake on center rack for 25-30 minutes or until brownies appear set (the middle should puff up slightly and will lose its glossiness). Let cool completely and chill. Lift from pan and cut into squares.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Stir together flour, baking powder and soda. Add sugar and salt and stir again.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a In a separate bowl, combine syrup, molasses, vanilla and oil.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Make a funnel in the flour mixture and pour liquid into it. Stir to combine.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Add chips and nuts and nuts, being careful not to overmix.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Drop by large spoonfuls onto parchment lined baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or just-set. Don't over bake.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Remove from oven and place cookies on cooling rack.
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Serves: 8-12
a51bae48-d29c-438e-bf83-b72f7cfc466a Note: These last a long time and taste great chilled.
db621d7b-5c42-4e7b-8d3a-72ae1fac1801 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8 inch square baking pan.
db621d7b-5c42-4e7b-8d3a-72ae1fac1801 Mix all dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Make 3 wells, add vanilla to one, vinegar to one and oil to one...pour the warm water over all, stir only until combined.
db621d7b-5c42-4e7b-8d3a-72ae1fac1801 Pour into pan and bake for 30 minutes or until done. Let cool completely, then prepare frosting.
db621d7b-5c42-4e7b-8d3a-72ae1fac1801 In a mixing bowl, beat together vegan margarine and vegan cream cheese. Beat in butter extract and vanilla. Stir in sugar. Beat until fluffy. Spread over cooled cake.
